author: {'steamid': '76561198093239492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1704178362}
review:
Harvest Moon: Light of Hope, feito pela Natsume após a saída da Marvelous e a compra da mesma pela XSEED, qual mudou o nome para Story of Seasons devido a Copyright, tenta manter o padrão da série que foi estabelecida pela Marvelous. 
Nesse jogo, a Deusa da Colheita desapareceu e uma ilha sofreu um terrivel desastre. Caindo de Paraquedas nessa ilha, voçê não têm outra escolha a não ser consertar o que foi danificado na ilha, e fazer com que os moradores voltem a morar na ilha de novo, como tbm trazer a Deusa da colheita de volta, e assim garantir a prosperidade na ilha.
O jogo traz um sistema simples, assim como os anteriores e algumas novidades e formas mais criativas de ganhar dinheiro para sobreviver.
Se você gosta de Harvest Moon e Story of Seasons, esse jogo é uma boa pedida.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014690869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1705006821}
review:
Das ist das schlechteste Harvest Moon, das ich je gespielt habe. Ich bin froh, dass ich es stark reduziert im Sale erworben habe, sonst hätte ich mich sehr geärgert. 
Die Grafik ist wirklich schlecht und nicht mehr zeitgemäß, die Animationen sind grausig. Das Mining bringt viel zu viel Geld, was einen dazu bewegt, sich zu fragen, warum man überhaupt was anbauen sollte. Die Charaktere laufen gar nicht rum und es gibt allgemein zu wenige... das Dorf lebt einfach nicht. Die Zauberer habe ich noch nie in ihrem Haus angetroffen, um ihre Dienste in Anspruch zu nehmen. Am Anfang nerven mich die ganzen Sequenzen tierisch! Und wenn mal eine ist, ist sofort der ganze Tag vorbei. Die meisten Gebäude sind schnell wieder hergerichtet, es fehlt die Motivation weiter zu spielen. Ich bin mittlerweile im Sommer und habe gar keinen Kalender... gibt es Events?
Ich kann die vielen guten Bewertungen nicht verstehen... ganz klar:

KEINE KAUFEMPFEHLUNG!

review: This game has some really positive points and most of the negative ones could be forgiven.  However, the inventory management in this game was bad from the start and becomes a painful chore about midway through the game.   I found more than half of my time playing was doing various forms of inventory management which wouldn't have been the case if just the simplest QOL changes had been made.  Normally, I am a completionist for this type of game, but I am going to throw in the towel on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041201321', 'num_games_owned': 1250, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1694904203}
review:
Not a terrible first attempt, but I still got bored before I could beat it. 

Essentially Natsume needed to get a new team for this series, and this was the first game by that team. It's okay! Rebuilding an island is fun. I really enjoy there being a main story to follow, unlike a lot of farming sims!

Dislikes:
 - Controls. Feels like a mobile game that was never on mobile.
 - Some events in the game randomly end your day.
 - This writing is weak!
 - The merchant is in different spots everyday ugh
 - Unlocks are slow
 - Unlock requirements can be nonsensical (flowers that only grow during certain seasons for tool upgrades? Are you kidding me?)
 - Certain abilities get unlocked by arbitrary events. (Repair an expensive house, get a fishing rod. what.)
 - Mining takes forever.
 - Annoying as heck low stamina sound

It's okay tho, Doc makes everything better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1685160563}
review:
"Harvest Moon: Light of Hope Special Edition" is a mobile app that's been dumped on Steam as if it was a real PC game (it's not)... it's a cash grab from greedy mobile devs.  The game is a rehash of an older console game which may go some way to explaining (but not excusing) the huge list of technical defects.

If you take this mobile app as a serious PC game (which it's not), it's a basic StarDew Valley like farming/adventure/business sim game where you run around a cartoony/anime styled Final Fantasy esque farm and plant and sell cabbages etc through monotonous repetition of basic tasks.  Is this fun?  Of course not.  There's also a crappy, badly written family friendly story that's mostly just a wrapper to get you into the monotonous seed planting/garden watering.  At least the graphics look slightly better than Stardew Valley?  Which is a lot like saying one midget is slightly taller than another.

From a technical perspective, as a mobile app, this doesn't meet basic minimum requirements that most PC gamers expect as standard.

The artwork here is terrible, it's somewhere between old retro pixel "art" and early 32 bit console graphics, used as a substitute for contemporary PC graphics.  It seems the developer really didn't know what they were doing, couldn't manage to do contemporary graphics, but didn't want to go retro, so they just sort of lifted the old console graphics and dumped them into the mobile app.  It's unclear if this is due to lack of budget to arrange someone who can do graphics properly, or lack of talent, regardless, the overall visual quality of the game is extremely low as a result of these decisions.

Bewilderingly, the mobile app doesn't include proper audio controls, so you can't turn off the annoying background music, you'll need to alt+tab out and stop the music using the Windows sound mixer.  This is obviously not okay and it's unclear why the developers chose not to include this basic feature.

There's no options to change the resolution for the mobile app or customise the graphics settings.  There's no way for gamers to ensure this mobile app is running at the native resolution of their displays... there's no guarantee this mobile app will look right on any PC as a result of this hamfisted design decision.  There's no way for gamers to try improve the low quality mobile phone graphics.  Some of this is due to the mobile app heritage of the game and some of it just seems to be because the developer couldn't be bothered updating the graphics they took from console and dumped into the app stores.  Case in point, some of the intersituals are 4:3 pillarboxed aspect ratio... that's just sloppy, but that laziness demonstrates clearly the disdain the developer here holds towards PC gamers.

The controls can't be customised, which will be an annoyance for many, but it can also render the mobile app unplayable for differently-abled gamers.  PC gamers will be insulted by the presence of console peasant children's toy controller prompts, despite this being on PC.  Developers should try to be aware which platform they're developing for.

Because this is a mobile app, it carries a number of deliberate design deficiencies.  Compromises were made to cater to the iPhones that the mobile app was designed for.  These are unfortunate handicaps and limitations that PC gamers shouldn't be forced to accept, but it's evident that PC was an afterthought for the iPhone developers who are to blame for this.  The mobile app is deficient as a result of these choices, and would have been so much better without the handicaps that designing games for mobile phones forces upon a game.  Once more, mobile devs have made gaming worse for everyone.  I didn't spend thousands on building a gaming rig just so I could pretend it's an iPhone.

These technical defects push this mobile app below acceptable standards for any modern PC game.

Once more we see greedy mobile devs trying to scam PC gamers. On Steam, this mobile app garbage carries the eye watering price of $20 USD, on app stores, it's still overpriced at $15 USD (ouch). Mobile devs must learn PC gamers are not here to be gouged, and can't be expected to pay FIVE BUCKS MORE for a cheap mobile app just because it's been lazily dumped on Steam.  The developers here genuinely are trying to mislead gamers into thinking this has parity with cheaper AAA games like Red Dead Redemption 2, Monster Hunter Rise, Euro Truck Sim 2, Horizon Zero Dawn... the list goes on.  And in what level of hell do these mobile app developers think mobile apps on PC are worth $20???!?!

This is unacceptable disrespect for PC gamers.  Because this is a mobile app, is priced to insult and gouge PC gamers, and because of the other defects, it's impossible to recommend.  Just who do they think we are?

author: {'steamid': '76561198255628553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4852, 'last_played': 1682574762}
review:
O Jogo é muito gostosinho e relaxante de jogar
Embora poderia ser melhor em vários aspectos

Vc não tem uma liberdade tão grande para construir coisas como outros jogos do tipo
O Sistema do Soleil é muito bom e ajuda muito na fazenda. É uma pena q não dê pra afzer isso com o parceiro romântico por exemplo kkkkkk Ele só fica lá de enfeite depois q se casa, mas Ok
Mas é ruim que não da pra automatizar certas coisas como aguar as plantas
Tmbm achei os eventos anuais muito fracos
A História principal é muito simples, mas bem divertida e os personagens são legais
Não é um jogo muito dificil, embora seja relativamente demorado conseguir dinheiro
O melor sistema de pescaria haha 

Eu acho q é um jogo muito bom pra quem gosta do estilo farming game

author: {'steamid': '76561198121864665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 2208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2208, 'last_played': 1682018509}
review:
Honestly, I had fun playing it. It's more simple than other farming sims, but the simplicity can be fun if you're in the mood for that type of gameplay.
The main thing that kept me playing are the characters: they're charming in a silly kind of way to me. (Your mileage may wary though.)

Ps. While I enjoyed the game, I do suggest buying it on sale, rather than at full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007888370', 'num_games_owned': 612, 'num_reviews': 571, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1587, 'last_played': 1677459407}
review:
This is Harvest Moon for Mom’s

When I first bought this for my lady and I, I had a light of hope that it would be good…

…and I was pleasantly surprised.

Now sure, at first impression it looks like a mobile game without the pay to win features and it kind of makes Farmville look amazing in comparison, yet I still find it a good game, and it only gets better once you beat the main storyline.

It isnt what the old games were, but I've sunk 20+ hours into it according to my profile and I like it more and more as I progress. I feel engaged in my day-to-day farming life (and it takes up my day!) like I haven’t since A New Beginning. The Story of Seasons games haven’t been doing it for me and I feel the series has gotten a little too far away from the farming aspect I fell in love with all the way back on the SNES.

Graphically, the juxtaposition between character models and backgrounds is pretty bad. The models themselves are fine and fairly expressive during skits and I find the whole thing looks a lot better zoomed all the way out.

There are crop variations and mutations to suss out for even MORE profits which really provides a lot of fiddling around and experimentation for those like me who enjoy that sort of thing. There are guides for those who don’t.

I actually had a hard time choosing a marriage candidate this time around(!) which I haven’t had a hard time choosing in years. Usually I choose to live my life out in voluntary celibacy because all of the choices are awful. I was essentially a hermit in A New Beginning because I hated the marriage candidates so much.

I could continue but in short, check it out for yourself. There are a lot of people frolicking through the reviews with a vendetta against Natsume for trying to do the series honor. Their budget is a lot smaller than Marvelous’s and I think they made a solid attempt with Light of Hope and got pretty darn close. 

So far my only gripe is that there could have been more development between villagers. I’m almost through my first summer and they are... fairly repetitive.

Also, you can’t marry Sam because, like, he’s got a wife but, like, I haven’t seen her nor do I think he’s even called her by her name so I don’t see why I can’t be his second family. I’m championing for a DLC. Homewrecking on the Homestead. I’d give them ten bucks easy for that sort of story telling.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198323516078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 36714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3458, 'last_played': 1693777251}
review:
Once you get the hang of it its pretty consuming. I love this game! I played harvest moon as a kid! this is not exactly the same but its pretty fun! I love the ease of control, the story line is pretty interesting, just takes a little learning or some wiki-fandom to figure some hard parts out that's if you want a smooth reasonably quick game, if not have fun exploring all the options yourself and stumbling across the answers as I am currently doing *which if you ask me is more fun than the quick play. though I will say its not as customizable as I would have liked, like in the original or stardew, (if you want a more customizable version of harvest moon try star dew valley! same awesome fun, game graphics are fantastic as well it is  just more in depth and more choices in game.) 

I really do enjoy this game, just wish it was multiplayer/cross platform multiplayer and had more ability to customize for your individual game play... but its a fantastic game none the less

author: {'steamid': '76561198316371310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 5836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1690288309}
review:
I'm a fan of Harvest Moon and Story of Seasons series so I definitely would be sinking tons of hours into this. 

What I love:
1. This game has charm. This is farming game as I know it. Chill, more focus on farming (mutations, crops rotation, animal husbandry etc). 
2. Decent gameplay, themes and control. I like the fact that we no longer need to select tools. Just stand in front of things (tree, soil, rocks etc) and press action button, and the right tool will be selected.
3. Zero combat. I prefer my chill, farming games with zero combat because I have no chill when it comes to combat. I would prioritize purchasing farming games with zero combat. "Gentle", "kind", "idyllic" are the keywords I focus on when it comes to farming games.

Improvement needed (IMHO):
1. Graphics. I prefer games with beautiful, 3D looking graphics. I dislike simplistic, 2D looking or pixel art. Modern graphics card can do so much more. This game's graphics has a lot of room to improve. 
2. More character customization in the beginning and throughout gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138028741', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1957, 'last_played': 1672267256}
review:
This game is a mess from what Harvest Moon use to be when Marvelous use to make them. It feels so lazy, soulless, and rather ugly to say the least. Ugly in the round models that don't fit in with the 2d background while they are 3d and stiff. Pixel art with 3d is kinda weird mash together and it doesn't work.. Whats more is they have made maybe 3 new characters in the last four games maybe. They are reused characters there is nothing new about this. 

The whole game is meant to be farming and relationship building yet half of everyone isn't even available at times not even in their house, they are just gone. No one even walks to an area but vanishes into place just filling any form of normality to the game. All of the magic users are horrible to even talk to in their homes as all they do is give either pointless information or tell you what to do next so you get no form of seeing who they are outside of the events. Even if you get events they have shallow and uninteresting personalities. And if you can't romance the villager they don't matter. They have less personality than a rock. On top of that when you do have events and you talk who knows what you are saying. Your character talk and you don't get to know what they are saying, you have to guess. 

And then the DLCs, pay money to get to unlock more tools, people to romance, or events. Wowie. Swoon the king of the underworld for 2 dollars and regret life as he is the most unattractive model every made in any harvest moon game. And if he isn't for you marry this gem spirit you watched grow from a literal baby. You watch it learn to talk and express itself while you thirst for it? Its sickening to just thing of, its shown as a baby. Its shown as young and unknowing. And you can marry it because it has an adult form so its okay!

The story can't even make up for the game. Its short, mostly waiting, no reward or meaning, and just sucks. It wasn't fun..

author: {'steamid': '76561198857486670', 'num_games_owned': 817, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1596175753}
review:
What's in a name? 

To the subconscious mind, I see Harvest Moon and still get excited to this day. I can't believe Natsume gets to drag the name of Harvest Moon through the mud like this.
 
This is Harvest Moon stripped of all of its charm, character and just about anything else that made the games up to A New Beginning good. 
Do yourself a favor and buy any of the other farming sims coming out that are better than this. 


Peaceful Days
Orange Season
Story Of Seasons (the real Harvest Moon)
Coral Island
Stardew Valley

author: {'steamid': '76561198108235797', 'num_games_owned': 4082, 'num_reviews': 550, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1670848627}
review:
I like the Harvest Moon series, the Animal Crossing series, Story of Seasons and the games alike.
But i find them to be a bit repetitive and "boring" at some point, this is why i prefer Rune Factory, Stardew Valley, Fantasy Life, My Time At Portia, Graveyard Keeper, etc...
It has dungeons and some action which is a great addition to such games in my opinion.

This Harvest Moon game isn't as good as the other games of the series.
But my main problem is its bugs and some problems the game has.

First launch, game is bugged, i can't refill the watering can, i can't remove plants, game is bugged, had to restart the game, that's a pretty good start (sarcastic huh). 
Second, game is slow paced but this is much more annoying than the other games of the series.
"Objective says get to point A, then get to point B, now go back to point A, go back to point B, now go to point C, go back to B, go to A, now go back to B", you'll be going back and forth lot of times at least at the beginning and it's getting annoying. 
Also, the loading sequences are truly worthless, this game shouldn't even have loading screens. There are bigger games which uses even more ressources and all and do not have loading sequences or are even shorter than the ones in this game... Useless.

Game may be good, that i don't know, but it sure is buggy and slow paced, i wouldn't recommend it, maybe for about 1$ but that's it, visuals aren't that interesting to me and it looks ugly on higher resolutions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198176316493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1996, 'last_played': 1664244247}
review: Not one of the better games in the series, but it has its moments. this game is a beginner-friendly farm sim with simple mechanics, a cute storyline, and new characters. I think fans of HM/SoS should save their money -- the weird character renders, limited landscape design, and bugs make it less fun than a replay of FOMT or another game from the series. that being said, the UI does have some good points, such as auto-selecting appropriate tools based on which task you're doing -- no more accidentally cutting crops when you thought you'd equipped your watering can.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080623907', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2611, 'last_played': 1552345174}
review:
I have been playing the Harvest Moon and subsequent spin-off series' since 2002. LoH represents a stark and unfortunate decline in quality within Harvest Moon games, and solidifies the Story of Seasons series as the definitive Harvest Moon successor. After just under 45 hours with the game, I found the small points of enjoyment were purely based on the basic formula that all games within the farm & befriend genre have, rather than any innovation from this entree in particular. The characters are widely uninteresting and bland, the 'storyline' isn't engaging in the slightest, and the artistic direction seems far more like an imitation than anything original. With the original developers gone, it's no surprise that the quality is so low. 

I rate this game a Turnip/Play Another Game. 

Stardew Valley had mod support. Spend your money on that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198373626575', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5045, 'last_played': 1650309986}
review:
This games feels more like a phone game than a console or PC one. The graphics are simple, the story is too short, the characters are super flat, the game mechanics are lackluster (expect for mutations, which I found cool, but extremely frustrating), and it's plagued by the most absurd amount of loading screens I have ever seen in a modern game. I enjoyed playing it while I was trying to 100%, although in the end I gave up, realizing that it wasn't worth the hours of grind that it would have taken me. 

If you are a farming-sim fan, try it. But for the love of all that is holy, do not play full price. I repeat. DO NOT pay full price. It just isn't worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198801528003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1695, 'last_played': 1710526795}
review: Harvest Moon always was an interesting game because the mechanics are interesting and the graphics were good. This game very much still nails it in those marks but brings some innovations. Especially the RPG linear story format which is new to me. I heard some YouTuber's criticism and it's all based on how the game looks bland and done lazily. But I have to add that the simple sprites are clean and don't demand some aggressive RAM from the computer, in other words, it works fine on low-end computers. Plus the music is very soothing to the ear, differrent from the older versions of Harvest Moon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198220454244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1593352589}

author: {'steamid': '76561198085014011', 'num_games_owned': 1873, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 16910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16910, 'last_played': 1657123423}
review:
[b][i]This is a cute & very relaxing game! (similar to Stardew Valley)[/i][/b]

[b]* Quests:[/b]
Features 1 main quest & a lot of sides - each villager has their own quest series. There are also seasonal repetitive quests after u finish each villager's quest line. Additionally, via bonus Gods' quests u can about double your stamina!

[b]* Activities:[/b]
Farming (tend to your crops & animals), fishing, mining (best source of income!), cooking.

[b]* Upgrades:[/b]
Prioritize buying a horse to move faster. 
When u finish the main quest line, u can teleport to every area on the map without walking.
Upgrade your tools at the Blacksmith. 
Buy bigger home (lvl 2 & 3) from Doc.

[b]* Bonus:[/b]
Home Decor and general decoratives (Doc).
Wardrobe for you and all marriageable characters that changes each season if u purchase it (Melanie).

[b]* Relationships:[/b]
Cultivate friendships, marry your love interest & even have a child.

[b]* Events:[/b]
Enjoy seasonal events such as cooking and fishing contests, dog race & lots of festivals.

[b]* Pets:[/b]
You can buy a pet doggo and via a secret u get a kitten too!

[b][i]PS: Crop mutations are addictive, u will probably get the "pokemon effect"! :p[/i][/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198394836239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1444, 'last_played': 1684091548}
review: This is a beautiful and fun game.  This review is only for those players who played the Stardew Valley with the fishing mod.  I played that game for 500 hours and could only progress thru the game with the fishing mod.  This game  has the same fishing style and I can not progress anymore since I can't catch any fish and there aren't any mods.  Reading the forums, I realize that I am not the only one with this problem. So if you are like me, DON"T buy this game.  It will be waste of your money.  It will only frustrate you.  It is a shame because it has such a great potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344685058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5340, 'last_played': 1698348463}
review:
Im the opposite of an Speedrunner but finished the Storyline the first year at the summerstart - by an lvl 2 hoe and hammer and 500,000G
I took 13h Gameplay, 10h mining, 1h Cutscene, 1h Storyline and 1h others.
Me Idiot tought firstly "Story of Seasons" was the fake one...

author: {'steamid': '76561198201646987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1273, 'last_played': 1642779487}
review:
If I hadn't looked up what was happening with the Harvest Moon/Story of the Seasons title split, I would've been REALLY surprised that the "20th anniv game" of "Harvest Moon", my favorite series growing up, is like this. I had plenty of fun playing it. In my opinion it's a lot more chill than SOTS:FOMT and I really like it for when I don't want to feel crushed under the demands to keep up, but I can't help but notice how unfinished it felt. It was all over the place, the pacing is rather bizarre, and I don't think I've ever played a HM game where I have 80k gold by the start of Year 1 Summer.

There's crop mutations and 4 different types of soil, but somehow it's missing a map where you can see where you planted what, and would need to go to the location to check individual plots for what kind of plant is there. There's a shipping bin, but it feels a bit weird to have it when you can sell to specific shop-owners for higher prices. There's no real way to know tomorrow's weather. The quality of the animal produce is *randomized*, which is just unbelievable. Animal growth rate also feels like forever despite purchasing from store, which in my opinion defeats the purpose; the idea of purchased animal vs birthed one is that of comparing upfront cost with the profit loss from the length of pregnancy as well as waiting for the newborn to grow into an adult. It doesn't matter, there's no point in getting the pregnancy medicine, it's literally more expensive than just buying a calf off Sofia. You get incredibly rich very easily off of mining, which has both a positive and negative: in one hand, you're not as pressured to plant plant plant and water until 2 AM. It's actually really nice if you're looking for a truly chill game. On the other, it does make the farming feel kind of pointless, if what you enjoy is the gradual and careful building of wealth.

Another aspect that I felt was really lacking was... the villagers. There's nothing really interesting about them; personality-wise, maybe there's a trope or two you like, but they hardly have deeper relationships with each other. I rarely feel the need to visit or talk to them to see how they're doing. NPCs are also usually stuck in one place at certain points in the plot, which means for weeks on end while you're trying to get a specific quality milk, they'll be in the same spot every day morning to evening, saying exactly 1 dialogue.

At the same time, I do think there's enough things going for it to be worth getting on sale, or even full price if you're in other countries where the full price is halved. Funnily it's the fact that some of the systems are wonky or lackluster that you end up able to set your own pace. If you're like me and get really stressed out about meeting goals or missing the shop opening windows, this game is an alternative where you can largely ignore all that. Just come in with a different mindset, I think.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995318477', 'num_games_owned': 2584, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 13304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13304, 'last_played': 1641386633}
review:
Let's start with probably the only truly good thing to come from this game, the ability to save anywhere.  This is a fantastic feature that all games of this genre should implement.  Many times you are trying to make sure you get as much done as physically possible in a day.  If something should happen and you need to quit for some reason you often have one of two choices, either quit or try to rush back to bed to save.  This causes you to either lose progress by quitting out or to shorten your day and potentially cause you issues further down the road.  By having the save feature like this game does, it really assists and makes sure you don't lose any progress you were working on.  

Lets move on to the bad now.  Playing this game you need RNJesus to help with anything as almost everything is randomly decided.  There is no clear way to get the desired effect that you require in this game without a good amount of luck or save scumming to acquire it.  

Crops are an absolute mess in this game.  They try to make the crops growable in all seasons which would be a large plus for games of this genre.  However, they ruin this by making obtaining new crops by planting in off seasons for mutations and giving them health bars.  The idea to mutate crops to get new ones would be amazing but it's extremely poorly executed and the information provided to the player is very little at best.  I had to pull a guide to actually find the information and then from there create my own spreadsheet to ensure I done crop mutations in a timely manner.  This still lead to over 200 hours played to complete this.  Even worse is the fact that due to crop health they can die in their proper seasons if you are not taking full care of them or a weather event takes place at poor time for you.  A grown crop loses it's ability to receive water so they will die after a couple of days as there is no way to provide them with what they need to survive. This means you cannot grow grass and let your animals outside to eat it as will die within a couple of days at most.  Even worse is the fact that a majority of crops in this game are useless outside of providing you money.  One example of this is Wheat and one of it's mutations Rye Wheat.  You can use the Wheat to make flour for your bread in cooking, but the Rye Wheat has no use what so ever in the game.  It's not even worth farming them for money either as you can go to the mine and quickly make more money then you'll ever need in the game through that alone.  

Weather is painful to deal with.  There is no way (at least that I have found) to get information about the upcoming weather.  According to the game, you are supposed to be able to talk to Gareth (the Wizard Apprentice) after 6pm at his house and he will tell you the upcoming weather.  Either this does not work or is so heavily weighted in RNG that I have never seen him actually do it as all he provides is useless "hints" to what you can do around the farm, all of which you will already know to do before you can even unlock him as a villager.  Even more aggravating is how the weather works.  Sun and Rain work the same as any other game of this genre.  Thunderstorms & Blizzards are about the same as well with it taking the "no villager interaction" approach. Then you have Fog and Heatstorms.  These 4 weathers are problematic as they greatly harm your crops and if you aren't staying on top of fertilization, they'll die out.  3 of these I can understand why they would affect crop health, but Fog makes no sense.  Never has there been a point in time when a natural fog has rolled through the neighborhood and all the plant life has just died out.  It feels like they were just looking to add something to make it more difficult to keep crops alive.  

Animal friendship makes no sense in this game.  In other games of this genre, your animal drop quality is based on the friendship of your animal.  The higher this is, the better the quality.  In this game the friendship with your animal just gives you the ability to have the random chance to get better quality.  Complete friendship with your cow, well that entitles you to the potential Miracle Milk (5 star) from your cow but your probably going to only get a Ultimate Milk (3 star) as it's so heavily weighted to this.  This wouldn't be an issue until you quickly look at the cooking recipe list and notice that it's so heavily weighted to the use of milk that it feels impossible to complete.  A barn of 15 cows of one type and if your luck isn't perfect it would take legit real life weeks to even come close to half of what you need for the recipe list.  Ultimately there was so many milk requirements that I broke out Cheat Engine just to get the amount I needed to complete the recipes as I didn't want to put another month of real life time into this game for just collecting milk.  

The respawn on trees, rocks, and bushes are ridiculous as well.  I understand that they want you to be able to have enough rock and lumber to do anything with, but when was the last time you saw a tree fully grow in 3 days?  It makes it difficult to have a nice clean farm for any amount of time and will really start to grade on your nerves if you like to keep things tidy like I do.  

Overall, I want to love this game.  I grew up playing the Harvest Moon games and loved them.  However, this isn't one of those as that series is now it's proper "Story of Seasons" title as it was in Japan originally.  This game feels like a poorly rushed knock off of the Story of Seasons games pushed with the old Harvest Moon title to try and get people to play them.  However, outside the save function, nothing great really stands out about this game that makes it any better then others in the genre and but the issues with the game stand out far more then other games in the genre.  I sit on the fence for almost a month debating if this was a recommend game or not and finishing it this morning, I can say that I cannot recommend it due to outstanding issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992030206', 'num_games_owned': 3069, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 4035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4033, 'last_played': 1636105456}
review:
Plays very much like a mobile game and looks a lot like one as well with the chibified models. The overly simple controls actually make certain actions harder, especially for M+KB. Mouse controls in particular are very poor with everything being keyed into the click, it can make doing the action you want difficult. For example, click on a sheep to shear it and end up petting a cow 3 tiles away despite the action icon being on the sheep. Trying to use the charged hoe, you'll need the keyboard for that and if you misclick, you won't be able to use the hoe because you need an available tillable tile to use the charged hoe.

Other issues with mouse controls is trying to quick select an item to use as you may end up moving onto the space instead of using the item.

Note also that most crops can be passed through so there is no need to do any special crop arrangements unlike some farming sims.

The story is kind of questionable in quality as well. Really, the story is just a long tutorial.

Also, make sure you sell your dishes in order. If you sell out of order, the restaurant may sometimes fail to stock the dish. (Normal -> Great -> Ultimate -> Supreme).

Also, for achievements, you'll need to save and sleep then close the game to trigger some achievements. Why? Don't know, but that is how some of the achievements work.

Also be aware that you have a very tight inventory limit until you unlock your storages, but do note that when cooking in your own house, you don't use the storage that is like two tiles away. The ingredients must be in your inventory. Also, you need to have the non-great ingredients for many recipes/turn ins as the great version cannot be used instead. (On the other hand, some recipes/turn ins do allow the great versions). Not that you'll want to use the great versions in most cases, but it is something to note.

While you can grow trees, do note that trees not only block movement, but can also hide obstacles, such as weeds and it can be hard to see these obstacles. This isn't a huge deal with keyboard controls, but mouse controls can be frustrating here, especially since your move and till buttons are the same.

Also, for anyone wondering, there does not appear to be the option for same gender marriage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198807722176', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 2094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1242, 'last_played': 1671221323}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969208810', 'num_games_owned': 4056, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1633781403}
review:
I haven't played a Harvest Moon game since the original team left to make Story of Seasons, so I was weary, but....
I played the whole storyline, which is more than I can say of the other Harvest Moon games I own,

Yes, the game looks terrible and some characters have "Mii faces", but the fact you can finish the storyline in a only a few months of in game time (I beat it in the first summer) is a good thing.

When playing other Harvest Moon games I have all the upgrades before the first year is over and I have nothing to do, get bored and quit the game.

But in this game you can "beat" the game quickly, so I did it.

Making everything use one button makes the game much easier and charging up to fertilize or pick up a bunch of crops at the same time makes the game much easier and I can grow much more crops than in other Harvest Moon games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199073376719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1698924271}

author: {'steamid': '76561198452593505', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1633553825}
review:
Let's be real, this game is a complete and utter hot mess right down to the weird mix of 2D landscapes with 3D characters, the awful hit boxes, terrible animations, and janky interface with Xbox control buttons hard coded onto the screen which is just weird to look at since I'm playing with a keyboard and mouse.

However, with all that said, I can't quit playing the dang game. I am actually having fun. So if you go into it with no expectations or comparisons to other games, you might enjoy it as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045147917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3876, 'last_played': 1672621822}
review:
I won't lie, this Harvest Moon instalment does have it's faults:
The horse is pointless. (Due to the later unlocked map fast travel.)
No instructions on mining.
Found gems and jewels overpower the crop aspect.
Everything is costly. Some items are tougher to obtain. (e.g your own wardrobe!)
Main story short.
Slow walking animation.
Not impressed with the bachelors this time round. Most are rather dull or too dopey. (Taking my chances with the Underworld King. LOL At least he's got some adorable qualities.) 

Regardless I still experienced enjoyment from it. There's some good humour. Character and animal designs are cute. 
Light of Hope may not be the best to some. For me I found it a great introduction to the farming genre. I avoided the Harvest Moon franchise like the plague. (Due to the early, frustrating GBC version way back.) I'm now searching many other game variants (both old/new) and catching up on a lot I sorely missed out on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007186560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1633978017}
review:
When you like games like "Stardew Valley", "My Time at Portia" or "Pumpkin Days" you might also like this one. At least it's the case for me.
This game has its own kind of setting with its Japanese Anime way of people talking to each other, with their emotes and reactions. But I like that. There is some simply but nice story, with some mysteries, the characters are not very deep but adorable enough.
It's not as good as Stardew Valley but probably about the same level as the other two games I would say. At least it's good have me kept hooked for 5 hours so far and probably many more.

I just love such kind of games. You build up your farm, grow some crops, have your live stock, mine some ores, improve your tools, the seasons change and so your crop, you help other characters, help the whole town there, socialize with them, resolve some mysteries, etc.
And I love how these games are so relaxing and still so much fun.

Edit after 20 hours of playing:
This game is still fun and entertaining, but there is one thing that annoys me more and more. This game is not programmed very well in terms of performance. It has very simple graphics that could be from the last century, which is fine for me, but still it is very power consuming. This way it is wasting way more energy than necessary and your notebook gets heaten up for no good reason.
And even more annoying are the loading times when travelling between map parts. This takes about 5 to 10 seconds each, which makes no sense at all. It takes even longer when an event appears.
And it`s definitely not because my computer is too slow or sth.. Core i7 10th Gen, RTX 3060, 16GB RAM, M.2 NVMe SSD.
This dulls the fun a bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094803808', 'num_games_owned': 4070, 'num_reviews': 5384, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1632942539}
review:
Star Ew Valley 3/10
Sad unfinished clone of harvest moon that somehow got an extra chromosome. Worst harvest moon game ive played to date
Cant kite, part of almost EVERY rune factory and harvest moon game
Load times, AND I HAVE AN SSD. WTF are these load times for this trash of a game thats under 1 gb
Only 1 gender for the animals, lazy
map is super tiny, SUPER TINY!!!
you can only buy 1 animal at a time, slow as hell and teleports you back to the barn every time so you need to walk back.
8 hours in and i still cant cut a large trees or smash big rocks
No leveling system, harvest moon games never have them. But ive come to enjoy them in every rune factory
Pay to unlock mobile bullshit feel. You need to build and unlock everything on the map and each time you need a new thing that gets harder and harder to find or grow or catch
They forgot to fill in some of the map background in, just blackness
20$ for this game with almost no depth and they try and charge you more for dlc
my disappointment is immeasurable and my day is ruined

Would love it if rune factory 5 could make it onto steam with mods

review: I dont usually write reviews, but i had to in this case. Harvest Moon was my childhood, and upon discovering the game on steam ( i know, pretty late, but still), i burst into tears. A pleasant feeling of nostalgia went through my body. I remember my cousin playing Harvest Moon series on his Nintendo back in the days. I am very grateful for this game and every other Harvest Moon series released on PC, because this way I can recall the good memories. ♥

author: {'steamid': '76561199195307232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1630637989}
review: I enjoyed this game on the switch and the PS4 so i was looking for something to play and decided to get it on the computer since it has been awhile since i started it.  I definitely like it on the PC, i changed the control settings so i could use my arrow keys otherwise it is a nice relaxing game to play in the evenings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146593964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1211, 'last_played': 1517517110}
review: The whole thing feels very stale. The personalities on the town folk are almost non-existent, the game play is slow, the tasks you have to do feel meaningless, and even farming is boring. It's a slow game and not worth the price. My advice? Play a different farming simulator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198844475978', 'num_games_owned': 107, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1613150318}
review:
I played this game on my nintendo when I was a kid but somehow I am not so much a fan of consoles anymore so I am actually quite glad that it is available for PC now. It is a simple game, there is not much story to it. I would say it is a nice amusement but not the best game ever. If you really are looking for a game like this I guess you should rather play Innocent Life or Stardew Valley. 
6/10

review: If you're looking to relive your childhood because you enjoyed the old HM games, this isn't really a good option. BUT...I do really love this game. I know a lot of people have mixed feelings about Harvest Moon now, but I've been really enjoying this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125598211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1599320736}
review: This game is empty, the interface is poorly designed, and every interaction is superficial. I knew that the original creator had split off to go make Story of Seasons but I thought with a whole team and a bucket of cash the original IP could make something fun. This game is not fun and you will waste your hours trying to power through to the fun part. But there is no fun part. Go get some mods for stardew valley and never buy from this franchise again.

review:
This is like every harvest moon before it. I've played for an hour, just got it, and it's reminiscent of all the Wii based ones. There's a storyline for you to complete, very Mii like character designs, and simple controls. Nothing wrong with any of that. In fact I'm already enjoying it immensely.

Also for the save issue person..... it's the book in the menu, you're welcome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179098471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 24047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19099, 'last_played': 1704505139}
review: I love Harvest Moon, it first begun for me on my Gamecube, when I found out that there was a PC version, I bought it and all DLC. I wasn't disappointed. There's plenty to do, farming, collecting, fishing, mining (always hated the mining part imo). There's so many aspects.. If you complete the storyline there are still achievements to get so the game continues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137322003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2066, 'last_played': 1575694329}
review:
I've been a fan of the Harvest Moon series since back when I was a kid playing A Wonderful Life on the GameCube and after 30+ hours of playing this instalment I can say with absolute certainty that if you're looking for an enjoyable game in the series than this entry is not worth your time. In fact, any entry bearing the Harvest Moon name since Natsume's split with Marvellous back in 2014 can be skipped. 

The Harvest Moon games made since the split are half-assed, hollow attempts at cashing in on the fact that they got to keep the name they gave the series for the English localisation. The 3D graphics make the game feel bland and uninteresting compared to previous 3D entries to the series. The characters don't feel as interesting, and the gameplay doesn't give me much to make me want to return to it every time I shut it off. 

I didn't even get to the point of getting married in the game because after someone accepts your proposal you have to jump through more hoops in the form of quests with frustratingly specific requirements. After several in-game days waiting for one of my animals to produce a specific quality of wool I realised that I was no longer enjoying myself and hadn't been for some time. I shut the game off and felt no desire to return to it.

If you're looking for a good Harvest Moon game either get your hands on an entry from before the split, or pick yourself up one of the entries in the *real* Harvest Moon series, renamed Story of Seasons by Marvellous. They keep the heart of the series that made fans love it to begin with, while adding new and interesting features that keep players coming back.

tl;dr: All HM games after 2014 suck. Play Story of Seasons instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375266183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12069, 'last_played': 1656955831}

author: {'steamid': '76561198806776471', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1617165821}
review:
It has opportunity to be better, but as it is, it's not very good.

Negatives:

1. The storyline is fairly short, can be completed within a day or two. Should probably extend the storyline and make it last throughout at least a year game time. That way it'll take a few days and one could explore more of the world around them and play for more than just the story.

2. There are next to no player choices to make. You get to decide wether you play as a boy or a girl, your birthday, and your name. Oh and your significant other, of which are not many due to the fact that it isn't possible for same sex marriage. We don't get to design our characters or truly choose who we wish to end up with. I understand that programming is a bit of an issue, but one could take the money gained from this and improve the game to make it much more player centered and better overall.

3. The controls, even with a controller, are wonky. It is rather hard to tell just where you are and what all does what when moving your character. As others have said, it's very reminiscent of a moble game.

4. The graphics are fine, but the mash-up between the 3D and 2D pixel art styles does not work. It would be better if the 2D models were a little bigger to make your character and the npcs fit into the world better.

5. It is rather hard to figure out what to do and how to get things even with Edmond. I had to look up how to get a fishing pool because I didn't know how to and the same with a hammer for the mines. I also had to look up how to go about the levels of the mines (go deeper) and how to fish properly. Nothing was explained, except for at the very beginning.

I like the idea of such a mash-up world, but if I had to choose between this and Stardew Valley, I would choose the latter. It's a lot smoother in its gameplay, the player has more control over the smaller things, how to do things is actually explained... I could go on. Personally, it's a waste of money and I bought the bundle pack. If I could remove bought games from my library, this would be one of them. Again, it has potential, but it's definitely not something I will be returning to any time soon for any reason. It's rather boring and I'm just sitting around half the time waiting for people to be available. I would like a refund and I think a demo should be released for this so people can find out if they actually like it before wasting their money on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387509324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 442, 'last_played': 1615854589}
review:
It's pretty fun and kept me busy for a few hours, however I uninstalled it because I hate how they don't let you delete saved games. For a child this game would be fun I am sure, but for me even though it kept me busy the way breeding your animals and saving your game works is pretty dumb. For starters you have to buy some kind of potion to make your animals get pregnant, not sure why just doing the typical buy two animals one of each gender and see what happens wouldn't of worked. 

However, my biggest complaint is simply just how there seems to be absolutely no way to delete saved games other than save a new game over it. That is the stupidest thing about this game.

review:
Harvest Moon inspired so many games over the last 20 years, the most famous one is probably Stardew Valley, wich I like a lot. Stardew Valley had some problems though wich don't exist in Harvest Moon, like the poor combat system and the stupid fishing game.

I love the overall wholesome atmosphere and it's just something so relaxing, even though it's working on a farm. Definitely my favorite Life-Sim series. Especially recommended to people that like Stardew Valley, but hate the combat in that one.

Time to finish the main storyline: 23 hours

author: {'steamid': '76561198215456251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2486, 'last_played': 1665975559}
review:
I've loved playing Harvest Moon ever since I borrowed my friend's copy of the game (which I plaid on my GameBoy). I've plaid it on Gameboy SP, DS, 3DS, Wii, etc. I was so excited when Light of Hope came out on mobile. I plaid and beat it! It was the first Harvest Moon game where I'd got my character married. I felt so accomplished. Then I found out it was on PC via Steam and I HAD to buy it.
I beat the game (another official first for me and Harvest Moon) and now I'm trying to decide who my character should marry.

I had taken a break from the game after beating the main story. But when I came back I was SO EXCITED to discover that new events, characters, and missions had been added to the game. That's not something that happens in disk games.

I strongly recommend this game. It's cute, a bit repetitive at times, but I love it.

P.S. I also love that all the games have the same premise (farm, get married, have a baby) but the overall story and landmass is always different. LOVE LOVE LOVE

review: so far into the game i like it very much, the story line is good the villager are cool and i like how the main character is given task to do by the villagers it helps you build their trust and gain likes. all game has pros and con which i dont like how the character energy runs out too fast. in the beginning you cant do much but waste days because you havn't had much source to keep your energy level up throughout the day. also if anyone is playing i recommend you to not try to go through the story line too fast otherwise you will miss a lot of cut scenes aka event note. i recommend you to upgrade all your tools asap it will help you a lot more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392724289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 7221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4137, 'last_played': 1634766029}
review:
I really love this game. It's very cute without being cutesy most of the time and has an engaging story line. 
The game is very reminiscent of Stardew Valley but with enough differences to be worth owning both.
I absolutely LOVE the farming mechanism, which allows for crops to MUTATE depending on chance, terrain type, and time of year as well as mutation boosting agents. It's a very, very clever addition to a farming simulator and one I've never seen before. I also really love how the seasonal planting works, because unlike many other games, if you plant crops in the wrong season, they DO NOT die immediately. Actually, with enough care, fertilizer, and luck, you can grow any crop in any season. And as annoying as I find it sometimes, crops randomly DO wither and die on you, especially if you aren't taking good care of them, which is aggravating when it happens but also a really nice touch. (My family grows food and our plants do not all suddenly wither at once with the change of season).
The characters are many and varied, with some of them amusingly eccentric and some of the annoyingly so. (I do NOT like most of the Harvest Sprites for this reason). However, outside of the main story, almost none of the characters HAVE to be interacted with, so if you find one more annoying than the rest, you can usually avoid them.
While the resource gathering in the game is very rich and very well thought-out, USING those resources is a lot less intricate. I'm torn on how I feel about this. On one hand, it's annoying that I gather all these resources (wool, various ores, etc) and then don't have much use for most of them, except cooking and repairing buildings. On the other hand, it's actually kind of neat that my character can't do EVERYTHING. He can farm, fish, and chop down trees and break rocks, but he can't also weave his own clothes and set precious stones in jewelry and have an entire wine-making or cheese-making operation going, and while I do sometimes wonder what to do with these resources, it's a lot more of a community-minded game than many others. A lot of other games I've played, your character could do pretty much everything ALL the other characters could do which often led to them being the only ones to do ANYTHING. And this game is very different in that the character actually needs the others to achieve anything. It's a neat mechanic to the game, and one I haven't seen before, as other similar games I've played did have a community of people who had certain skills but then would also teach them to me and give me the ability to do it myself, and there was very little working together. I like how they managed to make a single-player game cooperative without losing features for the player. I'd like it a bit MORE however if my bag could hold more items. While storage is available eventually, I find my bag aggravatingly limiting in quantity when so many item types exist due to 5 quality tiers. 
I also love how any recipes (food or otherwise) you follow tend to require several items but rarely aggravatingly difficult to obtain ones or ones that require several extra processing steps. For example, if I want to make a salad, I may also have to make, say, mayo first, but I don't have to first press vegetables into oil, then make mayo, then find mustard seeds to stone grind my own mustard first. It straddles the line well (usually) between so easy it's pointless and so overly complicated nothing gets made, especially since in many of those games, all of those steps require lots of time waiting for it to be done. While this is NOT realistic, unlike many parts of the game, producing new things does not require time. 
The recipes are also really really well done because for almost all of them, you can sub items. So if it calls for, say, tomato, you can choose different breeds (which you got through mutation, usually) OR sometimes jsut flat out different things. Like it'll call for sardines but you have cod, so you can use cod. Which is just AWESOME because isn't that how we cook in life?
Another excellent feature is how your energy levels the next day change based on how late you went to bed and whether you went to bed or passed out. Instead of losing half the day, you get way more tired way more easily, which... I mean, realistic.

Overall, I'd say this is an absolutely excellent game with some unique gameplay mechanisms that really add value. I definitely recommend it!

review:

If you like hour-long grinding towards another meaningless achievement - get the game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198054579800', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4194, 'last_played': 1603565144}
review: Typical Harvest Moon theme. Graphics are nice, world is nice. Game play is redundant, progression depends on moving through each season, so slowly, yet a seasoned player could complete all needs for an entire season in 5-7 days leaving the rest to repeat over and over simply waiting on the next, long, season. Limitations include a pre-fab map, and pre-fab barn buildings that allow for no customization, no upgrades, nothing once you have unlocked the building. It is a "cute" game, it is fun if you've played previous Harvest Moons and don't mind grinding for little reward. If you want something more user friendly, and rewarding I highly suggest Stardew Valley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263927829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4616, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4329, 'last_played': 1601073626}

author: {'steamid': '76561198016728972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 11353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11353, 'last_played': 1589189527}
review:
I've played several Harvest Moon titles and so far this is the first one I've played that wasn't on a DS, Game Cube, or Wii. I played this game with a controller, not with my keyboard and mouse. The game is decent, I wished there had been a little more to do in the game. The horse is useless in the game and you can't get rid of it if you buy it. 

Getting your hands on various new crops feels laborious since you can only unlock certain ones by completing requests. Trying to make the more rare crops also sucks and doesn't guarantee you will successfully grow to harvest them, even when you throw tons of money into special fert and apply it every day. Also, yes I did apply the seeds on the lands they are suppose to grow in. 

The farming doesn't really feel fun or efficient. It's strange that they gave the player so much in the means to push farming as your main thing, but it's redundant. The game focuses on the player farming in so many different land types and yet it is not necessary. Practically all common or uncommon seeds can be planted next to your house regardless of the lands the seeds require. The only times I had used the other places like swamp and dry areas is when I attempted to make the rarer/harder to proc plants.

There aren't many villager/townsfolk interactions. The whole co-op thing with the crystal/gem fairy doesn't work. Even accidentally activating it will break your game in a sense where you can't get out of controlling the fairy at all. I had to quit the game and reopen it to play it again. Over all it's an alright game that entertains for a while.

I do wish there was a better Co-Op Mode though as me and my best friend Dom Loved playing Stardew together, but this one just doesnt quite have the proper capabilities for a smooth Co-Op play I recommend 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198161072424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1599447326}
review: I've been playing Harvest Moon Games since I was very young. All the way back to the GBA (Gameboy Advance) games and the Harvest Moon game for Nintendo 64. Some Of the game feels like it goes by a little faster than usual, but I definitely love some of the newer aspects of this game, like having to rebuild the town to unlock more shops and possibilities. One of the things I don't care for about this game though is the fact that you have to grow Cosmos and Sunflowers (which you can't even plant until Summer or Fall) as well as mining ores just to upgrade your tools, why should we have to collect flowers just to upgrade our tools? Being forced to have flowers just to upgrade your tools makes zero sense and flowers should have nothing to do with upgrading METAL tools! I do also wish there were other fence options and that (like in previous games) you could try to discover recipes just by putting random ingredients together rather than having to wait to get recipes until you've re-built Bastian's restaurant.

author: {'steamid': '76561199040230578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1595804049}
review: I absolutely loved Harvest Moon on DS, so I bought this and didn't worry about playing it right away because I figured I'd love it and didn't need to worry about returning it. I was so wrong. The graphics are awful, the dialogue is bad and generally I just didn't see how it tied in at all with the other Harvest Moon games. Definitely feels like a cash grab that they put zero effort into, just because of how big Stardew Valley has gotten and the popularity of the original Harvest Moon. I am so disappointed and doubt I'll ever want to play this game all the way through it's just too bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355230415', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2493, 'last_played': 1585979721}
review:
If you want to play a farming simulator, there are many titles that do it much better. The characters are bland, the graphics feel lazy, the 3D characters on a 2D background looks annoyingly weird, you are forced to progress through the story that isn't even that long, and once it's finished, TAH-DAH! You have a lighthouse that works and does ABSOLUTELY NOTHING. 
This is the most bare bones farming sim I've ever played, and I'm really mad, because I kept thinking it would get a little better, since you have to put a little time into a farming sim. Nope. It never gets better, and you lose your opportunity for a refund. 
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. I mean, I feel like such a dimwit for picking this up at all and NOT refunding it right away. But I loved Harvest Moon, and wanted to give it a chance, since it had been one of my favorites as a kid. I recently found out that the games I've known as Harvest Moon were rebranded in the West, they are now Story of Seasons. This has stolen the Harvest Moon name and slapped on the most basic functions of a farming sim, then charges a RIDICULOUSLY high price for it.
Buy a better farming game. ANY other farming game. They're cheaper, better made, and most importantly, a lot more fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093149396', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1517876856}
review: I have played every harvest moon game until they had changed the title to story of seasons. This take on harvest moon, is not it. This was not it. Why bother buying out the title if you're going to ruin it? Stick to story of seasons this game is nearly unplayble and just not worth it. Also wayyy overpriced.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078365965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1588902826}
review: I was excited to try this game because I played a lot of Harvest moon and Rune Factory games on SNES, Gamecube and DS. However, it seems the franchise has really taken a nosedive during the last several years, because this game was horrible. The best way to describe it would be a "dumbed down version" of a classic. If I dare even say that. It was boring and clunky from the beginning, and the graphics are awful. Not much good to say about this game. I would only recommend it for young kids.

review: i know this game is not the same harvest moon i used to play in my childhood which is now called story of seasons outside japan, this one is created by  a different developer but under the same old name. but i wanted to see this game as a brand new game and not gonna compare it to the old harvest moon (bokujo monogatari) and so far i enjoyed it's gameplay and features like there's a lot of side quests etc. the only downside is the main story is waaaay too short and wasn't really interesting. as for graphics, lots of people complains about it but i don't mind as long as the game is enjoyable. but i'm still hoping natsume will improve their "harvest moon" game in the future and become an alternative farming sim other than story of seasons and stardew valley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234516860', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 15035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15035, 'last_played': 1596370710}
review:
Doesn't hold up to today's standards, but it's a good game.
Frustrating weather, not enough warning before you run out of energy, no customisation of character, and you can only marry someone of the opposite sex to your character so I recommend looking at potential marriage candidates before starting the game.

I married Nova, and I'm not sure if it's just her or if it's everyone, but she was creepily childlike even after marriage and having a baby.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067321092', 'num_games_owned': 490, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1587821918}
review: Joguei muito pouco do jogo, mas já posso dizer pra quem é fã da série Harvest Moon e jogou os anteriores como o Back to Nature do PS1 e A Wonderful Life no PS2 que este não está no nível dos anteriores. Houve um problema de direitos e a empresa que criava jogos Harvest Moon se dividiu entre jogos com o nome de Harvest Moon e Story of Seasons. Os jogos com "melhor" qualidade estão sendo feitos pela Marvelous, com o nome de Story of Seasons, então não se deixe levar pelo saudosismo dos jogos antigos, "Harvest Moon" mudou de nome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067189801', 'num_games_owned': 584, 'num_reviews': 309, 'playtime_forever': 3355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3355, 'last_played': 1594367652}
review:
This is my first (and probably my only) Harvest Moon game. ... Where to start? I had so many issues with this game. It feels a bit surreal that they released this in 2017 and it's so lackluster. Natsume is a million-dollar company, so there's really no excuse for such a [i]basic[/i] game. Indie developers have made significantly more interesting and fun games with less resources. Stardew Valley is the obvious example, but I even liked World's Dawn, a RPG Maker game, vastly more than this. Sadly, I put way too much time into this game. I kept hoping it would get better, but not even DLC could salvage my enjoyment. In fact, the DLC made it worse.

Long list of issues:
[list]
[*] There is no mystery or depth in the story. Everything is spoon-fed to the player.
[*] The characters are extremely boring and one-dimensional. All character cutscenes are so dull and uninteresting. 
[*] The island is way too small. There's not a lot of exploring to do, even after unlocking everything.
[*] The controls are finicky and make the already tedious tasks in the game more frustrating. 
[*] The player can ride a horse to get around faster, [i]but[/i] it takes a long time to even obtain the horse. I obtained my horse [i]after[/i] I finished Chapter 5 (the initial ending of the game), in which the player obtains teleportation from the map view. That defeats the whole point of even obtaining a horse if the player can't get it earlier in the game.
[*] There's no obvious way to advance in the mines. I had to search online how to advance, because the game tells the player exactly nothing about how to find the ladders to lower levels. 
[*] Fishing is easy, but uninteresting and not very fun. 
[*] There are too many levels of item quality. Two or three would've been fine, not five: Regular, Great, Ultimate, Supreme, & Miracle/Legendary. Every time the player gets a new recipe, it has to be made five different times thanks to the quality variations. That's such a needless and uninteresting way to bring variety to the game. 
[*] The protagonist can only be a light-skinned man or woman, giving a big "f--- you" to darker-skinned and enby players. 
[*] Furthermore, there are only heterosexual relationships/marriages.
[*] Speaking of marriage, the wedding day is abysmal. It lasts about five seconds and takes up the entire in-game day, forcing the player to neglect all their crops and farm animals as well. 
[*] Thankfully, I only obtained two of the DLC, during the summer sale while they were cheap, because guess what -- they don't work properly. It seems like the DLC only works if the player has it from the very beginning of the game and follows every little step needed [i]precisely[/i] to trigger cutscenes that are required to happen before the player can even utilize the DLC features. I researched online to find several different issues with the DLC packs, so my issues weren't even all of them. I contacted Natsume via their official email and got a "Sorry for the inconvenience" stock answer. It's almost like these DLC packs should've just been part of the base game and then maybe there wouldn't be so many issues with it working. 
[/list]

Short list of good things to say about it:
[list]
[*] The animals are cute. The player can adopt a dog and a cat.
[*] The female protagonist makes cute facial expressions to make up for her lack of dialogue. 
[*] While the characters' personalities are dull, there are a few who, at least, look nice/pretty/cute: Edmond, Soleil, Jeanne, & Shirlock. 
[*] The seasons of Spring and Autumn are pretty. 
[*] The player can save at any time rather than daily like in other games of this genre. 
[/list] 

Just play Stardew Valley if you want to play a game of this genre. Harvest Moon: LoH just isn't worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114991122', 'num_games_owned': 733, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1891, 'last_played': 1593378540}
review:
Game is okay. Not the best of the harvest moons, but that's just my opinion. Don't let me sway you away from the game by me saying I don't like it.

This is the first harvest moon I know that requires flowers for tool upgrades, or that I can recollect currently. It didn't take me until the 1st year of fall to realize I can plant crops out of season with Fertilizer, something the game didn't tell me.

This game is very intricate and versatile compared to the rest, you have many blends of fertilizers you can create that help with cross-plant creation basically, gaining a new harvestable item, along with food blends and creating your own quality of food. 

Crops are not the money maker in this not unless you want to go wild. I found myself holding onto crops just for quest exchange or to make food to keep me stamina up, and in the mines - using the food, and making my money that way. I quickly went from 0 to 500k  with no problem. Fishing is also the same way unless you catch the big boisss. Though its more beneficial to use your crops and fish to create food or hold onto for quests, same thing with items from animals, for some of those items will be used to craft things through npcs in the game before and after ending.

Game has cute scenes and good humor. You can beat the mainstory in the first year, even by summer. This game is definitely intended to keep going after the main storyline, the dlc started to take off for me right after along with the additive content for reaching end-game, such as marriage, kids, barn upgrades, chicken coop upgrades, clothing, etc. 

The only true irritating fact about this game is if you are trying to level your FP (friend points) with someone and everyone usually has a cut scene at a certain FP (musical note, 1, 2, 3, 4 blah blah) if you do not witness the cutscene, please don't waste your gifts on them for it does not increase the FP, and soft-locks it until you see that cutscene.  Same thing goes for their quests. If you have not completed their quest, the FP gain seems to soft lock for that npc you are trying to raise in friendship/romance. 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197975376313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1606509121}
review:
We are in a weird place when it comes to Harvest Moon.. They created the whole farming genre, but Natsume fired the guys who created the original games. They can't create a good Harvest Moon and the guys that they fired doesn't seem to be able to create a good game either! 

Meanwhile we have a random fan that creates Stardew Valley which is the closest we've ever gotten to a good Harvest Moon game since friends of mineral town!

Natsume sits on a good IP,  and they let it rot.. It's kinda sad..

author: {'steamid': '76561198410937033', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4692, 'last_played': 1593491286}
