author: {'steamid': '76561198083055597', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1594402777}
review:
O gráfico e a história são muito batidos além de vários pontos falhos, mas tem alguns pontos interessantes em relação ao outros títulos da franquia.

PONTOS POSITIVOS.
- Tratamento inteligente de seleção de ferramenta (Meio Confuso no começo, mas você vai pegar rápido).
- A plantação não bloqueia seu caminho, sendo assim você consegue fazer uma plantação 3x3 sossegadamente.
- Você consegue plantar no inverno sem necessidade de uma estufa (Não tem estufa no jogo).
- Sistema de estamina bem intuitivo.
- Quando você vai coletar qualquer material (minérios, madeira, legumes, verduras, flores, cogumelo, etc) caso você já tenha 99 do item, ele será armazenado automaticamente no armário ou na geladeira.

PONTOS NEGATIVOS.
- Menus não muito Intuitivos.
- Variações de itens desnecessários (o que dificulta fazer algumas missões do jogo e confunde ainda mais o menu) EX.: Ovo (Egg, Great Egg, Ultimate Egg, Supreme Egg, Miracle Egg) cada receita feita com um ovo vai ter uma variante ou seja 5 tipos de ovo frito, 5 tipos de ovo cozido, etc.
- Os personagens não são muito carismáticos.
- A economia do jogo é bem quebrada, a plantação e os animais da muito pouco retorno pelo esforço, compensa MUITO MAIS ir minerar ou pescar (acabei guardando a maior parte na geladeira/armário por que não compensava vender, mas, sim usar para dar de presente para os NPCs ou fazer missões).
- A história é bem mais ou menos (mas a maioria dos harvest moon não tem um aprofundamento muito grande na história então já era meio esperado ¯\_(ツ)_/¯).
- Não é muito amigável com novatos (se você não tem experiência em outro títulos vai passar um perrengue).
- Adubo, você vai precisar MUITO disso se não sua plantação vai ficar morrendo do nada (o que reforça meu ponto, plantar só serve para presentar e seguir a história).
- Os eventos do jogo são bem mais ou menos.
- O pacote de semente só planta um quadrado( nos jogos anteriores um pacote plantava 9 )
- Você só consegue carregar 99 de cada item (isso atrapalha na hora de plantar e colocar adubo).
- Os personagens brotam e aparecem do nada (eles não saem andando pela cidade eles de repente surgem no lugar)

CONCLUSÃO
- O jogo poderia ter um tratamento melhor, da a impressão de ter sido mal polido ou feito as pressas, ainda é harvest moon sendo assim a ideia central do jogo é a mesma (apesar de não compensar plantar), vai chegar certo ponto que o jogo vai ficar tão repetitivo que você provavelmente vai enjoar de jogar (eu enjoei com umas 40 horas de jogo)

author: {'steamid': '76561198129346545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 8611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2614, 'last_played': 1614405928}
review:
The devs focuses too much on the story telling to the point where some of the mechanics needs to be understood by the players on their own (Item limits, Action hold and others). 

Pace wise, it is quite easy and smooth. You just need to grind the mines regularly because it's a literal treasure trove.

Comparing this to [story of seasons] series or [stardew valley], I can say with certainty that this game is a tad undeveloped well unlike those two. If you're deciding to choose play either this or [story of season] or [stardew valley], certainly choose the latter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798880056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3168, 'last_played': 1586691403}
review:
Not quite like the Harvest Moon I grew up with. The actual story line can be completed a lot faster than you'd anticipate. There's no real twist or turn. Minimal challenge. When you're not bossing the plot, the rest of your time is spent waiting for crops and changing seasons whilst shoving the same gift as yesterday to the person you have elected will be your future bride/groom- nothing that wasn't expected. 
Felt like a bit of a let down after playing games such as Stardew Valley, but, it passed some weekend boredom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198868175607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3035, 'last_played': 1620486905}
review: Game progress/story feels a little slow at first but it proves to be a solid story. It is a bit annoying that you can't leave your barn animals out over night or that you can't let both the barn and coop out together. It would be nice if there was a tv for weather forecasting so that you don't have to track Gareth down. I like that there are mutation crops and that the characters seem to have some depth to them.  Accept Doc; he's a bit of a strange cookie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282270171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1591664347}
review: It's a harvest moon game, hard to mess that up. Very nice if you're looking for something relaxing to do; if you like stardew valley and haven't played a harvest moon game, give it a try! Or if you're looking for something relaxing and cute. Rune Factory fans will also most likely enjoy this too since they all follow the same general concept; just no combat in Harvest Moon, as far as I can remember/have seen

review: I purchased this game with not really much of any expectations. The only thing I wanted was an easy going game, and I got it in this. There isn't any combat but there's plenty to keep you busy. The instructions on how to do things in the game aren't very clear, but that could be on me since I'm too lazy to look up walkthoughs and such. Over all it's a good, easy going game. And I do recommend playing with a controller vs. keyboard. I tried both ways and I honestly prefer the controller as it allows for a smoother playing experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049366291', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 4986, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2960, 'last_played': 1591758224}
review: Uggggh. This is hard to write. OK, first thing: if you're thinking of buying this but haven't yet played Stardew Valley, My Time at Portia, and Yonder, play those first. All three of them are better than this (ironically, since all three are inspired by this). The basics are the same: farming, role-playing, and doing various activities in support of "building a life" with very little conflict and an emphasis on charming characters. But this one is clearly the weakest of the four games, with the least interesting activities and the least charming characters. Most characters are in fact very flat and one-dimensional. It's still a sweet game, though, so you're not losing that. Where this game *really* breaks down compared to the other three, though, is in the complexity of the systems and the grind that you will be called upon to do. There are a hundred different crop variations (caused by factors such as growing things out of season, on different types of land, with different types of fertilizer), plus different fish variations, plus different cooking variations. By end-game, it gets to the point where to create a type of bait needed to catch a rare fish, you first must catch some *other* rare fish and combine it with some rare crop, combine the two to make a very specialized bait which then gives you a chance to catch the super-rare fish... it's exhausting, highly luck- and grind-based and ultimately just not very much fun except for people who take achievement completionism to the level of an extreme sport. So this game is much grindier than the other three... but does that make it any more fun? In the end, the answer for me was "no".

review: I had played ALOT of Stardew Valley and many of my friends had suggested I play Harvest Moon.  They are much of the same game but Harvest Moon you are basically rebuilding the whole town, villagers houses included.  It had taken me 24 hours to beat the storyline of the game.  With all the add-ons I am still playing the game.  I enjoy Harvest Moon and it's easy to get sucked into this game for hours.  I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys farming town games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198430401387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1900, 'last_played': 1599191114}
review: I really love this game because it is easygoing, you can take it at your own pace as you play, and it's very fun to be a  productive farmer, I've always been a fan of Harvest Moon games and anything like them, the story is interesting as well, I suffer from anxiety and ocd and this game really calms me and helps me relax, definitely would recommend to anyone looking for a feel good relaxing game that is super interactive and has a cool story line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026230192', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1589985164}
review: I do understand where a lot of long time harvest moon fans feel a little let down by this entry, but to me it's actually very charming and lots of fun. the simplicity is actually something i appreciate, though the crop mutation system is a fun bit of complexity thrown in too. I'm not sure what else to say. It reminds me of all the good points of harvest moon even if it's not up to the standards of some fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054089768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 27013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3742, 'last_played': 1706062853}
review:
Updated Review

Just played the new SOS Friends of Mineral Town, and I have to say HM Light of Hope actually has better game play mechanics. I think SOS has cuter graphics, but the novelty of that fades quickly.  HM Light of Hope is a GREAT BUY at half the price of SOS.

HM Light of Hope has better farming controls.  And it has a crop mutation element.  That is actually my favorite.  Crops can mutate into a new crop under the right conditions.  The variety of soil type also makes farming much more interesting.  I put in hours of gameplay trying to unlock new seeds for crops and flowers.  In comparison, "Friends of Mineral Town" gets really boring really fast.

That's just one area where I think the new HM is better.  Storyline, and fishing is also better here in HM Light of Hope, imho. The more I play Mineral Town, the more I want to replay HM LOH. :D

Original Review

The story moves faster than the previous HM games.  They improved the process for farming and raising animals, so it's not so tedious.  Mining is much easier, and so is making gold.  I finished the main story line within the first year.  Wish the story was longer.  I really enjoyed the game play and can see myself playing the game again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028200093', 'num_games_owned': 1178, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 1625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1625, 'last_played': 1586034407}
review:
this is objectively one of the worst versions of harvest moon i have ever seen.
honestly i gave it a go because they arnt many harvest moon types of games on pc (and those that are i either played or arnt good either)

too make a long story short, the story is shallow, most characters are dull or impossible too find. and only AFTER finishing story, you unlock half the game.

so too put down a list of problems.

1, selling stuff
    it seems that selling too npcs makes more profit than sellin too the bin. which makes the bin completely useless.
    in addition, you have too either buy or sell x amount in order too unlock more seeds and tree's too plant.
    not a problem but pointless.

2, mining = profit.
    so less than halfway year 1 i unlocked mining and o boy does that make a profit. in reality it makes so much more profit
    than farming does. in such a short timespan. that it feels like farming becomes the sidegig.

3, upgrades locked behind story.
    after a certain time in the game (fixing blacksmiths house) you end up being able too upgrade your tools.
    which is great and all. but i quickly noticed that everything you need is either deep in the mines. or is out of season.
    certain flowers required for upgrades can only be obtained during 1 season and thus hard too obtain. while others
    are locked behind resources that only unlock AFTER beating story.

4, story is simplistic and dull.
    the main aspect of the game is for you too "find" 5 medalions. sadly story wise each and every single 1 takes no effort
    too obtain. if anything the game would have been better off not having this story. the main characters "reason" too stay
    on the island is rather bad as well. you wash ashore and as usual fashion gets brought into a house too rest. character
    character wakes up and with little to no dialog accepts too live on said island. without even beeing outside yet!

5, building instantly.
    so in the older harvest moon games it would take a while for a house or tool to be build. unfortunately over the years 
    they removed said system. now everything gets build instantly. its a shame really. but the thing that anoys me the most 
    about it. is that whenever you repair an house of someone. they magically appear the next day. as if getting an invite too 
    come back home. it's so obnoxiously bad that its sad. fix house. npc moves in the next day. without ever hearing about 
    them earlier.

6, npc static during story.
    so long story short. when you're are at ANY of the story parts. the npc you interacted with will stay there until you move 
    onto the next story part. this can takes days or weeks ingame. completely removing them from the normal cycle.
    this can easily lead too events and interactions breaking. as the npcs arnt joining.

7, inconsistent events.
    so since for whatever reason the dev desided too remove the calender. you will never really know when an event is going 
    too happen. this sadly also means. you don't know if you missed any. or for whatever reason. sometimes events dont 
    happen at all. apparently there are multiple events a month. but because of point 6 and other things. events just dont 
    trigger.

8, tiered minigames.
    of the events that do spawn there are certain tiers you unlock. easy normal hard. you start on easy and if you get 1st 
    place you can then do normal the next time the event shows up. sadly tho, the events seem to be even random there.
    for the fishing one you require a certain amount of points which seems to be completely random whenever you obtain
    the right amount or not.

9, hearts(affection) doesn't mean anything.
    for whatever reason. it's real real real easy too obtain affection with people and animals. even more so if you shower
    them with gifts. which isnt even needed because of how easy it is too obtain. yet it doesnt seem to do anything.
    untill you beat story you can't even marry people. within 1 month i maxed out affection with all animals i got.
    yet they still produce questionable quality of resources. not too mention that more animals unlock AFTER story.
    while your barn is already full.

10 house upgrades.
    speaking of upgrades. the farm upgrades are unlocked again. after story. they arnt really cheap either. so you end up
    having (forgive the pun) farm for money wood and stone. which would not be an issue if the game was enjoyable.

11 co-op
     as i'm finishing up the review of the game i suddenly remembered co-op. like... why did you make it so bad?
     yes folks, unlike what the website says. this game has co-op. shitty shitty co-op. you unlock that after about
     a week or 2 ingame and then can select too have a 2nd person join. unfortunately it's NEVER explained. so the 
     1st time i activated this mechanic i ended up losing control over my MC. because for whatever reason the game
     desided too move my controls too player 2. player 2 is only active while you are on your farm. seemingly as a sidekick
     again sadly tho. its interactions are limited and honestly no npc even ecnolages its existance.

if anything. this is one of my lowest ranking harvest moon games too date. and i think i played almost all of them.
sadly the game doesnt even have much on the points of good things. as all but 1 character is bland af. which sadly has always been a problem with the later HM games.

long story short.
i wish they released a better harvest moon game instead of this one. hells even releasing the older ones would have been far more interesting. 
(looking at the screenshots by accident and i notice the animals being outside. not once in my playthrough have i seen the farm animals outside)

author: {'steamid': '76561198272966975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1590118207}
review:
This game is kind of a hit and miss. Some people might like it and some people might not. Personally, I've been a big fan of the Harvest moon/Story of Seasons series sense Harvest Moon: Friends of Mineral Town. To be honest, I didn't really think that this one would be any good compared to the others after seeing the trailers and gameplays of it. But then I decided to give it a try and see how things went and I gotta say that I like it. It's not the best in the series, but I can see myself playing this game for hours at a time like with any other Harvest moon game.

Likes: The characters are cute and their expressions are funny and unique. (They kinda remind me of Mii Characters.) The animals are adorable as always. The story in the game is good.

Dislikes: The controls are a little iffy at times. When collecting flowers in the wild, you won't know what flower it is until you pick it up. The story is good but it's too short in my opinion.

Anyways, like I said earlier it's a hit and miss game. It's not a bad game but it's not the best in the series. But I'd recommend getting the game and giving it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980518052', 'num_games_owned': 5854, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1588906440}
review:
[h1] Disappointing [/h1]

I've always loved Harvest Moon and Rune Factory games. I've waited a LOOOOOOOOOOOONG time for Harvest Moon and/or Rune Factory to come to PC, Stardew Valley and many games since have shown there is a market, and this is what we get? This game? If it wasn't published by Natsume and carried the Harvest Moon name, I would have thought it was some copycat asset flip game. 

The graphics are awful, there is no charm. The controls are awful, no PC optimization, you don't even have a item bar to easy swap between things. Even when zoomed out to the max everything still looked like I was playing an older game on a CRT monitor. This may be to hide how small the world appears to be, however, there are clearly more areas to unlock, but without any kinds of map I don't know if it would make a difference. I didn't play long enough to comment on the story but it seemed pretty standard from what I saw. 

I thought this might have been a poor mobile port, nope, the game was released on PC in 2017, then later to PS4, Switch, and mobile in 2018. That's right, a game released first on PC isn't even optimized for PC, has XBOX control prompts (which you can see from the screenshot) but I can't find any release info for XBOX, what?

There are better mobile games then this, heck Stardew Valley is now on mobile. I couldn't even say this game could stand on it's own merits let alone when compared to it's competitors. The most disappointing thing is that I really wanted to like this and give it a shot. I saw all the positive reviews and thought, maybe look pass the graphics and there is some enjoyment to be had. There may very well be but when I think back at all those hours spent playing Harvest Moon and Rune Factory, this just feels like a slap in the face.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986276194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 3993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3157, 'last_played': 1601330669}
review: This isn't the best Harvest Moon game I played, and its one of the smallest Harvest Moon games I ever played (without getting all the DLC), but its still a good game. I played all the Harvested Moon games for the Nintendo DS and Gamecube, and can confidently say while this is not big on content, it is still very well made. There is still a good amount of things to do, discover, and see, with a good amount of things to unlock. The small size of the game world and medium content is probably what will annoy people who play this game who managed to play Stardew Valley before it, as Stardew Valley has a medium sized game world with a huge amount of content. However, if you get past that, you'll notice the characters are lovable with interesting personalities and histories to enjoy, along with an original storyline unique to all other Farming Sims.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047891833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1587952983}
review:
I bought the game with all of its DLC and extra content.  I played it for about an hour, and this game was not what I hoped for.  I was looking for a Harvest Moon game that was similar to Back to Nature on the PS1.  This game is not that.

There are a number of apparent issues:

1. The graphics suck.
2. The story line is pretty bad.
3. The game does not feel like the older Harvest Moon games.

Also, one issue that you cannot tell from the screenshots is that this is a really crappy port from the Switch.  They show the XYAB buttons in the UI.  Due to the crappy port from the console, the controls are clunky for a keyboard user.

I really wish Natsume would put some time and effort in a nice PC version of a good Harvest Moon game.  Really disappointed.  Honestly, Stardew Valley is a much better game and closer to the old Harvest Moon games than this one.

I think Natsume thought they could rake in millions by porting to PC; however, I am requesting a refund.  I am really unhappy with the quality of the game.  It just wasn't fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991290216', 'num_games_owned': 646, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1591368847}
review:
Ok, I know this isn't a true "Bokujō Monogatari" game (now they are called Story of Seasons in the West). I also know people seem to "hate" this game mostly because of this, claiming this isn't a true Harvest Moon.


My biggest surprise here, however, is that I DON'T hate it. And while I DO understand people's point, this game actually DOES feel like a true Harvest Moon to me. 


That said, this isn't one of the best games to carry the Harvest Moon name. Everything is... average in here, nothing more than that. Graphics are average, soundtrack is average, story is meh...


But I'm having fun with it. A LOT more fun than I was anticipating, in fact. The gameplay is solid. The game reminds me of Island of Happiness (Nintendo DS), since you play in an abandoned island and the more you fix stuff more NPCs come to live in the island. And I LOVED that aspect, since it really feels like we are accomplishing a lot more than your typical Harvest Moon.


The controls aren't bad either. You can even use the mouse for everything, including moving around (but you can also move with WASD... and that's what I recommend). Some things are more intelligent than in most games in the series, for example: if you click in a crop, you'll water it, without having to select the watering can first. If the crop is already watered, you'll use a fertilizer if you click in it again. Click a rock, you'll use the hammer automatically. This makes things a lot more simple, and in a game where you'll do repetitive activities all the time, that's a good thing.


Now, everything that you'd expect from a Harvest Moon are here: farming, gifting, fishig, mining, getting married, heart events, etc. Everything done in a very average way, but nothing badly executed either. And man! This game is packed with content. Not as much as Stardew Valley, but as a Harvest Moon game, this one has quite a lot of stuff to do, even if not as much as Animal Parade or Friends of Mineral Town.


But as I said before, everything this game does, it does in the most average way possible. And that's where you should decide if this game is for you: do you want an average Harvest Moon? If, like me, you've played all the games in the series and also played Stardew Valley until your eyes bled, then maybe you want a new game? If yes, then get this game. This game won't "replace" any game in the series. It won't replace Stardew valley. But if you want a new Harvest Moon, this game isn't bad.

I recommend it if you already did everything you wanted in Stardew Valley, for example, and still needs a new farming/dating sim.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060818063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5627, 'last_played': 1587827288}
review:
This review may seem awkward given the number of hours I have in the game - and I actually expect to spend some more, but the answer is: I do not recommend this game, unless you have basically completed the alternatives (Stardew Valley comes into mind).

Mining System: 3/10. Honestly, being able to use the upgraded Hoe helps, and the fact that mining is the best way to obtain gold in the game also incentives a little, but honestly, this mining system is probably worse than Friends of Mineral Town. It is grindy and boring. Fortunately, you can get the minerals you need fast enough and then you basically just stop mining, unlike FoMT where you actually had to mine a lot in order to obtain stamina fruits and cursed tools. Nonetheless, this is one of the worst current-era mining systems around. 

Planting: 5/10. The mutation system is quite interesting, however, it is quite expensive (which is not that much of a problem) and, especially, it is time consuming. For some reason, the devs decided to now allow us to hire help from the Harvest Sprites, so, no matter how advanced in the game you are, you will still be watering and harvesting by yourself. In fact, the only way to improve your production is upgrading the tools, and then it is done. You have to plant about 500+ of some particular crops in order to obtain enough mutations to unlock the seeds for them, and doing it without any irrigation system (again, sprites or anything) is consuming. 

Animals: 2/10. The system is completely unclear on how the quality of the animal products work. I assume that, as in any other game, the higher the friendship/love/w/e with the animal, the higher the quality. However, it also looks like giving better food (Delicious Feed in particular) increases the chance of higher quality, but, again, this is something not specified and even guides aren't clear about it. Similarly, it feels there is little reason to let your animals go out (besides some bugs with it, like some not going out at all - even though they are not sick/pregnant/anything) and if the Delicious Feed theory is right, letting them go out is actually bad as it decreases the quality of the products. If that is the case, the system sucks.

Also, while Milk is highly demanded for cooking, Wool and Fur are pretty much worthless. Money? Get from the mine. Requests? Meh, not worth it and also you can get enough for all requests in like 2 seasons. After rebuilding everything and marrying, it feels like the sheeps and donkeys are useless. 

Relationships: 0/10. Honestly? There is absolutely no reason to improve friendship with anyone that you are not going to marry over 2 notes. In previous games, higher friendship would allow you to visit them in odd schedule times (by the way, scheduling in this game is oversimplified as hell: most villagers have basically two different schedules, independent of season, weather or anything - and they simply teleport from one place to another), offer new items even at the highest levels of friendship or any other kind of reward. In LoH, you don't unlock anything. Bastian and Sofia will need you to get 2 notes in order to fully unlock their stores but that's it. I think Carol also needs 2 notes for some flowers. But there is no other reason for it. 

Even the cutscenes with Michelle - which i married - are boring and poorly made. From what I have seen in cutscenes with other characters, they are not better either.

Wifes: 10/10 - Kurisu is on the game, I don't care about anything else. This line is half-ironic, by the way. Jokes aside, 2017 and HM games still lack any kind of homosexual relationship. Yes, I understand the child is a major part of the storyline, but there are many ways to include that (adoption hi?) and make the game a little bit inclusive. But w/e, for *me* this is minor, but for some people it might be sad and bad.

Cooking: 2/10. Cooking is grindy as hell as well. The bottleneck is, by far, Milk, which basically requires you to have a farm full of cows. There are almost no recipes with eggs (which is funny), and the recipes are very repetitive. Basically, (insert quality) Butter + Fish or (Insert quality) Cheese + Bunch of stuff. Gezz, you need a total of 22 cheeses of EACH quality in order to complete the list. That's 66 Miraculous Milks only for the cheese. 

The specific quality system is also a huge annoyance. Honestly, all the cooking system seems messed up and lazily done. Requiring so many top-quality material and not even allowing a higher-quality to be used in most recipes is simply bad. 

Events: 2/10. No more horse race. No more... so many stuff are missing. I will skip this into the final one because they are related.

Soundtrack: 6/10. It's calming, but repetitive and the mine one is straight forward annoying. Also, bugs in the summer... bug me.

Art: 1/10. Gezz what an ugly art. Really. Honestly it feels like a huge downgrade compared to a GAMEBOY GAME FROM 2003. This is how ugly the art is for me. 

Final review: 4/10. The game seems like a down-graded version of games that were released more than 15 years ago. Seriously, there is considerably less content than Friends of Mineral Town (aside the crop mutations), and gameplay has not improved at all. Mining is even more boring, relationships are more meaningless and storylines are more lazy. So far, I haven't seen any couples in the island besides myself, by the way, which is also something that downgrades the storytelling - if you don't marry them, everyone else in the island remains single forever, because you are the only person worthy? Miss love rivals. 

So, going back to what I have written in the beginning: This is not worth it, unless you already got full achievements in Stardew Valley, or even My Time at Portia, or anything else that had a little more of effort put from the devs, and you really love this kind of game and really want to play it. Especially considering it's quite expensive.

author: {'steamid': '76561199048096352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 67385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1710536373}

author: {'steamid': '76561198060744465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 974, 'last_played': 1590295741}
review:
I liked this game, but the reason I said I would not recommend it is largely because of a few small frustrating aspects of it, that I think add up to it just not being worth quite as much as $20. I'd value it at $8 maybe. The things I mean by frustrations:
- I had to look up how to use Soleil, and guess what, if you're playing the PC version of the game, you can't! You have to play multiplayer with a console and 2 controllers for that. Stupid.
- The controls are not that well explained inside the game. It took me forever to figure out how to actually use upgraded tools. All they tell you is "hold the Action button", but that's not what you actually have to do. What you actually have to do, that the game doesn't tell you, is hold the action button and drag it across the squares you want to use it on. It was a pain in the ass to learn that bc like I said, the in-game exposition wasn't adequate.
- How to fish was also not very well explained. But luckily, it was easy for me bc I was used to the Stardew Valley method of fishing. But still, to save you some hassle and disappointment when you first try to fish (without any guidance from the NPC who gives you the rod): you click on the square of water, click again after choosing your bait, and the hard part to learn is wait for the tiny bumps to turn into a big splash, THEN click. At first I just kept clicking as soon as the fish bites and you see ripples, because that's what I remember doing in numerous other games, don't remember if that's how it works in previous Harvest Moon games or not, but it is just not explained at all when you get your rod. 
- The NPCs are kind of meh, with only a few of them having real interesting personalities. They mostly just hang out by the fountain and say the same lines over and over again. I guess that's typical of farm sims, but this one has especially bland NPCs. Tree of Tranquility was the last Harvest Moon game I played and the NPCs in that one were written better. They were much more interesting in A Wonderful Life for the Gamecube too.
- You can make so much from mining, and so little from fishing and farming, that you wonder why it's a farming game at all. All you have to do is fix the restaurant, buy a bunch of bread, mine every day, eating bread when your health is low, and bam. Why even bother growing crops or having animals? Other than that the plot of the game demands it, and most villager requests are for crops, animal products, or flowers.
- NPCs make requests that are sometimes for off-season items, I wish they had programmed it so that they knew what season it was when making a request? Idk if that's possible. There are endless requests, they often feel repetitive and boring, and I don't think the game rewards the player that well for doing most of them. 
- The fortune telling characters being only available after 5 on certain days. I'm used to things being closed and off-limits by 5-6 or so, so that took me forever to figure out. I couldn't understand why I was never able to visit them.
- Speaking of NPC availability, you don't have any device you can even buy right away at least that tells you the hours of any business, and they are not posted on signs AT the business (which they are in other Harvest Moon games). You have to look up the hours/days for businesses to be open in your bookshelf, that's the only place you can see it. And there's no "business hours" sheet, you have to find the sheet specific to that business or NPC. Frustrating. 
- No calendar, like, anywhere? No TV, at least, not that's available in the first 2 seasons where I'm at. In other games, you started with a basic TV and a calendar in your house. 
- The map tells you where characters are if they're out of their homes, and sometimes? tells you if they're in their homes? It's very unclear. Many times you get no indication of if a character is inside their home and their home is open for visitors. 
- I got stuck in limbo where I'm at right now waiting for fall, because to advance the game I need a strawberry, milk, and flour. I could make the flour in summer, but spring had passed, so too late to get a strawberry, until fall. And I have to wait for my cow to grow up for the milk. And I upgraded my tools early in summer (needing flowers to upgrade tools in addition to cash and ore is weird and frustrating too), using sunflowers. Now I have to wait for fall for the cosmos and white roses needed (for SOME reason) to further upgrade my tools. Even though I have tons of money and other material (materials that actually make sense that you would make a tool from). So it's like Summer 15 and I basically have to twiddle my thumbs for 15 more days. Or just do my farm chores and go back to sleep. 
- The tool order thing. I basically cannot destroy unwanted crop plants that keep producing all season. When you start on a square, it first assumes you want the hoe, then if you click a hoed square, it rifles through available seeds to plant, then it assumes you want to water, if watered it assumes you want fertilizer. No ability to just take an axe or sickle or whatever to plants you no longer want. I guess you just have to let them dry up and die. It also means that, say you water a square in the middle of a 3-square row and you want to water the plant before it and after it, you can't. Because the game will not let you water a square that's already been watered. And the controls are sometimes heckin shifty so you definitely will screw up and water in such a way. 
- You can't give food to wild animals? I don't know how I'm supposed to befriend the mountain cat if the game won't let me give it stuff? Or maybe it has to be given certain specific foods? Not like the game will tell me. If you want to figure this game out you probably need to search online, the exposition in-game is the bare minimum, if even that. They did say you need to upgrade your house to have a pet, which I think is kind of bogus anyway, but maybe that means you can't feed a wild animal to befriend it until you do that. 

I will say though, that despite these issues sometimes causing frustration, I do mostly enjoy the game. I just don't think it's up to the Harvest Moon name. The dev breakup here leaves an obvious mark on the quality of it. I was hoping it would be good despite that drama, but it's really mediocre. I'm only playing it because I got so good at Stardew Valley (and married my favorite NPCs in different save files) that I got bored with it, and because of the quarantine. I have heck-all else to do. Not like I'm actually going to finish crocheting that scarf, or work on my novel. Ha. It's funny but I'm pretty much going insane under the pressure here, and that I actually seem to enjoy playing this game seems proof that I've finally hecking lost it.

After a few more days: Well, I can't say it's not growing on me. I like Cyril and Jeanne. However, this is balanced by the fact that I have come to hate Tabitha and the purple haired lady. Tabitha is just an annoying brat. The other is pretty but boring and always in the way between me and the blacksmith. And all she ever says is either "do you have that thing I asked you for" or "I just can't imagine myself being married, teehee". Ok fine, I won't marry you. Byeee. 

 I found out that you can sometimes select the green arrow to give a higher quality item than the item that is required. I say sometimes. I could not use Great White Roses for the tool upgrade that requires (because, reasons?) 4 White Roses. I just never had much trouble figuring out the basics in any previous HM game. Everything was either explained fairly well via a cut scene, the person who gives you your farm giving you a tutorial, or text. The fact that you can grow things without real regard to seasons makes the game feel weird, and not grounded in nature or reality as much. I mean, it isn't to begin with? But it's odd that your animals shit in this game, BUT you can grow carrots in the summer.

review: Harvest Moon games have been a part of my childhood and teenage years, but I found as time progressed, the heart and soul of it seems to just not be there. This is a hard game to recommend. If you're new to Harvest Moon games, perhaps you'll enjoy it! But for a veteran like me, I just don't find it the same as past installments. It's very hit and miss! I may come back to try and play it one day, but not for a long while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304095026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1616073266}
review: It's good if you don't have any consoles for the other games and it's an easy way for me to relive my childhood. It's a fun game that's not too short but also not long enough to the point where you want to quit halfway through. Sometimes it does end up with a few hours in only one session but it's good that you can do that multiple times with the odd break.

author: {'steamid': '76561198439827413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1632113167}
review: I love that you can actually go mining in this HM, as opposed to the "mining system" of The Lost Valley. I would prefer if all of the shops would conduct their business indoors, and if NPC's were accessible more of the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078782200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 43170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1999, 'last_played': 1693868147}
review:
It's okay for a Harvest Moon game but it's certainly not the best. The stamina mechanics are awful and you really have to grind in order to get your tools upgraded before the first Winter season. My BIGGEST peeve about this game is that no matter how much stamina you have, it does NOT let you stay up all night. I spent so much time gathering enough energy to grind in the mines all night long but the stupid sprite stops me every single time at like 5am and forces me to sleep. It's incredibly annoying.
My only other peeve about this game is that I find it lacks in the animal department. All of the other HM games give you so many options for your pets and variations of colors for your barn animals but it seems that everyone is given the same colors and single options for the dog.
Still haven't finished the first year yet so will be updating my review as I go.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077348037', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3073, 'last_played': 1585702810}
review: 45 hours in, its okay. Def seems like they are trying to capture the feel of the old games but missed a bit. I really gatta say i dont care for the fact that grass isnt a leave and forget thing and has to be replanted every time you gather. I also dont like that it will just die out of now where. I also must say the fact that i have to spend every day re clearing my fields is annoying and a very bad time sync they tried to put in. It feels bad and makes me kinda not care to make the whole place look good. In the next one I hope they go back to storms being the only thing that adds debry back to your fields and that they bring back the old grass. ALSO the guy who is supposed to tell me the weather never has after 300 conversations with him i still havent seen a weather forecast. Besides these points the game fells OKAY at best. I know its a new dev, I just hope they take time to read reviews and put them into thought in the next games. I will still collect both main line and the new "HM" line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050104886', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4272, 'last_played': 1660434129}
review:
I love me some Harvest Moon, though I admittedly haven't played much after the English localization split (the Japanese developer decided to change to a different English localization company, so the Japanese-made games previously localized as Harvest Moon titles are now localized as Story of Seasons, and any newly made Harvest Moon games are west-exclusive and completely unrelated to past Harvest Moon titles and all Story of Seasons games.  Look it up on your own for more details).  

While this game is lacking in features compared to the previously Japanese-made titles and has various little annoying details in functionality compared to them, this game is still fun and addictive.  Features-wise, there's no character customization or really much else to customize (which I'm not super upset about it lacking, but I do like customization features), and the game seems a little short on festivals/events.  Functionality-wise, the game annoyingly lacks an in-game calendar and everyday weather forecasting (you can ask one specific character for the weather forecast, but he is only around in the evenings and only like every other day of the week), and it really sucks that animals bought from the livestock dealer aren't adults, and thus one has to wait several days for them to mature to get their products (which is especially annoying for the donkeys as they take a whopping 30 days to mature!).  Additionally, the way one progresses in the story to unlock features is sometimes annoying, as one has to obtain certain items to progress, some of which can be more difficult depending on the in-game season, plus it can be restrictive if the player just wants to farm his/her own way as opposed to what the game says to do.

That all being said, I thought the crop mutations were a really cool and interesting feature.  The characters are pretty fun and likable (Except the blue Harvest Sprite!  That guy's a d***.), and it was actually a bit of a tough decision on whom to marry.  The Player 2 Gem Sprite helper, Soleil, is a cool and useful feature (especially in the mines!), though it's worth noting that when I would activate it, Soleil's controls would go to my controller, and the player character could only used through the mouse and keyboard.

Ultimately, I just adore the base gameplay of Harvest Moon, so the annoying features were tolerable and the good stuff was just as good as ever.  If you feel the same about the base gameplay, and/or want a different, less-frills Harvest Moon game definitely pick this one up.  I give it 4/5 Magentocrystals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036084478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1681, 'last_played': 1586484800}
review:
As a huge fan of the early Harvest Moon games and now of Stardew Valley, Orange Season, etc, it pains me to say - this game is not good. The main story line is lazy, a sloppily edited copy-paste of themes we've all seen a million times before. The reused tropes miss 'inspiring fond nostalgia' and instead land in 'repetitious boredom'. The development of tools and buildings is awkwardly mismatched with the resource acquisition. The fertilizer system is just a nuisance. The number of mutations and variations of crops STARTS as a fun extra but rapidly devolves into a hindrance - are you growing a certain number of corn plants to turn into a certain amount of fodder? Too bad 3 of the plants are now making Great Sweet Corn, and one is Supreme Corn, you don't get to make the fodder you were planning on. Don't get me started on the cooking system and the world's longest in-game scrolling menu.
Look, there are SOME good things about Light of Hope. The controls are decent. The art is fine. There are a few bachelors and bachelorettes that are actually appealing and interesting (although it is SUPER CREEPY that you can romance the little helper once they grow up - you raised them from 'birth', taught them words and experiences, they are essentially halfway between your pet and your child - and then they hit crystal alien puberty and suddenly they're a potential sex partner? Nope, nope nope nope).
Where was I? Ah yes, good things. That's it. That's all of them. 
If you want a farming RPG, you can do much better than Light of Hope.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985048152', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1140, 'last_played': 1521670609}
review:
За других не говорю, но это худший симулятор фермы из всех, что я видела.

Примечательно то, как бесстыдно поступили разработчики: получили права на использование имени нашумевшей франшизы и выпустили под ним какую-то ерунду, воспользовавшись тем, что игроки не знают всех этих закулисных интриг. Фанаты серии, ни одна часть которой никогда не выходила на PC, восприняли игру холодно, зато ей очень обрадовались пользователи Стима и сделали игре такую кассу, что всё остальное уже не важно. Многие так и не поняли, что их обманули, и настойчиво защищают Light of Hope в обзорах: [i]это же Harvest Moon, она не может быть плохой, вы просто её не поняли! Я и сам пока не понял… но это же Harvest Moon, она не может быть плохой![/i] Это не Harvest Moon.

Сюжет банален: герой (конкретный мальчик или девочка на выбор) терпит кораблекрушение и попадает на остров, где его выхаживает смотрительница маяка. Город на острове находится в упадке, жители покинули его, здесь нет ничего интересного, но герой почему-то решает остаться и навести на острове порядок, а заодно возродить каких-то духов маяка. Герою в собственность дают избушку с кроватью и участок земли, заваленный брёвнами и камнями.

В Castaway Paradise аналогичная примитивная завязка, но это не мешает ей увлечь игрока. В Light of Hope всё не так радужно: с самого начала все здания закрыты, NPC практически нет, сажать нечего и некуда — сперва придётся расчистить участок. У вашего героя есть полоска энергии, и ресурса этого несбалансированно мало: вырвал десяток сорняков — всё, иди спать до утра, а то в обморок упадёшь. Обморок грозит ещё меньшим количеством энергии на следующий день. Со временем темп игры набирает обороты: вы чините магазин, и в нём появляется торговец, у которого можно приобрести семена овощей и фруктов; чините другие здания — и становится возможно купить семена цветов и рецепты, пообщаться с новыми персонажами и попытаться выполнить сюжетный квест: найти магические печати и вернуть их на места. Звучит интереснее, чем есть на самом деле.

Первый очевидный недостаток игры — её внешний вид. Делать такую жалкую графику для игры на платформе, на которой уже вышло столько красоты, просто неприлично (я говорю не только об AAA-играх, но и о казуальных проектах наподобие этого). Дизайном игра тоже не блещет, всё крайне примитивно и безынтересно. Вы считаете, это нормально, когда дом семьи из трёх человек представляет собой коробку с тремя кроватями?

В любой The Sims ухаживать за огородом на порядок интереснее, чем здесь. Повторяющихся действий слишком много даже для симулятора фермы, к тому же процесс ухода за овощами невозможно автоматизировать. Даже в маленькой Farm for Your Life можно было купить автоматические поливалки и нанять помощников. А самое неприятное — каждое утро растения рандомно гибнут, если их заранее не обработать дорогостоящим удобрением. Сами семена тоже влетают в копеечку, так что после всего этого фермерства и продажи овощей вы практически не получаете прибыли. Животные бьют по карману ещё больнее. Куда выгоднее рыбачить или грайндить в шахте — денег за результаты своего труда вы получите в десятки, а то и в сотни раз больше. То есть в [i]симуляторе фермы[/i] бессмысленно заниматься фермерством.

С готовкой тоже всё плохо. Рецепт варёного яйца стоит 300 долларов! ( ・_・) Сложный, наверное. Ну а сам процесс приготовления блюда представляет собой скучное окошко крафта. Готовое блюдо стоит меньше, чем сумма его ингредиентов. Несколько видов качества каждого продукта не спасают положение, даже наоборот: для некоторых рецептов нужны настолько отменные ингредиенты, что этим блюдам не суждено быть приготовленными, плакали наши ачивки. Кстати, ингредиенты разного качества занимают разные слоты в ограниченном инвентаре, так что вскоре собранные с грядок овощи не лезут в карманы.

Общаться с NPC неинтересно, а «катсцены» невозможно пропустить. Обучение слишком подробное и навязчивое, зато, когда заканчиваются очевидные вещи и начинается полная неизвестность, подсказки прекращаются. Реплики персонажей очень простые и глупые, словно написаны для дошкольников, зато разбиты на десятки пролистываемых окошек диалога, чтобы игрок одурел, пока ждёт его окончания.

Саундтрек ужасен. Даже спустя полтора года после моего последнего посещения шахты из Light of Hope я легко вспоминаю звучавшую там музыку. Думаете, это мрачный эмбиент или что-то героическое, потому что обычно в этих шахтах водятся враги, и с ними нужно драться? Вот и нет, пещерными обитателями игра нас обделила, а самым удачным звуковым сопровождением добывания руды и драгоценных камней кто-то посчитал карнавальную музыку, точнее даже, её недлинный отрывок, повторяющийся снова и снова. Да ещё игра так запрограммирована, что лестница на следующий этаж открывается под одним из последних исследованных участков, хотя по-честному здесь должен быть рандом.

Не представляю, кому эта игра могла действительно понравиться. Здесь не на что посмотреть, нечего почитать, музыку лучше не слушать, все предложенные занятия скучные, а сюжетный квест очень короткий и примитивный.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098378302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1511147460}
review:
This has to be the worst Harvest Moon game I have ever played (and it's clear why). I've played all of the Harvest Moon games, with some of my favorites being on the Wii and Gamecube! Sadly, with the shift in company (the developers changing to Story of Seasons), the Harvest Moon series is being ruined by Capitalist greed.

XSEED has made some wonderful games with much better graphics and story than this; why would there be any reason that this game would be released with such an abysmal soundtrack, horrid graphics, and hardly any fun to be had? The reason is simple: the owners of the Harvest Moon title prioritized making a game quickly using a popular name; making it a horrible Capitalist dumpster fire with, what is it now, three or four items of DLC? 

This game is not worth $5 let alone over $30. They've only gone backwards. Buy a cheap Wii and a copy of Animal Parade, and don't waste your time with this soulless creation.

review:
I only bought this game because of my unhealthy obsession with Stardew Valley and was looking for something similar, but honestly, I'm really glad I bought it! Though I haven't even reached the 24 hour threshold yet, I seriously love games like this, even though they're basic as hell and all follow the same structure of "you farmer. plant crop. love animal. date small town boy. destroy market sales by selling stupid stuff like shells." I can't help but keep getting out of that pixelated bed and rushing out of my tiny house to go water my crops for the 105th time. I personally didn't know JACK about the Harvest Moon series before this, but now honestly, I'm really hoping to get into the series. 

(also why can u date soleil u literally witness his birth)

REGARDLESS I LOVE THIS GAME 10 OUT OF 10 WOULD WASTE TIME ON AGAIN

author: {'steamid': '76561198325546457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3304, 'last_played': 1573127024}
review:
We are used to ... better. Sorry, but with this part of the franchise Harvest Moon did not quite meet their own standards. I don't even think of thinks like "I'd like to marry someone of the same gender". 
The whole game feels rushed, quickly thrown together to earn some money with the name before everyone forgets there is a "Harvest Moon". As much as I loved the older parts (still playing Tale of two towns now and then) ... as much am I disappointed with this one. 
Can not recommend. 
Not even sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198221250036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 9506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6436, 'last_played': 1598883174}
review:
Love this game. 
It's not like the traditional harvest moon games, where you can do whatever you please. You must rebuild the town first, and complete the main story quests, involving the tablets before moving onto do your own stuff. The graphics are cute, it's easy to understand and i appreciate that each character is different. There's marriage, and birthdays and even the forest sprites and Harvest Goddess like the traditional HM. 

I grew to enjoy this game the more i played. The more you get into it, and progress through it, the story is cute and your missions become clear. You work for your tools, and upgrades are available. You're able to upgrade your house, barn, buy / sell animals, produce, animal products, etc.   Also cooking is an option in this game. 
Overall, I highly recommend if you're into the HM games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209831352', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7739, 'last_played': 1595508964}
review: Starting out in this game is so much fun; building everything, welcoming all of the villagers back, upgrading your tools/house, everything. However once you complete the main story it kind of goes downhill from there; yes there are still things to do, new crops to discover, get married, start a family, make friends, explore the mine, cook all the food, raise all the animals....the list goes on. If you are anything like me though you've done 99.99% of the things at some point in time during your main story. You've finished all of the villagers requests, you've gotten to the last floor of the mine, you've gotten to the point where you are getting married (haven't seen the marriage scene yet though), you've cooked most of the food, you have all the buildings built, you've upgraded almost everything to the max....basically been there, done that. Once you hit this point everything sort of becomes.....bland? You might log on here and there, put in an hour here and there but nothing like the hours you poured into it in the beginning. I wish they would have put more into the game, either in the main quests to make them harder or just other mini game type things to keep us busy, to pad out that time. I love this franchise and was super excited to play it on my computer, last decent game that I played was Animal Parade on the Wii. While I would still highly recommend this game as it is amazing and a fun addition to a beloved franchise, I would caution that it can be completed fairly quickly. If you are looking for a game with a lot of substance to it that will keep you hooked for a while I would recommend one of the other games (Animal Parade), but if you want a quick and fun title this one is a wonderful option.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181897943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2297, 'last_played': 1596754359}
review:
[b][i]"Harvest Moon: Light of Hope"[/i][/b] é um game bastante carismático e charmoso. Apesar da questão gráfica deixar um pouco a desejar, ( algo que muitos possam vir a  negativar sobre ) o conteúdo e jogabilidade do game compensam.

 Não há nada de extraordinário no jogo, tornado-o bem simples, porém, ele contem os elementos básicos nostálgicos marcantes que as franquias [i]"Harvest Moon"[/i] possuem e que qualquer fã saberia reconhecer e se apegar. Possui uma história e personagens bem simpáticos além de contar com uns sistemas levemente diferentes do que os fãs já conhecem e estão acostumados.

 Recomendo bastante esse game pra quem tem um apego por simuladores de farm e também para os fãs de coração♥ da franquia.

review: The game is good but the thing that bad is the stamina of the character. You get 5 hearts and cant do anything to regain stamina, only by eating food. You wake up at 6:00 AM and then have half a heart around 11:00 AM, you pretty much cant do anything in the game: you just take care of your crops and all your stamina is gone. No point in this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048811260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 8048, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7985, 'last_played': 1562220360}
review: I got this game because my kids and I all played the older versions of Harvest Moon and I did not realize that the two companies responsible for making and distributing the game had split. I started playing in and kept hoping it would get better. I played it for over a hundred hours thinking I must be missing something.. that it can't be this badly unbalanced. Farming makes you zero money because you have to spend so much on your crops to fertilize them and keep them alive. You have to mine in order to afford the crops seeds and fertilizers and half the time, its pointless because a storm will kill the crops even if they are fertilized. It is an incredibly grindy game and I wish I had stuck with Stardew Valley.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063536807', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1559517957}
review:
(shortened list of why no at bottom of comment)

Ok, so I bought this because it was recommended by a friend yes (only apparently they didn't play this version whoops! lol), however I can safely say I DO NOT recommend this game.
It is so SO boring. I do love these types of games, and yes I do own and play Stardew Valley which is basically heavily inspired/ripped off of (however to put it) from Harvest Moon games, BUT this particular game just pales in comparison.

It is (at least to me) not very clear on what to do, and it takes forever to do anything/earn profit (especially for a first timer), and you cannot skip cut scenes. Not being able to skip cut scenes is a sin in my book. Straight up sin!
The energy levels are piss poor, I understand they are going to be in the very beginning but even by beginners standards they are pretty crap.
And over all... I just do not have fun playing this game. I wish I could get a refund for it, but apparently I've just played it for 'too long'. Honestly I've only played it for 'so long', because I was waiting for that  'ah-ha moment', for why people enjoy it so much. Sadly, that did not occur.
I hope whoever does get this game enjoys it, but it is, by my standards, a big no.

A shortened list on why a big ol no:
1.) too slow
2.) cannot skip cut scenes which is an absolute sin imo
3.) not enough energy, even for beginners, just like one more heart would be good (again imo)
4.) directions are not clear at least not after when you're through "here's how to plant things", because then it just kinda drops you like naked baby in the woods and says HAVE FUN!
5.) because I'm so used to games like Stardew, Skyrim, etc. etc. allowing gay marriage/same sex relationships, it took by surprise this one doesn't so I'm like THIS BIGOTRY SHALL NOT STAND! lol xD

I'm glad for those who enjoy it, but me? No... not unless I'm tipsy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198302831327', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6789, 'last_played': 1559048259}
review:
The game is a fun game and I found it a bit similar to Castaway Paradise.

Pros
- cute graphics
- supports one-handed gameplay for the most part (except when using upgraded tools)
- most characters are likeable
- changeable clothes
- having to unlock areas makes it not overwhelming
- good for children
- requests make for more gameplay, I personally find it fun
- good soundtrack
- convenient (and creepy) map that tracks villagers' locations
- automatic selection of tools is convenient
- fun main storyline
- DLC

Cons
- basically Skytree Village for PC
- forced pace for gameplay during the main storyline due to items required
- I don't understand how Soleil can help
- heteronormativity
- Doc looks too different and is a bit creepy at first
- villagers don't walk places, they teleport
- too many qualities of products
- scenes not skippable
- constant load screens
- the only cat is the stray bobcat that can only be adopted after a house upgrade
- weird requirements for tool upgrades
- [spoiler] I thought that Nova was selfish for not thinking of the consequences of her actions and only focusing on what she wants [/spoiler]
- only 3 save slots

Overall, I'd recommend this game especially to kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170391373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2876, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2291, 'last_played': 1557972735}
review:
I was expecting a not very great game after reading the reviews, but I think it is as good as most other harvest moon games. I think people need to stop comparing Harvest Moon to Stardew Valley which was created by a completed different person/company. It has a new story line that takes a little bit of a different take with the same original game play as the others. One thing I especially like with this harvest moon is the option to complete personal tasks for each character as well as follow the main story line.

BOTTOM LINE:
- New to farming series and recently came upon Stardew Valley? You aren't going to find a game with more features than Stardew Valley
- All time harvest moon fan? Good selection to add to your collection

author: {'steamid': '76561198259205147', 'num_games_owned': 76, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1305, 'last_played': 1672069161}
review:

ถึงยังไง ใน เรื่องภาพ ยังถือว่าห่วย เพราะ เกมส์ STEAM ยุคนี้ ต้องปรับสุด ไปถึง FULL HD 1080P ขึ้นไป ได้แล้ว ไม่ใช่ ปรับสุดได้แค่ 720P

review: I'm always up for a Harvest Moon game. I found this one while very fun... very lacking. I finished the story in the first year of fall. I wish there was more events which they have done in previous game such as horse racing and the farm animal event for best animal, ect. Still fun but not the best Harvest Moon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200387321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 30826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13114, 'last_played': 1618321389}
review:
O jogo passa a impressão que não foi finalizado. 
O maior problema são os menus do jogo, estão mal organizados e pouco intuitivos, isso é agravado pela grande variedade de itens.
Quem jogou Stardew Valey vai sentir muita falta dos sprinklers, pois o regador cobre uma área muito pequena, plantar serve mais para as receitas e cumprir missões, pois é mais fácil ganhar dinheiro na mina. (tem uma DLC que melhora o regador, mas achei sacanagem)
O jogo parece não ser feito pensando nos fãs da franquia, a história é bem fraquinha e nesse quesito parece ser voltada exclusivamente para crianças. 
Enfim o jogo carece de alguns detalhes e por ser um jogo comemorando 20 anos da série faltou muitos elementos e mecânicas dos jogos anteriores que o deixaria mais agradável. 
O jogo não é ruim, mas não é tão bom com outros jogos da franquia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045895911', 'num_games_owned': 4200, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1943, 'last_played': 1555459317}
review:
This game is one of those where a neutral rating would come in handy.  It's not horrible, but I'm only in Fall of Year 1 and am getting bored.

Part of the problem is the tediousness of farming itself.  It takes forever to upgrade equipment, I've only managed to get the first upgrade so far, and I can still only hoe and water a total of three squares at a time.  Needless to say, I'm finding farming tedious, which is pretty much the biggest purpose of the game.  And, as far as I've read, there are no sprinklers implemented nor can you hire anyone to help with the work.  Currently, I also only have one chicken and one cow, and I kind of don't want to get more animals because I think it'll get just as tedious as the farming.

I could probably overlook these aspects more, but characters are just flat.  They say the same things over and over, and there's really no engaging story to draw you in and make you want to develop friendships.  As with the farming, I'm just a little bored with the people and feel like I'm just doing the same over and over and will continue to do the same over and over with little change--other than better and/or more stuff I can buy.

On top of that, instructions that are given are very sparse or just nonexistent.  An example of this was the mage who kept showing up in my house saying to meet the mages at the Goddess' Hot Springs--something I needed to do in order to progress the story.  I thought that meant I needed to fix the Hot Springs and then could progress.  No.  It was only by accidentally wandering into an area that I discovered the right place to go.  Then there's some gem sprite--Soleil I think.  Suddenly it emerged from a purple gem in my house.  What's he for?  I don't know.  By accident, clicking on the sprite's gem in the tool section of my menu, I discovered a whole new submenu where I could give the sprite gems for "help."  I have no clue what this help is.  I gave the sprite a gem and nothing seemed to happen.  I clicked on his gem home in my house, and it suddenly said "Do you want to end multiplayer?"  I clicked yes because what?  And then the sprite disappeared.  I had no clue if it was permanent or what, so I went back to a previous save. 

And then there's your bag.  You are limited in what you can carry--only 99 of each item until you can upgrade your house for storage.  I have no problem with this factor.  The storage factor that is frustrating, though, is the unknown limiter as to the overall number of different items you can carry.  What is that number?  No clue.  It's not as if you're given slots so you know just how many different items you have or that you're warned--hey, you have 52 of 75 items that you can carry.  Nope, you hit that too many item quota at inopportune times--like when completing a quest and getting a unique reward or when finding a new gemstone in the mine. . .  However, it doesn't tell you what's going on.  You just a get a message that says something like you have too many of this item in your bag.  So you try selling some of X item that you're currently harvesting, wondering why the game thinks you have too many when you only have 23.  Or it just won't let you create gems from ore and you have no clue why and think the game is broken. . .

At some point, I'll probably come back to this game, but only for little bits at a time.  With that in mind, I'll give this a hesitant thumbs up, but it's probably not a game that will completely draw you in and immerse you in the fictional world, which was what I was looking for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375575280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 43786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26235, 'last_played': 1560901481}
review: I have played many different versions of Harvest Moon, This one is as good as any. I love that there are additional bonus features that can be purchased for added play. However I would have loved to see a strong sickle added to deal with all the weeds and dead plants. Also I wish the Sprites were more interactive where like previous games, you could ask them to help around the farm, some could water plants others could care for the animals when you forget to or don't have time, or even that the different people could be hired to help once in awhile. If Soleil is included for special edition then the multiplayer feature should be adjusted for use on a keyboard for the PC version. I would change the way the grass seed was planted as well, instead of disappearing when you harvest it for food, it would simply grow back and if you didnt want it there anymore you could use the hoe, Also it would be more convienent if the tilled land would stay into the next day instead of having to do it over after those one time harvestables, Infact it would be much nicer if the veggies could all be multi harvestable...Overall this is really great game! Hope to see more Harvest Moon on Steam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198152741824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2656, 'last_played': 1561190385}
review:
First of all, as a HUGE Harvest Moon fan. I find this game to be the weakest in the series. Does that mean I dislike the game? Of course not, as you can see I've put several hours into this game. I found the game lacking alot of depth compared to the other previous harvest moon games. The game has alot of typos in the texts (which shows they didn't really put much thought into the game.) Another thought was the graphics...for being released to both PC and the Switch, the graphics are not that great compared to Animal Parade and Tree of Tranquity ( Excluding the 3DS HM).  I found little exploration in the game nor challenge. 

  Now on to the good stuff, I still found the game fun even with all the flaws. The classic Harvest Moon Farming,Fishing,Mining, and  Social interactions are still there. There are more crops to discover and requests from the towns people and the facial expressions are funny. Each character has their own quirky personality and isn't afraid to be a little weird. I am still playing this game and hopefully I can add more to the list of good things than negative. 

  In conclusion, I like this game. Is it the best? No, but it's still fun. I just wish for bigger Harvest Moon game with more charcaters and exploration and huge story progression (Harvest Goddess Etc.)Also, Yes I know about the company splitting up with the other company doing Story of Seasons. I really wish they'd work together again and make the ultimate Harvest Moon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198261417185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1564564368}
review:
I really miss harvest moon: new hope on playstation 1 so much that i immediately bought this game when i saw it on steam sales. Its quite nice even though i prefer the new hope one. But considering the graph, maybe you will enjoy this as i do. 
In this Harvest Moon, you must finish the main quest and restore the village building. The main quest itself not too hard, i finish the main quest on 2nd season. But i struggle in getting married cause i need to gift so much to the bride/groom. 
You can also buy DLC to expand the things you can buy in game or to make new quest or add new bride/groom choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305420735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2895, 'last_played': 1512510939}
review:
I've been a devoted fan for years, own 41 of the 43 games (including spin-offs, Story of Seasons, and Android apps). This is totally one of the SIMPLEST games the series has ever made. Some of the games are simple but work well because the play is good, characters are interesting and cutscenes and lore are entertaining (ie HM 64, HM Save the Homeland). 

This game feels like a step back from the potential the series should have unlocked after 20 years of game development. It's still a decent game and I enjoy it, but it's disappointing as a Harvest Moon game. 

Overly simple in an insulting way, weird graphics, ugly Harvest Sprites, weird child rearing spouse raising thing with the limited edition spiritual marriage candidate, and the plot can be beat far sooner than getting married. Money is way too easy to get just by mining, the crops mutation are sorta interesting but the fact that I was able to grow a summer flower in winter feels like cheating. The heart meter has always been my least favorite since its so hard to tell the exact energy you have. There's no calendar so I had no idea how many days a season lasted (35?? WTF?) The ridiculous size of the farm is pointless given you can grow all over the entire island. Weeds grow way too often for how much energy they take. Island map is way too small and very generic.

However, the game is easy to get a rythm and schedule for and the whole gathering items for the big item is very RPG and still entertaining. The heart events may be boring but still fun to trigger regardless. Making friends is easy and there is plenty of time in the day to farm, forge, and socialize. Hot springs for stamina are ALWAYS a plus. Kinda interesting how all wild flowers have the same graphic but can be registered as different flowers. I really appreciate when the HM series has wedding clothes, I like that you're involved in making them, it makes the wedding feel more real. You can customize things a little but not so much you stress over it. The game isn't too complicated so it's a nice way to relax and have fun without worrying about puzzles or clues. The side quests are kinda fun, usually you naturally progress those items anyway so it's not that inconvient to complete them.

Again, decent game as it is, did enjoy playing it through the story line, but as a Harvest Moon game its lackluster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049425896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2298, 'last_played': 1549843436}
review: Harvest Moon y su desarrollador Natsume siempre me sorprende y me deja en total adicción. Si esta versión es más rápido de terminar la historia principal, creo que faltó retomar un poco lo dificil de las versiones anteriores. El resto de las actualizaciones estan muy bien definidas, haciendo que el juego sea ameno. Me encantan los diseños de personajes y animales. Creo que faltaría volver a añadir cosas de las versiones anteriores. El resto, para los seguidores de esta saga. la recomiendo 100%
