author: {'steamid': '76561198294418896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 35593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5248, 'last_played': 1683255850}
review:
**Spoiler Alerts Possibly Below**

For this particular game, I would give it a 3.5/5 star rating.

It's very cute, definitely reminds me of old school Harvest Moon games, and was quite enjoyable. I went into the game not expecting it to be like Stardew Valley, especially considering that although both games incorporate similar gameplay, the developers are different, and I was correct.

As for the beginning of the game- washing up on an island after a storm- I detracted points for that. I recall that particular scenario from at least two different HM games (HM: Island of Happiness (exactly the same in that the character stays on the island and restores it) and HM: Tree of Tranquility (the character was moving there already and got washed ashore in a storm )), if not more.  The island itself is very gorgeous, I loved the graphics, though it did bug me that the wild flower 'marguerites' and 'tulips' looked excactly the same with broad white petals and a yellow center while the same flowers that were grown as crops looked completely different and neither one looked like the wild ones. Though when the wild versions of the flowers were picked it showed a version of the crop flowers? I don't get it, but okay. I liked having the mutation crops back, yay! A nice random surprise whenever it was time to harvest.

Most of the characters are very likeable. With that being said, here are my disliked characters- 1, Sally (I personally found her to be an annoying brat during the quest to get the axe- she promised to believe that the main character was indeed a farmer if they brought crops and then when that was done stated that they were probably stolen right in front of her mother and didn't even get a scolding for it!?! ) and 2, Doc! (I thought he was annoying and weird, not going to lie. I didn't like him in HM: Skytree Village, hasn't changed at all.) The mages were nice new characters to interact with and great new romance options.

There are clothing options but they are limited to 4 per character choice (male/female) and only available after restoring the lighthouse >.< And there is no option for changing the hairstyle :( Developers, if you are reading this, I would pay for more dlc to add hair styles and more clothing choices, seriously.  Melanie deserves more than just the six outfits she sells and why not add someone in who can do hairstyles? Or maybe one of the townsfolk has a hidden talent and is able to cut hair? I just find it really surprising that there is literally no one on the entire island who does hair styling considering how short some of the male characters keep their hair.

Another developer suggestion: please do a patch that prevents the main character from being forced back to the barn every single time an animal is purchased. It's annoying and frustrating. I saved and saved to buy two chicks and wasn't able to purchase both because I was running late on time and I got sent home with the shopkeeper and my first chick and didn't make it back in time. I know that the first time with the cow and sheep it's necessary because of getting the tools but after that? Especially with the chickens? Please consider changing that.

I managed to complete the main quest in about 3 weeks with intermitten play, planning on just playing through and doing requests. If I find anything unusual, I'll update this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313822946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1581118003}
review:
To start off, I purchased this game with all of it's DLC on sale for about 14.95$. Before I considered buying it, I heard that it was about 30$ and I wasn't even aware that there was DLC for a Harvest Moon game. I came into th Harvest Moon Franchise pretty late, and I have to say that this game does not give a good first impression to newer players. I haven't played through the entire game only because it does get painfully grindy which, in some cases, is good. I did not want to put in I don't even know how many hours into this game just to do a review. I do plan to play more because there is somewhat interesting content to enjoy, but this game is a good example of why I wish there was "Kinda" option in terms of recommendation. 

I have played one other game in the Harvest Moon Franchise, and that was A Wonderful Life. I have not played it properly whatsoever because the controls for me were really old school and it was hard to keep track of my stamina. However, I still got a feel for how the game worked, and honestly it was definitely a better game then this mobile port of a mess ever was.

The graphics are a mess. You have 3D characters in a 2D world. This works for certain games. I understand that this is a mobile port, so I get why that decision was made, but for a PC game, that doesn't look too good, and it's kinda off-putting. 

The other thing that's not very enjoyable is the dialouge. The tutorial is unskippable, and it takes almost 2 hours to complete which almost seems scammish because if you wanted to refund the game, you wouldn't be able to because you can't refund a game if it has 2 hours logged into it. You can't get a proper feel for the game until after you get the tutorial done, which again, is extremely scammish. This is probably one of the games I got during Christmas that I wanted to refund in the back of my mind but it was too late. So the only option I had was to keep playing it or just put it under the "Don't Bother" category in my library. 

The DLCs are a bit pointless. If anything they should already be in game. Why do I want to pay 2$ just to marry the King of the Underworld? Again, it is a bit scammish. It was a good thing I got the bundle on sale. It's nice to have these options for those who want those options, but putting a paywall on a small part of the game is annoying. I mean, for some, people already had payed 30$ for it, why do they want to pay more money for something that, again, should be part of the game already, especially if you're trying to get away with selling this game for a higher amount then the original mobile port. Seeing a 20$-30$ price tag might have made people think that the DLCs were part of the game already if they were just coming from mobile, so in that point of view, some people may have felt scammed in some way, shape or form. You either sell the game as a whole, or make it free to play if you want to throw some DLCs on it. DLCs work for some games, DLCs are supposed to be like an after thought of sorts. For this game however, it feels like they were planning the DLC whilst making the game. These things could have been just added while in the making, making it worth the price tag.

I've only been playing this game because it is a great time killer. Once you upgrade your tools, the grind is reduced. The game is still somewhat unbalanced however. You actually make more money from fishing and mining then you do with farming. For a Harvest Moon game, that is just wrong. Farming is deemed pointless on the terms of a source of income. You can still cook, and use the things you grow to upgrade your tools, fix buildings, and give gifts to the NPCs. 

Tutorials are unbalanced as well. They teach you everything you need to know about farming, the most horrible income source,yet they teach you nothing of the fishing or mining mechanics. Who was suppose to know they had to hoe the ground to actually progress through the mines? For me, fishing was a pain to understand because I didn't know when to click, is it when there was ripples in around the bobber, or when there was a exclamation point? Sooner or later I figured everything out, but for some people, that can make or break their purchase because they don't know if the game is broken or not because there is no direct explanation. Yes there's Tips/Tricks in the game, but for fishing, the explanation was too vague to understand.

Overall, this game is all over the place. It's not rewarding in some places, and it's possibly a scam in some way. I only recommend this game at discounted price, and if you see past the issues and are in need of a good time killler. Other then that, don't buy it. Stardew Valley is the best successor of Harvest Moon, so spend your money there instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041509086', 'num_games_owned': 344, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1546882174}
review:
No, no, no!

Where is the harvest moon of old where your grandpapa left you the family farm? Easy controls? ESTABLISHED VILLAGE!?
Really now, you have to run around repairing houses to get the people to come back after some storm?
Talk, load screen, done talking, load screen, enter building, load screen.

The dialog is laughable, the characters generic and pointless, nobody does anything except for you.
Really now. Forget this game and get Stardew Valley. 

A game created by one person utterly destroys this rubbish.


One question. Apart from two buildings, all the other buildings are destroyed and nobody else lives there.
Yet I can still put stuff in the box and someone comes along and buys it all.

WHO IS BUYING IT WHEN THERE IS NOBODY ON THIS GODFORSAKEN ISLAND!?

Seriously. 
Don't buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042938514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2159, 'last_played': 1548944327}
review:
EDIT: I changed to a positive review. All my negative comments are still relevant but I DID enjoy playing even after the annoying mechanics. I especially like that after you beat the main storyline, you get "extras" so to say. I wish Steam allowed a better rating system as I don't feel the game should be positive or negative. Really in the middle. 

I hate leaving negative reviews and I will change it if things get better, but right now I am not loving this game.

The story is fine, I like the variety of crops and animals but I cannot get past the mechanics and slow loading times. They take away from the fun. The watering can upgrade is terrible. You have to get it just right on the squares to water 3 at once. Maybe I am missing something but how it is now it takes me way too long to water all my crops. The hoe also is frustrating to use when upgraded. 

The mines are okay but I wish it didn't take so long to find a ladder. 

THE LOADING TIMES. It takes way too long to go from one screen to the next. It is like I am playing on a mobile phone. 

Like I said, if these things improve I will update my review. I am continuing to play until I complete the game so maybe my opinion will change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079519572', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4024, 'last_played': 1546881472}
review: Definitely by far one of my favorite Harvest Moon games within the Franchise. I have played several many across different consoles and found this one to be within my top 2; the story is intriguing; the characters amusing and a very good variety to choose among to pick your partner, and probably most interesting of all is additional content (DLC), which was a first experience in my Harvest Moon adventures. There are also other little factors that truly draw you in, for example, being able to change clothes (which I think could be a first--or is most definitely a first for me), as well as alter the decorations within your home. I'm use to Harvest Moon: A Wonderful Life, my absolute by far favorite so this definitely fits right up next to it. I extremely recommend to newcomers and especially to Harvest Moon casuals!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998197307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1578036131}
review:
I loathe the fact that I actually love this game. Dang nabbit.

Edit: What I really love about this game are the characters. Now, Stardew Valley definitely is the most refined in comparison to Harvest Moon LoH; it has better mechanics, better visuals and a much more expansive world. However, me being me, I'm a sucker for fun characters. This is where Harvest Moon LoH wins in this regard and is the sole reason as to why I play this over Stardew Valley, unfortunately. 

And of course I'm going to be comparing this game to Stardew Valley; Stardew Valley is the game that single handedly dominated Harvest Moon fans and any fan of Agricultural RPGs. 

Now, this is not to say that I dislike Stardew Valley; in fact, I love Stardew Valley. It's just like, at least to me, what's the point of being in a town where the word "edgy" can describe literally like 5 residents of the whole town? The word "grumpy" can describe at least 4, I believe. And there are only about 24 people in the whole town. Harvest Moon has fun, quirky characters; It's got a witch, a wizard, a family of, what I believe to be, ninjas, dorky little fairies (that personally make me grind my teeth in frustration from the "kawaii"), hot moms, some demon chick, and, apparently, you can bang the Harvest Goddess. 

Now the game plays like a mobile game, in fact, I believe that this game was made with mobile devices in mind, as evidenced with Harvest Moon LoH being available on the app store (it's also on the ps4, which is kind of hilarious; really hilarious actually). To the core it's a mobile game and that's the reason why people are always commenting about it looking like a mobile game; it's because it is one, it's on the app store. The design pholosophy fits that of a mobile phone. For instance, you can click wherever you want to go and your character runs towards the specified spot (that I like a lot), and you can click and drag your mouse to control the character, much like how you can press and hold your finger against a touch screen and drag towards a specific direction to make your character move.

Again, this game is far, far, FAR inferior when compared to Stardew Valley. The controls aren't the best, the graphics, while nostalgic for me since it reminds me of old anime-esque games I would play when I was a shota, are less than appealing (borders disgusting, actually), the mining is tedious, gathering materials is such a chore (you only get one wood or stone per mining or foraging respectively, i'm not kidding...), it's priced at a significantly higher price than Stardew Valley, literally no character customization at all (what? why? the protag is silent anyway, so why NOT give me the option to make a character?), selling items is such a hassle (you have to click on the number box to switch from the hundreds to tens to ones and you have to click on the up and down arrows to increase or decrease the number of items you want to sell. This  obviously could've been handled better, but again, , this game is made with mobile devices at heart.), no notifications or sound cues to tell you your character is almost out of stamina (messed up and passed out a couple of times from this. I'm not always going to be looking at the stamina bar, given that I'm more than likely going to be doing other things while playing this kind of game), things are hotkeyed to pretty inconvenient keys and you can't change them (fantastic design choice 10/10), the buttons for the XBox controller doesn't go away regardless of whether or not you're playing with a controller, you can't mod it (as far as I know)...

Wait, why did I thumbs up the game again?.... Oh yeah... I'm a sucker for fun characters...

But jokes aside, avoid this game; don't buy it unless it's on sale, and even then be cautious. This game isn't worth the money. The only reason why I have it is because of the Christmas Sale. If I were you, i'd watch a LongPlay of the game first before deciding whether or not the game is truly worth your money. Decide for yourself whether or not you want it; don't just jump on the bandwaggon without knowing why. Hell, you might just like the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113553317', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1004, 'last_played': 1622688853}
review:
I've played an hour of this game and I can already say that I love it. It's a bit different than other HM games, but not so much that someone who's played them for years would be turned off entirely. 
This brings back pleanty of memories for me. It's very similar in style to many versions of HM that I've played.
I see a few reviews talking about the long tutorial. This is completely normal and on brand for Harvest Moon. Every Harvest Moon game I've played has a very long tutorial, and usually you can't skip them. It's annoying, but just something that you deal with if you like Harvest Moon. 
The loading is a tad annoying, but I wouldn't say that it'd ruin the game, or even make me wan't to not reccomend it. However, if you're completely new to Harvest Moon, I might suggest you try console first (Save the homeland is my favourite.) For someone who's played previous Harvest Moon games, this would be amazing. It just seems like it wouldn't be the best introduction to the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091299045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 5123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3108, 'last_played': 1545883071}
review:
This is a wonderful addition to the harvest Moon name that being said there was a very strong pros and cons to this game.
Pros: context sensitive tool use that makes it unnecessary to switch between a tool every time, a list that memorizes all the villagers birthdays likes and dislikes automatically for you, the coop assistant that more or less shortcuts everything for you (he or she is its own upgraded 3 by 3 hoe and watering can), and the horse is pretty damn fast compared to some of the horses in the past. 
Cons: The character graphics and music are sorely lacking- it's hard to look at a character's face and decide you want to marry it unless you splurge for the DLC bachelor/bachelorette. The music is so repetitive and poorly composed that it's not really worth listening to, especially in the mines where it becomes maddening quick. The Cicadas in the summer CAN'T BE MUTED. The festivals are hard to plan around especially since there is no calendar to look at in-game to help you plan it just notes on the bookshelf that you have to individually select to research the days. And the coop is a bit of a nightmare to use if you're a single player: either you need to map your controller configuration to two separate characters or use the controller and keyboard interchangeably to get the job done. I get the impression that the NPC characters are so bland and archetyped that I might not bother befriending them. 
 Finally, and this is just personal opinion, the gem Spirit doesn't do anything for me. It resembles a floating baby [spoiler] I can't imagining wanting to marry its adult form [/spoiler]. 

Otherwise a pretty solid game that I anticipate sinking a good amount of hours into

author: {'steamid': '76561197983761821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1465, 'last_played': 1544313259}
review:
20+ hours of fun. The constant loading screens (about 5 seconds each, happens once or twice on map change) and really bad menus (like in Skyrim) make it feel like the worst possible pc port possible. On top of that, you need a controller and a keyboard in order to play the "bonus" content.
If you don't mind waiting forever and have a controller nearby, play it. It's Harvest Moon after all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004701958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1545849813}
review:
One important thing a lot of reviewers aren't saying, and what makes this a yes, is that the characters and story are just a lot more solid within the scope of Harvest Moon games. The game pace is a bit faster, and so are the chances to interact. This is a mobile port, but not all mobile games are arcade/cheap/quick-money-grabs. Think of the Final Fantasy ports and some of the more popular PC games that are psuedo casual that were ported to mobile. It's really just the other way around in this case, as this is a full-length game with just as much content as any other Harvest Moon. 
I DO NOT like the art style very much, but it's not the end of the world. I like the gameplay, and the speed of the game, and the fact that I can just click a tree and start chopping without worrying about having an axe. Or click a rock, and I break a stone. The up-close portraits of the villagers faces are animated and a little bit funny sometimes. I wouldn't have expected that from the screenshots of the game. 
In the older Harvest Moons, the plot and story are so lackluster and just kind of drag. Chores are repetitive and the world becomes this big place you just have to traverse to no end, over and over again.  World is a little smaller here, the tasks are less tedious, and you can just get through a day, a week, a season, a lot more casually. 
I would say this game is fun, and well-paced, and tries to change things up. It's not cumbersome AT ALL, and I'm enjoying the characters. That's enough to recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113535453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1543443289}

author: {'steamid': '76561198024372987', 'num_games_owned': 244, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5183, 'last_played': 1540439732}
review:
This game was greaaaaaaaat at first.
It took me till about fall day 10 to finsih the main story line
It took me about till 2nd year summer to get married (I was hopeing shirlock would be my option but getting notes to level 5 seems so un-even in this game [gave over 20 gifts not a single note increase not even a half] so i just went with the wizard because he was my 2nd choice)
If you actually follow the games proper way of playing you take good care of your animals, and i struggled getting 2 great wool because it wouldn't accept any higher quality for the quest to get married (Yes this annoyed me)
I wanted to get the achievements for everything in this game BUT for the harvest all and fish all you have to go through this extreme breeding process for even a harvest moon game and there are too many crops for this just look it up theres around 10-15 crops per season some needing to be pre-breeded from pervious year seasons its a pain.
The soilel multiplayer option made this game in the beginning easier. I loved that, i used my controller to help me and get more stanima in the beginning at the beginning
I wanted to get the grown up child achievement : nope, 90 days worth of game play to grow up a child. Have to wait an hour each day to feed said child (required to grow up) so 90 minutes of game play even if your rushing if not like 180 minutes.
This game as a harvest moon game felt empty because of the fact that you cannot make decent money off crops you need to use the mines for money. the story is so easily completed. the requests dont come in equal quanities for villagers, i only started getting requests from new villagers when started IGNORING the normal villagers.
They could have done so much beter if you want a better harvest moon please go play the games by the orginal creators of harvest moon as harvest moon is copyrighted in the usa and is now story of seasons. 

SOrry for the long review. I liked the game at times i hated it at other times. I also wont be playing anymore. I would not suggest it to friends. 

TLDR: If you loved old harvest moons do not get this it will not satisify you as a harvest moon fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062820824', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1256, 'last_played': 1537766371}
review:
Unglaublich schlechtes und billiges Game. Haben sich vor 20 Jahren den Namen "Harvest Moon" gesichert ( Natsume)
und machen jetzt Geld mit dem Namen und der Unwissenheit der Spieler.

In diesem Game lohnt es sich nicht etwas an zu pflanzen. In der Mine Erze farmen, geht 100mal schneller.
Die Story ist lahm und die Steuerrung sehr bescheiden. 

Ich würde dieses "Spiel" auf keinen Fall weiter empfehlen. Kauft euch lieber die Richtige Harvest Moon Reihe vom Entwickler Marvelous. z.b den Titel "Story of Seasons".

author: {'steamid': '76561198038520471', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1606599612}

author: {'steamid': '76561198063650068', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1579625880}
review:
The Harvest Moon series has seriously gone downhill since Animal Parade... A new Beginning was alright, but jeez...
All I can say about this game is either you like it or you hate it. I'm still very mixed in whether I like it or not. It reminds me of Seeds of Memories and another Harvest Moon game that I flat out hated...

author: {'steamid': '76561198095407359', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1550074650}
review: I've played Harvestmoon  since I was a kid. It's memorable memories. HM Back to nature on PS1, HM friends of mineral town on GBA Simulator. It was almost 10 years ago that I haven't played this series. Now I have a chance to play again. I'll continue to play this game. It's awesome, a lot of new things to discover. This is a peaceful game that I can relax after hard-work day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083135966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5060, 'last_played': 1538989775}
review:
I disliked the extremely long, non-skippable cut scenes.  That was very boring, and didn't even lead to choices you could make to affect your own game.

The animation for farming/plowing/watering was tedious, and energy management isn't given many options early in the game.  There is very little food, for example, that you might recharge your stamina with.

Playing on PC with a keyboard/mouse, I was not able to figure out how to make upgraded tools (hoe/watering can) function in their advanced capacity.  "hold the action button" did not work.
Edit: I was able to make the advanced tools work only after changing my action button to space bar instead of left mouse click.

There seems to be basically only one way to play this game, and it's very linear.  There would be no reason to replay it after finishing it once.  There is little chance for alternative challenges.

The game mechanic of crop mutations looked like it had potential for interest, but there seemed never to be a purpose to growing mutated crops other than acheiving a complete encyclopedia in game.   If grindy completionist goals aren't appealing to you, that would be very boring.

I was not able to find a decent wiki for this game.  The apparently official game wiki I did find only mentioned this edition of the game in passing, and did not give details of how to play it or understand its particular challenges.  

I would not recommend this game to anyone.  I put dozens of hours of play into this game hoping to give it a fair shake because I had always heard good things about Harvest Moon, so you can't say I wasn't fair in trying to let it show its best side to me.  But now I believe all the good reviews I heard were put forth by people who just never saw a better game.   Anyone who has ever played Stardew Valley will know it is vastly superior in every way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077516154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 12017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 452, 'playtime_at_review': 2257, 'last_played': 1712116541}
review:
Let me preface this by saying I've played alot of Harvest moon games. (I mean - almost ALL of them, across several different platforms)  And this game will probably be the last one.
I cannot recommend this game, either to old HM vets or newer players.
The TL;DR version:
Price too expensive, gameplay very bland; Stardew Valley does it better. (albiet the graphics are ancient)

The cons: This will likely be a personal view, but here goes: 
1) The characters are a directly from Skytree Valley, which is doubly disappointing since this is the 20th anniversary. A few new faces are not going to make it feel like a new game.
2) The trash outside your home regrows too fast. You can pluck the weeds and mine the stone, but it comes back waaaaay too fast. If you chop a tree, it should stay gone for weeks. There's a lot trees in other parts of the map.
3) Characters are lack luster, the dialogue never seems to change, even when their heart levels are up. After a while, I just gave up talking to anyone, which is a shame, because keeping heart levels up should be rewarding, feel like progression -  not feel like a chore.
4) Small bugs still exist (like handing in a quest item to Carol, but you get Gus who replies) 
5) The summer ambiance (Skytree suffered from this too) - There's an insect or something making an awful racket, I turn off the sounds until summer was over.
6) Time stops indoors. This is especially annoying when you have to wait outside the barn for animals to eat. (like an hour)
7) Mining - this is where all the money comes from, not farming (which seems counter-intuitive for a farming game.)
8) Requests from villagers come in the mail, which is the most unsocial way possible.
9) The mutation effect on crops carried over from Skytree is just as clunky, and frankly, not needed.
I could go on, but I think I've made my point.

Pros?
1) I like the upgraded tools and the way you can 'steer' them. An upgraded tool can operate in a zigzag line, which is handy.
2) Lots of areas for farming, once you get the tools to clear the way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341398555', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1660, 'last_played': 1536463932}
review:
เกมส์สนุกนะ แต่ยังเจอบัคอยู่ ที่เจอก็จะเป็น บัคฝักไข่ลูกเจี๊ยบ อยากให้แก้ตรงนี้หน่อย และบางที ถ้าจะกดให้ของ แล้วกดรัวๆ มันก็จะเจออาการเออเร่อ ซึ่งทำให้ต้อง ออกเกมส์เข้าใหม่ ถ้าไม่เซฟนี่ ก็เล่นใหม่ยาวๆ 
ปล. น่าจะทำไอเท็มที่มัน รดนำ้ได้ ออโต้ออกมาหน่อยก็ดีนะ จะได้เอาไปวางไว้ ในหุบเขาส่วนที่ห่างไกลจากตัวบ้านตัวละครหลัก และจะดีกว่านี้อีกหน่อยถ้าวิ่งเร็วกว่านี้ 
ใครชอบเกมส์แนวนี้ก็ซื้อได้เลย มีปลูกฝัก เลี้ยงสัตว์ เพาะพันธ์สัตว์ หัวใจเยอะก็ขายได้แพง หาแร่ ตกปลา ปลูกดอกไม้ อื่นๆ

author: {'steamid': '76561198056232611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1535760028}
review:
While not the best Harvest Moon installment, it certainly isn't the worst. If I could give a 50/50 recommendation I would.

At the start, it can be quite difficult to get the ball rolling, as the saying goes "gotta spend money to make money" seems to be turned up to 11 at first. But to be completely fair, it was quite rewarding to finally see the village complete. 

Not sure if it is a pro or a con for this one, but every bachlorette, with the exception of one, loves the same item, and its not exactly a difficult one to find either. This made that aspect of the game feel almost too easy, but hey, some people might like it, others wont. (I only played as a male character, so I'm not sure if this applies to the guys as well) Theres also the whole thing of when you go to let the barn animals outside, they seemingly pop up at random around the farm. Good luck getting them all in the same pen in a timely manner.

Now then, it gives off a strong vibe of being a mobile port (hell, in the tutorial it even says touch the screen and drag to move, guess we shouldn't be too surprised considering its Natsume, and they spelled their own name wrong in HM64). While not a game killer, I sure do wish they atleast touched up the graphics some.

P.S.
Turn off sound effects in the summer. Because my god that cicada never shuts up. You're welcome in advance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036031724', 'num_games_owned': 105, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1534528370}
review:
I'll be honest, this game is hit or miss. For anyone, Harvest Moon fan or not.

This is a different approach to any of the other Harvest Moon franchise and I'm not really that keen on it. Usually, used to meeting the mayor or someone who was a friend of your grandfather. Instead, you just wash ashore and found by a random villager who just helps you and shows you an unused farm.

Having to pay out of your own pocket to restore the village is a new one for me, and to which it's a pain. The beginning is painfully slow due to this. Restoring places, and if you restore the wrong building its another day or more before you can progress on with the storyline. When you finally can progress it just feels like things move fast, so I've been kind of prolonging advancing the storyline and just kind of focusing on befriending the villagers I guess.

Talking about the villigers, the good thing about Light of Hope is it seems faster on raising their friendship level. I guess having the requests really does help progress their levels. 

Having no calender in this game sucks so much, holy heaps. I mean, I can't be the only one who really relied on the calender that was provided to keep tabs on birthdays and especially keep tabs on whatever festivals were going to be happening, right? This is kind of the biggest thing that I am annoyed with in the game. I need the calender for the love of that there is.

The mining in this game is pretty ridicluous. The income on the gems just breaks the game for you there. I feel cheated on how easy I was able to almost find all the gems and material from the first day I got the hammer. Forget buying the seeds just go all mining. Like the other Harvest Moon games, different floors of the mining gave you specific ores. Nope! Not in Light of Hope. Just find Jade on level 2 out of 100. Refine the ore and sell it for 2,000 gil. Broken.

I don't really know what else to say. I'm only about 13 hours in the game and I'm just slowly prolonging from advancing for awhile. Let's not forget though that Yasuhiro Wada did not help with the making of the game since he left in 2010, so it's most likely why the game has an off vibe to it. I'll probably give an update after I possibly played more of the game.

I wish I could give this a kind of reccommendation instead of the full yes or no.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149010607', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1547919550}
review:
I played one of the first harvest moon and nothing in between. Let me say this: It is different. It remebers a DS game and it is weird to play it on the PC. It lacks a lot when you get into the game: Mining is odd and most of the time you don't know what to do.

You cannot compare this HM to other HM titles since its a total stand alone. "It apparently draws heavy inspiration from the first Harvest Moon game. It is the first Harvest Moon title to be available on PC." Let's hope further updates will adjust the game better for the PC.

Playing with a controller is recommended. 

Further language support would be a big plus for the future and a overhaul for the UI since it is a bit very basic and lean very strong to console gaming. It is nothing special and who played stardew valley and other harvest moon games knows already what to do. It is very "japanese" in a sense of their facial expression and character humor. Very easy to understand.

review: Cute, relaxing farming game. The "main story" is very short, I finished it in about 40-45 in game days so mid summer year 1. Like all HM games there is lots more to do after the story is finished. As far as comparing it to other games in the franchise it isn't my favorite, but I'm still enjoying playing very much and am really excited to see a harvest moon game on steam! This would be a good entry game to the series if you've never played one before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035869337', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1666, 'last_played': 1600148258}
review:
Everyday since the GameCube was replaced, I asked my mother, "Will there be a good harvest moon coming out this year?"  She looks at me, tearfully, and utters, "I do not know."  Every year wishing for this brings me one year closer to the abyss.

If you're a casual gamer and have the IQ of a shovel or higher, you'll like this game. *
*(Playing with a normal or above normal IQ, experience may vary)

This is what gets me--If you're looking for Harvest Moon 64 or even Friends of Mineral town series, just go download Stardew Valley.

Also the graphics are extremely basic (using the same icon for foraging and such)
This is a console game port, pretty much.  I prefer the keyboard, so I didn't like that all of the instructions being buttons.

I would not recommend, as I am taking the whole Harvest Moon series into account.

Someday I hope they will make a game to end this existential nightmare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268366281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16107, 'last_played': 1568714410}
review:
I have only played Harvest Moon: (More) Friends in Mineral Town and Harvest Moon: Hero of Leaf Valley before so my review is primarily relative to those two versions of Harves Moon.

[b]OVERALL RATING: 6.7/10 [/b]

[olist]
[*] STORY (6.5/10): The start of the story is kinda cringey and unrealistic [spoiler]because your character just got washed up in that island during a storm then the next thing you know is that you're staying in the island to help bring back the people and restore it to its former glory.[/spoiler] It also became more of a fantasy genre (with all the magical stuff in the story) than the two versions that I have played. However, the good thing about this version is that you would somehow feel and keep track of the progression of the story since they would actively give you things to do for the story to move on.

[*] CHARACTERS (5/10): The characters are nice but I feel like they are lacking in story. I would love it more if there's more story behind each character and their relationships with each other (like in friends of mineral town). You also don't really feel getting close to people that much based from interactions unless you check out the relationship bars (musical notes in this case). You won't also feel the rivalry between you and the potential partners of your love interests.

[*] GAMEPLAY (8.2/10): Gameplay is good for me but let me break it down in different aspects.

[list]
[*] Farming (9.5/10):
They made things easier for you to grow your farm (except the weeds are annoying and you don't have a sickle to cut all of them at once) and there is a huge land where you can farm. Aside from that, the crop mutation is great that it would make you feel that you really are managing a farm.

[*] Rebuilding Island and Villager Requests (9/10):
I like how you have something to do everyday. [spoiler]At the start of the game, you won't have access to the entire island and you would have to rebuild things first to expand and unlock more areas.[/spoiler] Aside from that, villagers would keep giving you requests for you to accomplish. It basically keeps on giving you some goals that you need to achieve as you keep playing the game.

[*] Events/Festivals (6/10):
There are just a few events and for me, they are not as challenging as the ones provided by the other versions. I especially liked the chicken fight, horse race, and dog frisbee in the more friends in mineral town. Even the cooking festival is not as challenging here.
[/list]

[*] GRAPHICS and SOUNDTRACK (7/10):
The graphics and animation is just fine but they are not really the best ones either. As for the soundtrack, I believe that it is fairly similar to the other versions and generally suits the overall feels of the game.
[/olist]

To sum it up, it's not really the best version of Harvest Moon out there just like what others have pointed out. However, I would still recommend because it is just a chill game and is nice for killing some time. Besides, completing all of the steams achievements for this version is challenging enough and for perfectionists and goal-oriented players like me, it helps me develop my focus and strategy skills in achieving the goals set by the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294267760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2000, 'last_played': 1530799111}
review:
Also, ich kann mich vielen negativen Kommentaren anschhließen. Das reich werden mit der Miene hat nichts mehr mit Harvest Moon zu tun. Wie schon mal von jemanden erwähnt, nach 5 Minuten in der Miene kommst du als reiches Püppchen raus, was das anpflanzen von Obst und Gemüse total Sinnlos macht weil man damit kaum Geld verdient. Genauso wie das halten der Tiere. Das was eigentlich Harvest Moon ausmachte, das Farmleben, wird zu einem reinen Bergarbeiter Spiel. Das hat nichts mehr mit Harvest Moon zu tun. 

Ich hab es mir geholt da ich dachte, dass es vielleicht was werden könnte, nein ist es aber nicht. Vorallem in den Bergen wenn du dort herum läufst verzehrt sich das Bild etwas und das ist sehr unangenehm für die Augen. Die Grafik ist aus der letzten Tonne geholt und die 3D animationen waren auch mal deutlich besser. 

Das man alleine eine Insel aufbauen soll, die eigentlichen Bewohner gar nix machen und sich lieber aus den Staub machen, finde ich doch sehr zweifelhaft und nicht gut durchdacht. Noch dazu wollen sie immer wieder etwas von dir und geben dir zum dank das du ihr Haus/ Laden wieder aufgebaut hast, einfach nichts. Das Spiel zeigt immer wieder ein "nehmen aber nichts geben" was ich sehr schade finde. Noch dazu finde ich blöd, wenn man einen Auftrag fertig hat und einen Bewohner die Sachen geben will, man manchmal gefühlt Minuten lang suchen oder sogar warten muss weil man die Person gar nicht findet, nicht mal auf der Karte. Wo sind die denn dann? Spontan mal eben weg gefahren mit dem Boot? Denke ich nicht. Das ist auch wieder nicht gut durchdacht. Die sind an Orte wo du noch gar nicht hin kannst weil WEGE VERSPERRT SIND und du die erst frei schalten musst, wo ich mich frage, wie kommen die denn dannn da hin?

Noch dazu war jedes Harvest Moon Spiel auf Deutsch und dieses ist auf Englisch was auch nicht für das eigentliche Harvest Moon spricht. Es ist einfach nur reine Geldmacherei mit dem Namen mehr nicht. Holt euch lieber Story of Season oder Stardew Valley oder jedes andere Harvest Moon Spiel. Die sind zu 100% besser als das hier. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198197373050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18678, 'last_played': 1531190429}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065471546', 'num_games_owned': 2045, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1530042306}
review:
Nur weil Harvest Moon draufsteht, ist noch lange nicht Harvest Moon drin.

Natsume ruht sich auf seinen Namensrechten an Harvest Moon aus und rotzt ein Spiel hin, dass sowieso jeder kauft (inklusive mir, lol) weil Harvest Moon draufsteht.

Die Screenshots sprechen schon genug dafür, warum man das Spiel nicht kaufen sollte.
Die [b]Grafik sieht absolut scheußlich aus[/b], die 3D-Modelle bzw. generell die Grafiken des Spiels wurden [b]tausend mal recycelt[/b] und sind ebenfalls auf Spielen auf dem 3DS oder auf dem Smartphone zu finden.

[b]Mit farmen verdient man kaum Geld[/b]. Geht man 5 Minuten in die Miene, kommt man als reicher Dude wieder raus. Das verfehlt ein wenig den Sinn hinter einem Farming Spiel.

Und außerdem, warum schafft es eine Person, [b]ein komplettes Dorf wieder mit Materialien aufzubauen[/b], der Rest der Anwohner macht aber keinen Finger krumm, obwohl es doch "so schade ist, dass alle wegegezogen sind und es so toll wäre, wenn alle Bewohner wieder herziehen"? Also da würde ich auch nicht wohnen wollen.

[b]Wer ein wirkliches Harvest Moon von den ursprünglichen Entwicklern spielen will, sollte sich Story of Seasons für den Nintendo 3DS anschauen. DAS ist Harvest Moon. Nicht dieses Spiel, das nur zu geldmacherei dient.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198054970909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1593046507}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062577311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1577284389}
review:
Ein Schlag ins Gesicht für jeden Harvest Moon Fan...
Seit Marvelous die Spiele nicht mehr entwickelt ging es mit der Harvest Moon Reihe denn Bach runter. 
Eigentlich habe ich gehoft man nimmt sich endlich mal ein Vorbild an Spielen wie Stardew Valley oder 
Story of Season (welches von denn original Entwickler der Harvest Moon Reihe stammt).
Aber man ging wohl davon aus das die Leute dumm genug sind das Spiel nur wegen den Namen zu kaufen.

Die Grafik ist so schlecht das man meinen könnte das selbst Harvest Moon - Back to Nature eine bessere Grafik hatte.
Das anbauen und verwalten des Hofes wird komplet zur Nebensache da man einfach nur Erze farmen muss um an Geld zu kommen. Nur um mal ein paar der Fehler des Spieles zu nennen.

Tut mir leid aber ich bin als Harvest Moon Fan absolut enttäuscht und rate jedem ab dieses Spiel zu kaufen.

review: I feel terrible for giving a harvest moon game a thumbs down. I love the HM series, it's my absolute favorite. I was over the moon when I saw this game and didn't hesitate to spend the money on it. It felt lacking, I'm not really sure how else to put it, there's no replay value in it for me either. author: {'steamid': '76561198067064990', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2369, 'last_played': 1548395750}
review:
Let me start this with, "Don't bother with those kids with their knickers in a bunch that the original team didn't work on this."
I got the game early on and those reviews were daunting, but I ignored them and am glad I did.

I've actually enjoyed this as another Harvest Moon.
You farm, you mine, you fish, you cook, you find someone to settle down with, do periodic festival stuff, and you can go hardcore completionist and collect everything if you're into that. It's standard for the series. It has its differences, but at the end of the day it's another Harvest Moon game no matter what people tell you. It doesn't need to evolve into a complex monster and become a farming simulator. It's simple and cute farming fun and that's what matters.

The story can be completed very quickly if you choose, but story has never been a major staple of Harvest Moon games 
anyhow. It's always been a fun little side thing to give you a reason to be there farming and that's about it. 

My major quarrel is the lack of information sometimes can leave you in the dark wondering what to do next or how to get a certain item, which I feel may be discouraging to more casual gamers - don't be afraid to look things up online  if you find yourself in a jam. Or needing jam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087605990', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1514593888}

Die Geschichte ist leider auch sehr oberflächlich und schnell erzählt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041188414', 'num_games_owned': 2383, 'num_reviews': 329, 'playtime_forever': 807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 807, 'last_played': 1513310117}
review:
I grew up on Harvest Moon and I really miss the team that used to work on it. After A New Beginning (2012), the Harvest Moon series has grown a bit stale. The team that worked on the Harvest Moon series started working on Story of Seasons which is a really good series. If you want a good Harvest Moon like game, check out Story of Seasons on 3DS or Stardew Valley on all platforms. 

Light of Hope once again recycled the same characters that Natsume has been using for the past 4 Harvest Moon games and this one feels more like a mobile port than anything. I am enjoying the story in this game but I am pretty disappointed that the rest of the game is basically recycled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273735257', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2230, 'last_played': 1513217435}
review:
I enjoyed playing through this game though I do have some gripes with it. I did not play other games like Skytree Village that have similar characters and skins. I can undstand why the community rejected the reproduction of them. I do not think a price tag of $30+ is justified on this game. A game needs to feel new and completely different with occational nastolgia being okay. I think reusing  characters was a bad move. The game needed more character customization to get rid of the same plain look. I liked the bright colors of the game even if the graphics disappointed.

One thing that is enjoyable is the simplicity of the tool actions for farming, it cuts time and allows for easier mass farming which allows to farm more without it feeling like a hassel every game day. However, the profit coming out of the mine needs to be tuned down a litttle to keep it on par with farming. Being able to rush the mine everyday for instant profits does take away from spending days farming. Some people like to fish, some farm, some mine so all aspects need to be rewarding as equally as possible.

Another positive I found was the rate you could befriend the towns folk was great. Sometimes in the harvest moon games it takes too long to befriend people and I won't even bother with them all but the rate was good in this game. 

Lastly, the story line for this game felt too short. I purposely delayed pushing the story at points because I was flying through it. If I can beat the game before 1 calendar year I don't like it, there is not enough challenge. To those looking to buy the game just know this isn't a long game.

I will recommend playing the game as a loyal harvest moon fan to experience it yourself and judge. I'd give it a 3/5.

I hope the next game is more impressive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084941880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1628728140}

author: {'steamid': '76561198243821536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4025, 'last_played': 1555750175}
review:
Para comenzar...no, no es malo pero pondre cosas que considero importante si desear tenerlo...:
 
la carencia de horas de tiendas (me refiero al minimapa al solo mostrar si hay gente..es si sirve pero no comprementa mas de lo que uno aprende al jugar).
una musica literalmente un bucle...cuando cambia de hora solo cambia el tiempo de reproduccion.
no hay un calendario asi que cada vez que quieras saber algo al respecto de algun personaje es entrar al menu y tener en mente los datos.
personalmente no me gusto el sistema de recopilar dinero...es demasiado facil se puede sacar todo en menos de mitad del 1er mes del juego

bueno se rescata algo la animacion y que los personajes son los que te diran si quieren enganchar...
actualmente no veo actualizaciones y veo que su edicion fisica tendra mas cosas como casarse con la diosa entre otros eventos, eso en verdad me molesto demasiado siendo que espere que saliese aca...asi que si tienen consola y el dinero...solo haganme caso...

comprense la edicion fisica tendra mas cosas que aca no,valdra mas la pena.

sino tampoco es malo si deseas tenerlo solo digo que hay otros juegos que dan mas por menos...

author: {'steamid': '76561198379048330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1516706748}
review:
I played harvest moon for years and i also played stardew valley. If you are a veteran like me - you loved the cliche "grandpa gave you a farm and you must rebuild it" plot line. This harvest moon has a story and restrictive story mechanics that slow you down from getting your farm going. It's very story driven and not very "fun gameplay" in terms of getting you the freedom to farm in peace.

I do miss the old harvest moon games when you could start exploring and picking up fruit in the forests and selling it for gold as well as natsume letting you do as you please on day 1. 

I give it a thumps down because this harvest moon is nothing like the classics and is too story driven rather than "grandpa" farming simulator like the old harvest moon games.

review: I got this game for free as a gift from a person that loves me so much and knows that I'm a big fan of the Harvest Moon series and now I don't know what to tell that person just in case I'm asked how this game is. "Oh yeah, your gift, it had wonky controls, the art didn't work for the universe, the mechanics were repetive and felt like there was near zero pay off to anythin you do, you can survive without farming, the characters aren't well written and I don't want to marry anyone, there's WAAAY too much cutscenes and WAAAAY too little freedom to do anything the previous games offered. Also I've Finished the main story mission in less than 1 in-game year. But it's alright. I appreciate your gift." YOU MADE MY BEBE PAY FOR CRAP!! This game is bad. If anyone else is reading this, don't get this game. Get STARDEW VALLEY. It's an actual game unlike this quick cash grab.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070655995', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1474, 'last_played': 1523795308}
review:
Positive Review : If you have been craving to play the original or the harvest moon friends of mineral town/back to nature then this is the right game for you. The idea is still original to the first and previous harvest moon games and it's just circulating around that idea. However if you do not mind about the graphics then it is also a contributing factor on why you should play this game, since this is the first ever harvest moon game that was released on the PC platform so i think most of the harvest moon players and lovers wouldn't mind. This is just to bring back to the old nostalgic experience that harvest moon players have played over the franchise over the years. Plus the graphic were not that bad compared to the other harvest moon games.

Negative Review : To the expectation these days and especially in 2017/2018, demands are a bit pushed to the top and most gamers who have experienced high end games would negate badly about this "light of hope" graphics, considering that it is not easy and cheap to develop a game, i think natsume can and should made a harvest moon game on pc platform with graphics and interfaces that are much refined from the older generations of harvest moon. I think Natsume can bring more innovations and new ideas to this franchise for example variations of stories or more chapters/arc considering this is released on steam or maybe have a team that could write a new events on each regular updates just like producing an anime.


Ps : Make it a game that everyone will love and keep supporting this harvest moon franchise!

author: {'steamid': '76561198216353971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1012, 'last_played': 1529916350}
review: i bought this game recently, i bought it on a whim cause i love the harvest moon games, after the last few games that i found of harvest moon which i didn't enjoy, i thought maybe Natsume could make this game great, i was right this game has a clever story and it fills like it belong in the harvest moon series, i thought i would only play for a hour or so but 5.2 hours later i finally going to bed (it's 5:13am right now for me) I'm happy i bought this game and looking forward to playing it again :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198180249829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1850, 'last_played': 1534600291}
review:
之前玩过很久的d版牧场物语（之前真的穷），这次算补票了。
操作手感不太舒服，画面额，也不太敢恭维。但可玩性还可以（虽然较风之集会这种还差一点）
另，(雾)百度某大妈3.0汉化补丁亲测可用【不要用3.5，不要用3.5，不要用3.5！！！最新的补丁反而不行，我也很是费解】
8月开发组更新后，所以网上搜索的汉化补丁全部不可用，个人翻了一下安装目录，想汉化也完全没头绪。所以从价格，可玩性，更新频率综合评价，完全不推荐入手。
开发商至少做个国际化再来放到steam上面吧，也不要求你官方出简中！真的是醉了

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198065538768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 735, 'last_played': 1570758210}
review:
Eh. So since the split of harvest moon and story of seasons, it's clear that the "Harvest moon" line of games isn't as good. It's simple, some might say too simple. It's an easy game that I would sugest for little kids. There's not a lot in this game that made prior harvest moon games special. There's a real lack of events and festivals. It's like they got halfway through creating the game and just said "screw it, slap a harvest moon sticker on it and sell it, people will buy it."

I should have figured I wasn't going to like it after I hated the lost valley so much.


 Pros
-Farming controls are easy, no need to switch between tools
-Interesting characters, the addition of witches are cool. 
-Farming mutations are interesting.
-Graphics for animals are cute.


Cons
-As some people have said, the graphics are stale. It looks like something you'd see early 2000's. It's not even cutesy rustic, it's just ugly. 
-Lack of depth, everything is strait forward. There's no secrets or anything, no surprises. It's all just pretty boring. 
-Characters don't have much depth to them. No real back stories. 
-Not very many animals in the game
-Game is way, wayyy to easy. Completing the main storyline takes less than 10 hours, and can be completed in a little over one game "season." The items don't require mutations or anything.
-very little/no upgrades to buildings, very little buildings/useful features in general. What happened to the makers? Those made production interesting. 
-No Calendar, and no furniture to add to the house. What. 
-No TV like in previous games, if you want to know the weather you have to wait until 5pm and go talk to the wizard dude. 
-Remember the festivals that rate your sheep, cows, chickens? They're not in this game.
-no story/time progression. 10 years can pass and everything is still the same. Nothing new happens. 
-No foraging like previous games. You can find flowers, but that's it. The flowers all look the same on the ground, just an ugly big white flower. 
-Can't customize your character, no clothes, Nada.
-Charging your watering can/hoe is weird. You have to drag the curor, but if you're not in the exact right spot your character will move in that annoying touch screen thing. 
-The whole restoring the lighthouse thing is bland. You need very little to do it. At least Tree of Tranquility it took actual time to replant the tree. 
-Request system is annoying. It seems like the actual mechanism behind the game, the lighthouse seems like an afterthought. 
-Balance of the game is way off. What's the point of planting crops and raising animals when you can find gems EASILY and sell them 900-5000 gold a piece? There's very little to actually buy after anyways once you fix the town and repair the lighthouse. 


My advice is to stick to Stardew Valley, wait for the next story of seasons game to come to PC, and skip this game. I really wanted to love it, but it just doesn't have any of the charm of Harvest Moon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076384323', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13762, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13762, 'last_played': 1519645590}
review:
Overall I really enjoyed the game. 
It's overall a pretty easy game so it's a good choice if you just wanna relax. It's a lot easier to build friendships with townies than in older harvest moon games. Never really gifted anything to anyone, but the one i wanted to marry and did their requests and got almost everybody to 100% in the end. 
The story isn't overwhelmingly long, but you can kinda get stuck if you take your time (like i did) and need something from a season you just left (I didn't know that you could grow crops outside of their season back then) so that is kinda annoying.
If you like achievements you're in for a heavy load of rng and reloading saves as mutation of crops and trees is just pure rng.  All in all I enjoy the graphics of the game and the easy handling of tools and such (no need to select a certain tool, the character will choose the right one when interacting with an object)

author: {'steamid': '76561198235165492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2879, 'last_played': 1513384381}
review:
I was trying to decide whether I recommend it or not.
I decided no for a few reasons.

Cons:
Story is way too short. I've played 48 hours and havent touched it in weeks, it got real boring real quick.
It's missing a lot of Harvest Moon features, and also adds to the boredom.
It's not worth the money. It's barely worth $10-15 at the most.

I will say that I felt that some of the game changes in this one is nice. Being able to not have select the tool for every single thing really does help. Also viewing which crop you've planted is nice, and I also liked the story line.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052839637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3185, 'last_played': 1516761492}
review:
Whelp, I finished the game, at least as much as I care to. 

This seriously feels like the mobile version of the game, right from the wonky controls and the "press to start" screen you first see upon opening the game. 

The art is sub par, and while 2d top down style worked for stardew valley it does NOT work for a game which has previously given us 3d art. 

Marriage is flat. You can't decorate your house. Balance is WEIRD - one day of mining can pay for a giant house.

I honestly am regretting both the time and money I spent on this game. I felt obligated to continue playing to finish the story and because I spent money on it but honeslty..... there's so much lacking in this game. Very dissapointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078582788', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1798, 'last_played': 1515480869}
review:
Harvest Moon: Light of Hope is enjoyable and overall a good game in its own right. However, as an old Harvest Moon fan I don't think this game lives up to its predecessors, but seeing as this is an entry title on PC I'm happy it made its way here.

First of all, it took about 30 hours for me to complete (Keeping in mind I used Cheat Engine to speed up the travelling and DIDN'T cheat any other way). 

The game revolves around you completing requests for the various villagers in town. At first there won't be many but as you continue through the story and fix up the village - they will come back. These requests are mainly obtain x amounts of item y and hand it in for a reward that may be in the form of money or recipes which help you with your farm. Some items are only obtainable in certain seasons unless you use fertiliser, or aren't obtainable unless you have a certain recipe. These quests are enjoyable to do until you reach endgame, where it then just feels pointless as the rewards become redundant and the grind gets to you. 

Secondly, this game is a farming game right? What if I told you that 95% of your profits come from mining? Why is this the case? Because you don't know what future job requests are going to require, therefore you stockpile all of your crops hoping that it will become useful in future. THERE ARE A LOT OF JOB REQUESTS. I've finished the game and I still have requests. It's essentially Mining Moon: Light at the End of the Tunnel. 1 Soul gem (rarest gem in the game) is worth 5,000... let's say we have 36 of one crop that sells for 80 each, that adds up to 2,880. Why waste my time watering 36 crops for +5 days and then sell them when I can just spend that time in the mine and obtain +10 soul gems along with other rare gems and ores?

Third, the characters are likeable but there isn't much interaction availiable. you talk to them once, then you talk to them again, on the third try the same dialogue just loops. Also, the story is a bit confusing as it doesn't always tell you what you're meant to do, there's no quest menu (job requests excluded) so I spent a lot of time googling answers.

Conclusion: 
Is this game worth $30 USD? If you calculate accordingly to my hours that's about $1 per hour of gameplay. 
Yes I do recommend this game, but only if you're new the HM series, looking for a farming/life sim or if it's on sale. 
The game is good, but it has its cons. cons that are mainly experienced towards the end game.

If you really want to experience HM, grab an emulator or be like me and grab a 3DS. The 3DS is backwards compatible with DS games and there are plenty of HM games out there (Rune Factory 1,2 and 3 included).

author: {'steamid': '76561198066847514', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1708, 'last_played': 1555950988}
review: I really liked Stardew Valley, and was hoping that the Harvest Moon franchise learned something from it, but sadly they didnt. I enjoyed this game for a while, I have nearly 30 hours playtime, but it just doesnt keep the player motivated to keep playing. It takes forever to get a wife and upgrade your house. Upgrading houses was always my favorite this to do in farm games, but this one makes you wait and wait and find lots of rare items that must go into the build. Farming is completely useless becuase you make far more money mining. You can make more moeny in two days of mining than you can a full month of farming, and with far less work. Harvest Moon has suck a good platform and name recognition, they should really study up on Stardew and make a better game next time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191346685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2834, 'last_played': 1518482812}
review: To be honest I love love looove harvest moon so much! I am aware that a lot of people are unhappy with it. If you give the game a chance and not complain about the graphics or comparinging it to stardew valley, you may actually enjoy it yourself. I like their mutated crop system and the fact you are able to grow crops in the "wrong season" with fertilizers! There is also  extra animals in the game as well after you beat the main story line. The story line is a little short and so far there isn't any clothes customization..yet. It is still fairly new and I am sure there will be DLCs in the future to better enhance the game. So far the game itself feels like the OLDER generations like friends/more friends in mineral town, which is refreshing in its own way. As a long time fan of harvest moon I had mixed feelings when first introduced to LoH but quickly enjoyed it. Please give it a chance its quite wonderful!

review: So I don't hate it. You get a slot of stuff to do, the mine is great cause you can actually go in and dig like the original instead of hammering a crack in the wall 5 times a day. It's fun but the main story is sort of easy to complete. You get different areas like town, mountain, beach, farming plots. The villagers don't walk around though, they just teleport to places, even if they're going home and they're right next to their door. You can't do same sex marriage I think, but you can still see same sex "heart" events. It's addicting, it's fun, I like it. Maybe not worth the $30 though, more like $20 game. I got it on sale for Christmas. I wouldn't get it unless you're open minded about it cause if you go in hating it already you'll just be wasting your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076354433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1646, 'last_played': 1515695873}
review: Let me preface this by saying: this game is not a 30 dollar game. It is also NOT a great Harvest Moon game. Its fun. I'm playing the heck out of it. But there was clearly a shift from what I can only assume was intended to be a mobile game to what we have now. The game itself is kind of contradictory; it's both really simple, and really complicated, but in all the wrong ways. For instance, it's purposely vague on story goals, and everything is gated in weird ways. You need flowers to upgrade your tools. Also, your crops can randomly mutate, and become "great" versions of themselves (ie Great strawberry, etc.). There are also "great" versions of every mutation, leading to about 10000000 kinds of corn that you can grow, which all make different, unstackable, kinds of cornmeal. Which you can use to make different kinds of bread or feed. These "great" item upgrades do NOT always work the same as others. Sometimes it will let you use higher quality items to fulfill requests, but not always. I can't figure out what the distinction is. Also, you can mix and match item quality levels for requests (when it works), but not for town improvements. For instance, you need donkey fur to build a dock, but you need 5 donkey furs all at the same level to build it. Its needlessly complicated, especially since the player can't really control what gets upgraded, and what stays at base level. The story is okay, it was actually pretty decent. And like I said, I've played the heck out of it (it was a Christmas gift luckily). Get it on sale, and accept that its just a "guilty pleasure" game, and you'll enjoy yourself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198404437893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1526640181}
review:
Ich war erst etwas skeptisch, als ich hier auf Steam ein Harvest moon gefunden habe, ich wusste nicht, dass es seit kurzem auch ein Spiel für den PC gibt. 
Nach anfänglichen Schwierigkeiten,dem Spiel eine Chance zu geben, setzte ich mich intensiver ran.
Die Story ist wirklich sehr kurz, die Grafik fühlt sich nicht nach Harvest Moon an.

Allerdings muss man sagen, dass die Emotionen des Hauptcharas in Gesprächen das Spiel lebendiger machen. Das Farm-System bleibt das gleiche alte, Das Spiel ist auf jeden Fall ein guter Zeitvertreib für nebenbei, wenn man Langeweile hat. 
Jedoch sind so gut wie alle Ds-Spiele besser.
Gut finde ich, dass das Minensystem von Harvest Moon DS wieder aufgeholt wurde.(Viel kleiner natürlich und ohne Monster)

author: {'steamid': '76561198054326481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2008, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1932, 'last_played': 1515304320}
review:
As a long time farming game fanatic, I really wish I could have loved this game more. But while it can be an enjoyable time-waster (and boy did I sink a few hours into it before I burned out at last on it!), this game just lacks that special addictive quality that makes the Story of Seasons series, the Rune Factory titles and Stardew Valley so very, very absorbing. If those games are generally the A-titles of farming games, I would rate this latest Harvest Moon game a B-.

Pros: the farming of this game is stream-lined and relatively easy to do on a day-to-day basis, working my way down to the 100th floor of the mine was very fun, great variety of animals to collect and crops to cultivate, it's fun to revitalize a deserted town/island, and Edmond is a genuinely adorable bachelor.

Cons: the art is frankly rather ugly and amateurish, the main story line could have been interesting with better writing but seems so lifeless and dispiriting, almost all of the characters are dull as dull can be, you're basically forced to abuse your animals in order to get the products you need out of them, it's just not as good as recent rival farming games.

Basically, if you're really really really desperate for a new farming game to play until the next Story of Seasons or Stardew Valley comes out, this game is a decent time-filler that'll amuse you for at least a few days. But don't expect anywhere near the polished game-play or level of writing in those games showing up within this one. It's decent enough but could have been done far, far better if Natsume had just put more effort into things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072063590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6487, 'last_played': 1638256411}

author: {'steamid': '76561198355642984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5126, 'last_played': 1697252027}
review:
Overall I liked the game but compared to every other HM game, this one could have been a lot better. I like that there are somethings that do not unlock until the main story is beaten because it makes the game fun to continue playing. 
I hate how fast stones and weeds respawn and in large quantities-and, there is NO sickle. You literally have to pull the weeds one by one. Unlike most of the other games, there is no way to increase your stamina level. All Animal products have 4 or 5 different qualities to them and most of the requests require them to all be the same quality. This is a pain. 

Overall, I did enjoy playing. It took all the things I hated about Skytree Village and made them better-but there is still somethings I think could be better

author: {'steamid': '76561198071836405', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 6447, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6437, 'last_played': 1544049675}
review:
Стечения обстоятельств, разработчик показал себя не с лучшей стороны. Игра неплохая, но разработчики относятся к людям ужасно. Изменив стоимость игры, разработчик обокрал других людей, сделав стоимость такую же как с игрой, со всеми длс. То есть, те кто  изначально купил эту игру, за полную цену, должен еще заплатить сверху за длс. Люди поддержали разработчика, а разработчик решил таким образом, отблагодарить людей. 

The developer did not show his best side. The game is not bad, but the developers treat people horrible. By changing the cost of full game, the developer robbed other people, making the cost the same as the game with all DLC. That mean that, who pay for this game in full price, as soon as the game came out, they have to pay extra for DLC. People supported the developer, but developer  decided to thank people like this way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280995490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1838, 'last_played': 1514863122}
review:
i bought this game 2 weeks ago and i already beat the game within 30 hours (i beat the game on Fall 14th); in my opinion a bit too short for a harvest moon game, and the difficulty was far too easy. the game play is great despite that i had to use my xbox1 controler. alot of the characters come from the Harvest moon: Skytree village 3ds game. 

i'd rate this a generous 6/10 overall
but i'd wish it had more unique or new characters instead of recycling characters from previous games. 
and had a longer more challenging storyline

personally i would recommend the game buy not for around $26.  if anything it should be worth $10-15

author: {'steamid': '76561198065475920', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1514914735}
review: If this was Natsume's first game since the split with Marvelous it honestly would be pretty good, sadly it's not, it's their fifth game, and it feels like all they are doing is copy and pasting old games together into something new. If you could call it new. If you played any of the other Natsume made games on 3DS or the mobile game, you've played this one, and at this price you are better off waiting for the next Bokujo game, or picking up another good farming/life sim for half the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142188282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 501, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1514904858}
