author: {'steamid': '76561198067168951', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1801, 'last_played': 1516442840}
review:
So hier ist mal mein erstes Review ^-^

Also ich habe das Spiel um die 12 Stunden und die Story fertig gespielt.

Positiv:
- Endlich hat der Spieler mal ein paar Emotionen :D
- Kein Tauschen von Werkzeugen mehr, alles automatisch wenn man den Dinge anklickt die man bearbeiten will
- Tiere sind leichter zu pflegen/füttern
- Die kleinen Aufgaben für die Dorfbewohner, spielst zwar Laufbursche aber kriegst was dafür und man kann sich schneller mit denen anfreunden
-man kriegt das was man will, ein Farm Spiel
- bringt Spaß die Stadt aufzubauen
- leicher herauszufinden was die Bewohner mögen wegen ihren sehr ausgeprägten Vorlieben
- bei Events kannst du trotzdem einkaufen
- die Bewohner sind viel länger wach also mehr Chancen die zu treffen

Negativ
- kurze und langweilige Story
- Die Aufgaben für die Story sind einfach farblos
- Die Mine...gott diese Musik hat mich psychisch einfach fertig gemacht, davon abgesehen das auch keine Musik wechselt, sondern immer die gleiche Fröhliche Musik läuft die einen sagt "Hey bringt dir das Graben von jedem cm, damit du die Leiter finden kannst, Spaß?" völlig der Horror
- Man kriegt viiiiel zu schnell Geld, am Anfang fischen, damit du Ore verarbeiten kannst und fertig
- Wo ist bitte meine Traverne? :c 
- Kein Kalender, kein Fernsehr, man wird ein Tag davor informiert
- Events wo du mit jemanden weggehst, wird zwar paar Tage vorher bescheid gegeben, aber du bist immer alleine mit denen heißt die anderen Dorfbewohner siehst du nicht, zerstört das Event und das Gemeinsame treffen des Dorfes 
- Was immer ein Herz war um zu sehen wie gut du dich mit den Dorfbewohnern verstehst ist nu eine Note aus meiner Sicht echt mega unschön
- Viel zu wenig Dorfbewohner + Auswahl, man hat halt einfach 5 männliche Möglichkeiten, 1. verrückter der auf Blumen mega abfährt und ohne nicht könnte sein Lebensinhalt, 2. verrückter der auf Fisch steht und immer umfällt wenn er Hunger hat, 3. verrückter der auf Tiere steht, 4. Verrückter Magier der sich immer mit der anderen prügeln muss, 5. Verrückter Magier der mehr als 100 Jahre alt ist, also nicht die beste Wahl xD
- Eintönig man kann keine Kleidung, keine andere Frisur/Haarfarbe haben, Möbel oder deren gleichen kaufen, sowas wie ein Kühlschrank etc kriegt man nur wenn man Upgradet, allgemein wird alles nur durch Geld geregelt
- Hund + Pferd muss man kaufen und man kann sich keine Farbe aussuchen 
- Man kann keine Ringe oder Amulete mehr finden/craften
- nicht Tastatur freundlich (hab kein Kontroller und wollte dafür auch keinen kaufen ^^)
- man muss viel alleine erraten wie das und das geht (oder ich bin einfach dumm xD)
- finde die Größenunterschiede hässlich...das man so groß wie ein Baum ist muss nu wirklich nicht sein xD
- das Wellnessbad was dafür sorgt das du Energie bekommst dauert 100 Jahre, also lohnt sich mehr Brot zu kaufen, weil du eh genug Geld hast
- Die Tiere essen immer am Morgen also musst du warten bis die fertig sind...
- Das Pferd musst du jedes mal wieder zur Scheune bringen sonst ist es beleigt und kannst darauf nicht reiten, anstatt das es von selber nachhause läuft
- Upgraden der Werkzeuge..ich habe keine Ahnung wieso man dafür Blumen braucht die nur in einer Gewissen Seson wachsen...wieso Blumen für ein Upgrade für ein Hammer? O.o

Ich muss sagen dieser Harvest Moon Teil ist eine Enttäuschung und fühlt sich eher an als wäre das Spiel noch nicht fertig.
Klar man bekommt das was man will. Farmen, Tiere und Liebe, aber ich habe weitaus besseres erwartet, da sie wirklich schöne Spiele hatten. Leider werden ihre Spiele mehr und mehr so als wollten sie nur Geld damit verdienen wollen ohne mal auf die Ideen der Fans einzugehen. 
Auch wenn ich 12 Stunden gespielt habe, was bedeutet das es ja nicht so schlecht sein kann, finde ich das eine schwache Leistung immerhin ist Harvest Moon mehr als nur Geld und farmen.
Events wo man alle Dorfbewohner trifft, Leute mehr kennen zu lernen, darauf scharf ist die Minie durch zu machen ohne das die Ohren völlig vergewaltigt werden, Spaß daran hat neues zu entdecken und und und
Mir fehlt das gute alte Harvest Moon Mineral Down, da war mehr Liebe zum Detai drin.

Also ich kann es für große Harvest Moon Fans nicht empfehlen, die (wie ich) besseres gewohnt ist, besonders nach Stardew Valley.
Sonst die noch nicht viel  Erfahrung gemacht haben ist es in Ordnung.
Nicht das ich es komplett hassen würde, aber wie gesagt bin besseres von den Machern von Harvest Moon gewöhnt.^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198102854247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2147, 'last_played': 1594300498}
review:
For me it's a good game with decent graphic and music.
But it has worse NPC behaviour, unreal.
Also, NO CALENDAR T_T
(not found it, yet)

Easy money maker (possibily supposed to be).
Big variant of farming (kinda confused).
Lack of story (finish main story less than 20hours).
Good side quest (not yet with story, probably won't be).
Again, from all Harvestmoon series i played, this one has the worse NPC.

I like it's music and character design, also it has lot of room for improvement, very much.
Is it recommended? Yes, for old time sake.
Is it worth? you will grow on it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290297701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2337, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2039, 'last_played': 1511821276}
review:
As far as Harvest Moon games go I wouldn't say it's one of the best out there. However, this is the first one that has been offered on Steam, and I feel like this is a big step for the company. I've played quite a few hours and beaten the main story line yet still not unlocked everything. I wish I wouldn't of had to wait until I finished the main story line to get married. That was a bit of a pain. 

Overall, if you like Harvest Moon games like me it has a simular enjoyable feel as the others have, and I hope since it's on Steam they'll add some cool updates to make this game more special!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071779755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1565, 'last_played': 1514511845}
review:
by all standards.... this is a very bad harvest moon game. 

it had some interesting parts- Like the terrain allowing for mutated strains of crops, but it had too many jarring flaws

1. You cant Auto Water, and the game gives you an I N S A N E amount farm land to use. im talking there are about 10000 tiles you can plant on, and thats a low ball estimate. Watering is such a tedious part of the game , and it extremely detracts from the game at virtually every juncture. 
2. Farming is largely pointless. You will only ever farm for Food/feed supplies (fodder corn) and the oddball flowers to upgrade your tools. 
3. Mining is too profitable. one day in a mine can turn more profit than an entire month of Cropping 300 tiles(this takes all day to water until you get the max level watering can). This game basically becomes Mining Moon instead of harvest moon. 
4. removal of crops is cancerous. you have to buy herbicide. theres no sickle or ability to use a hammer to smash the crops...

author: {'steamid': '76561198385130403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1570, 'last_played': 1557691506}

author: {'steamid': '76561198345309977', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2229, 'last_played': 1545880240}
review:
I'm just disappointed in this game. The characters have good design but they are very bland and their dialogues hardly change throughout the story.

The mission system is heavy and unnecessarily complicated, and do not talk about cooking. The recipes are messy and it is difficult to find one, the most common ingredients are the most complicated to find when you have your livestok with high affection and that they give you a single random item only makes the game more tedious.

The difference between the simple and the blessed tools is almost none, specially the fishing rod. Is frustrating if we think all that it costs to obtain it. 10 times I have gone fishing only one or none gives me more than one fish.

The game looked promising but it is too simple in some things and ridiculously complicated in what should be simple. I finished it in 2 days and until now I do not see that it offers me too many things to continue playing it.

Not worth the money you pay for it, in the Harvest moon in addition to the systems the characters are the most important of the plot and should have more soul and personality than this.

Passable for casual players or small children, but I do not recommend it for fans of Harvest moon or Story of Seasons.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Sólo estoy decepcionada de este juego. Los personajes tienen buen diseño pero son muy sosos y sus dialogos apenas cambian a lo largo de la historia. 

El sistema de misiones es pesado e inecesariamente complicado, ni se hable de cocinar. Las recetas estan desordenadas y es dificil buscar una, los ingredientes mas comunes son los mas complicados de encontrar cuando tienes a tu ganado con afecto alto y eso que te den un solo item random solo hace el juego mas tedioso.

La diferencia entre las herramientas simples y la bendita es casi ninguna, en especial la caña de pescar, y eso es frustrante si tomamos en cuenta todo lo que cuesta conseguirla. De 10 veces que he ido a pescar solo una o ninguna me da mas de un pez.

El juego se veia prometedor pero es demasiado simple en unas cosas y ridiculamente complicado en lo que deberia ser sencillo. Me lo termine en 2 dias y hasta ahora no veo que me ofrezca demasiadas cosas para continuar jugandolo.

No vale la pena el dinero que pague por el, en los Harvest moon ademas de los sistemas los personajes son lo mas importante de la trama y deberian tener mas alma y personalidad que esto.

Pasable para jugadores casuales o niños pequeños, pero no lo recomiendo para los fans de Harvest moon o Story of Seasons.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992238359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1813, 'last_played': 1535209805}
review:
Harvest Moon ist eigentlich ein tolles spiel aber dies hier nicht
An nicht mal einen ganzen Tag das Spiel durchgespielt und das nichtmal wo das 1ste Jahr zu ende ist 

Die NPC´s bestellen dauernt dinge aber die einzige möglichkeit den das zeugs zu geben sind die festivals weil an den anderen Tagen die betroffenen Personen gar nicht da sind

Wenn Sturm ist sind alle NPC´s weg und nicht zu erreichen außer der Erntegott und Erntegötting und Gorgan sindd wirklich alle weg von der Map.

Den Zauberer den man "täglich" nach dem Wetter fragen kann ist nie da 
Die Hexe die man fragen kann was die leute aus dem dorf mögen auch nie da

Bei der Ausdauer hat man nur 5 Herzen die recht schnell weg sind es ist auch nicht wie gewohnt so das man irgendwo an Powerbeeren rankommt

Nach dem man nun mit dem Hauptspiel durch ist ist es eher son was soll ich hier jetzt anstellen spiel , warten bis die früchte gewachsen sind um die dann irgendwann mal den bewohnern zu geben wenn man sie mit glück erwischt 

Achso es gibt ja auch noch weitere plätze wo man farmen kann die kann man sich auch schön in 8 stunden realer zeit her richten weil man erstmal damit beschäftigt ist das ganze unkraut zu entfernen

also wenn es das vom Spiel gewesen sein sollte dann rate ich jedem vom Spiel ab

author: {'steamid': '76561198165407739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1897, 'last_played': 1513287242}
review:
I have been playing Harvest Moon for the last 12 years, since getting Harvest Moon DS for christmas when I was 9. I still play that first game at least once a year because it is my most favourite game. 

I agree that it is good for a company to expand and try new things- they can not just expect people to keep buying the same games over and over and not provide something new. But something big is lost in the games they have been making the last few years. I don't feel like I am playing a Harvest Moon game- I think A New Beginning was the last title that I felt I was playing a true Harvest Moon game.
Since then, it has felt like every other game has been a semi-good parody.

However, I feel like in comparison to some of the lesser titles (The Lost valley), Light of Hope is a step in the right direction... But there is still such a way to go.

Light of Hope looks like it was made in an RPG maker and I have a tiny bit of experience with using those to know that the easiest part of using an RPG maker is the design- placing the tiles. But whoever made this map clearly left their deadline to the last minute and did a passing-grade job. For example, the pathway on your farm- I can tell that its meant to appear as this faded-stone path but it actually is just blocks dotted in random places and its horrible to look at. It is really very simple but highly effective to fade the edges of the tiles to get this effect because this is otherwise a very poor and downright lazy job.

A more personal opinion I also have, which others may not agree with, is the colour- everything is far too brightly coloured that it turns childish. The whole game in fact feels more like it is designed for a child but I also believe that the bulk of the Harvest Moon fanbase is adults but we are not really being acknowledged. 

A big problem with the game is how quickly you can finish it and how boring each day can be. Back in the day, you would have to collect all 101 sprites, or put some real hard work into restoring the town- work that would take in-game years. In Light of Hope I am practically going to bed by 11am because thats it- I've watered my crops, I've fed my animals, I have said hi to the person I like and that is it for the day. The older harvest moon games- you could be spending most of your day trying to finish all your tasks and still be struggling to finish it all. That is what is so great- you are so busy! You feel immersed in the game. Light of Hope is too easy and too boring.

To put it plainly- I don't care much about the characters in this game. I don't feel like I know them and they are not interesting enough for me to want to know them. Their 3D designs when you speak to them are ugly- I am a big fan of the more anime-style you used to do because now they look like children and that doesnt really make me what to marry and start a family with them... If anything it's creepy.  I also miss how in the older games, the villagers would walk around and had a schedule- they didn't just appear magically somewhere and remain stood until bedtime. They used to have their own favourite spots to visit and spend time, based on their personalities. They even had different dialog depending on where they were at the time and also depending on how good of friends you were. With your love interests, you had to work hard to win them over and there was also competition- for each love interest there was a rival- someone who also cared for them and could end up marrying them if you werent careful.

Another wonderful but simple thing I miss about Harvest Moon are the little things- like how you could find treasure in excavation site, cursed items and tools, random events between characters (that you can only come across if you meet very specific criteria), hidden mini games, even hidden mermaids!

One main thing that frustrates me about Light of Hope- you have a ridiculous amount of farm space but you cant build anything on it? There are pre-built barns and windmill and this is it. You can't add anything else. Do you really think I need all this land? It would be good if we could place beehives like in A New Beginning, or greenhouses, a pond, maker sheds, a mushroom house... It is just a waste of a lot of land and it again makes me revert back to my previous point of this being designed lazily. 
I also wish we could customise our house and farm more. Maybe even the character. 

Some aspects of this game that I do enjoy is the mutation of crops and flowers- I think that is a fun idea. And the bell to get animals in and out of the barns... I thought I would have more to say on good things to be honest.

-
I guess to sum it up, I wish that Harvest Moon would stop being downgraded and simplified to tailor to children. Or, to at least make more adult versions for us to enjoy also.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081962235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1511819114}
review:
As a seasoned harvest moon player since GBC, I can say that IMO, Natsume has lost it's charm when it comes to making innovative farm sims.
In comparison to their counterparts, Marvellous: Story of Seasons and Chuckefish's Stardew Valley, HM:Light of Hope does not meet the expectation bar. In fact, it falls very... very short. This is disheartening but perhaps my expectations were too high.

This re-iteration does not add anything new, even the townsfolk are copied and pasted from prior installments. There is a lack of festivals, stale dialogue, and the pacing is terrible. I beat the game in under 24 hours mid-summer year 1. 
If you are looking for something new, this does not deliver. If you are interested in something VERY familiar to mindlessly occupy your time, this will serve that purpose.

Yet there are some nice game mechanic additions that I have to acknowledge Natsume for; the algorithm for tending to your crop fields and caring for animals is a HUGE time-saver and you now do not have to open a menu and equip tools manually or even use the quick bar to fully till, water, and fertizle crops. This makes the tedious tasks and repitition fly by so you can do more in a day - the only problem, is that there's nothing really to do during the day...

As such, that addition does not make up for the fact that the game is just overall boring and too simplistic/easy. If you have not yet played Stardew Valley or SoS, give those a go first; if you've played them and are looking for a quick fix to satisfy a farming itch - then this one will do just that but dont' expect anything more. 
Also as an aside, I played 4 hours of HM and then 4 hours of SoS: trio of towns back to back to better judge, and I stopped HM after 24 hours and have decided to replay SoS instead - if that is any indicator as to how boring this game has become. 

TLDR: no innovation or creativity, stale gameplay, but good controls. 
SoS and Stardew valley have more to do, so buy those first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256098565', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2373, 'last_played': 1515040016}
review:
Would recommend, but not for the price... Whats the point of the horse in end game? there is none... Soon as you finish the story line, you can instant travel. There is no horse race like back on the 64 version I played... too bad.. there is however a dog race... Story line is pretty short. After the story is finished you get access to buy better buildings like your house, barn, and chicken coup. Not sure what more there is after all of that... little under 40 hrs... So if you want this game, I would just say wait for a sale... Also... To make money fast, repair the mines asap... And go mining....

Edit: You cant even sell the horse!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016533802', 'num_games_owned': 31, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2765, 'last_played': 1515960755}
review:
Ich habe jetzt nach knapp 30 Stunden Spielzeit die "Story" durch und komme damit zu einem kleinen Fazit.

[b]Positiv[/b]
[list]
[*]das Spiel macht Spaß!
[*]sogar ein bisschen nostalgisches Gefühl, dass an Friends of Mineraltown erinnert kommt auf
[*]es gibt sehr viele verschiedene Früchte/Gemüse die es zu ernten gibt
[*]es gibt jetzt auch Esel <3
[*]es sind nicht alle Gebiete von Anfang an verfügbar
[/list]

[b]Negativ[/b]
[list]
[*]Edelsteine sind zu leicht zu bekommen/ bringen zu viel Geld ein, dadurch wird das eigentliche Farmen nutzlos und dient nur dem vervollständigen der Enzyklopädie
[*]mir persönlich fehlt der Fernseher/ Kalender im Spiel um einen konkreten Überblick über Wetter und wichtige Termine zu bekommen
[*]durch das Fehlen einer Sichel kann man nach dem Verwelcken alles einzeln rausrupfen...NERV
[*]Das Kochsystem gefällt mir nicht so. Man kann/muss sich alle Rezepte kaufen und kann nicht einfach selber drauf los kochen wie damals in FoM
[/list]

Insgesamt ziehe ich ein positives Fazit zum Spiel. Jedoch stellt sich mir die Frage, wie es um die Langzeitmotivation bestellt ist. Wird da einzig und allein das Vervollständigen der Enzyklopädie reichen?!

author: {'steamid': '76561198366381855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1512787937}
review: If you're new to PC gaming, this is a great title to start out with. I'm primarily a console gamer, but this game is introducing me to how you control games on the PC. I've been a fan of the Harvest Moon franchise since Harvest Moon: It's A Wonderful Life Special Edition for the PS2. This type of game is a slow-paced, learn at your own pace kind of game. There are no enemies to face and no enemy bosses to fight. You can play as either a boy or a girl. You can flirt with certain men/women inn this game, marry them and have a child with them. To reitterate, if you are new to PC gaming, pic up this game and you can learn at your own pace the controls for PC gaming. Different games for PC handle controls differently, but this game is a great intro to PC gaming. HIGHLY recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198160832408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4949, 'last_played': 1521316140}
review:
So after avoiding the Natsume Harvest Moon games like the plague, I finally broke down and bought this one. If you've played Harvest Moon before, you might be disappointed. If you are new to the Harvest Moon games, it would be a pretty decent title to start out with. However, as a Harvest Moon veteran, I thoroughly enjoyed it after about the 2-hour mark. Makes me wonder if I have been sleeping on this series because of my biases of the Marvelous/Natsume split.

Edit: Oh yeah, another thing that I forgot to mention, I found the game way more enjoyable once I plugged in my game controller vs using the keyboard or mouse controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190533693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 14040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11132, 'last_played': 1513111463}
review:
lots of people realize Stardew Valley is a fanmade game of Harvest Moon and NORMALLY harvest moon games unlock areas through getting items they grow or mine or harvest from animals to have more to do in the game. its the same here. the map unlocks a bit after the tutorial so dont feel discouraged if Harvest Moon: Light of Hope map seems smaller than Stardew Valley's at first. Its actually way bigger and i already finished the story and still havent unlocked the whole map. 

other than that.....not as many types of animals as i have liked but i like the space to raise them, however only got 3 notes (hearts) for the livestock shopkeeper so there might be more for me if i befriend her more. and i LOVE the fact that in order to get more items you need to befriend the villagers. it makes more meaning for befriending the shopkeepers instead of just a honey!!! this game is decent for its graphics for a starter for natsume, but wished it was 3D and controler worthy. must have not had the budget. Hope the next one they put out for PC and PS4 is 3D!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970897174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3458, 'last_played': 1512055376}
review:
I think HM: Light of Hope is a great game for people who are new to the HM series. Veterans and Rune Factory fans will be extremely let down. I have to agree with other reviews when they say it is definitely lacking when compared to previous HM games. Light of hope is charming, yet I feel it is a bit empty and monotonous at times. The characters are likeable but events with them seem a bit short, pointless, lacking content and emotion. I don't really feel any personal investment in any of the people in town. At one point I completely forgot the name of one of the lesser mentioned female characters so I had to run around talking to everyone to figure out who she was. Name visibility when approaching characters could've also shortened the time frame. The clock runs way too fast as it is. 

Once you get past the initial story line, it is just a bunch of endless requests and mining to get money. Farming doesn't yield as much money as mining gems and fishing (if you get the better bait and pole). Towards the end I was mostly farming for animal food, wheat and new plants. The different quality products you get from your animals is wonderful but it is infuriating having to spend almost an entire game year to get a specific type of wool to progress the storyline, just because I treat my sheep too good and I keep getting the higher tiers. I literally had to earn money to buy a new sheep, wait for him to grow up, and neglect him for a bit to get this. I feel like I am being penalized for treating my animals too well. Forget it if you need to earn several wool or donkey fur for a request because those 4 have to be of the exact same quality for the game to see it as the item needed, there is no mixing and matching. 

This annoyance also brings me to the cooking system, it works the same way as the requests. If you need 5 cheese for a dish it has to be the SAME EXACT quality. I had 12 cheese all of varying qualities (these take 3 milk to make each) and about 10 milks of different qualities and could not make a dish. I ended up having to go buy some from Bastien just to finish the request. Eventually I started selling these because they just took up space in my fridge. It took entirely too long to actually do anything with them. Also the 10 types of each recipe for varying quality ingredients was messy and chaotic looking. I would have 10 recipes but 50 items on my recipe book. For example: there was pizza toast, excellent pizza toast, superb pizza toast, etc. This was the same for just about every recipe.  It would be nice to have one of these recipes listed and have the option in the menu to increase the quality. It seems a bit redundant and unnecessary to have so many versions.

 BAG SPACE, there is no number or indicator to let you know the bag is getting full......this is very frustrating when I finally found a soul gem or that one time I won a contest and had no bag space.... the items just vanished forever into the abyss. Thanks...

CALENDAR, it would be nice to know the birthdays and events without the help of the little harvest fairy. Harvest fairy  only lets you know about events 5 days in advance. If you get caught up or carried away it is easy to forget. 

The witch and wizard that let you know hints, weather, likes and dislikes are never in their homes. I can also never find them on the map. I eventually just stopped looking for them until I had a request. I was grateful I didn't choose one of them as a love interest, it would've been near impossible. 

STORAGE, storage bins would be amazing. Especially for a psychotic organizer like me. Using the same storage for all my seeds, flowers, ores etc is a bit messy. 

Seeing what is in the shipping container would also be awesome. It would be nice to see how much I am making and what items are in there. Also to take them out if I accidentally put something in that is needed for a request. 

It would be wonderful if the npc and animals names hovered over them as you selected or approached so I can tell who they are. When you look in the book it doesn't differentiate between the different types of cows, donkeys and chickens. It shows them all with the same exact default image. 

Leveling up when mining, farming, fishing, ecetera feature would be amazing too. I feel like my character has spent so much time doing these activities and still has as much stamina as when they first started. It's a bit frustrating having to load up on food just to get down 5 levels in the mine when I have the best equipment. 

I know I have done nothing but complain and criticize, but I guess I have been spoiled by the prior games and my expectations were a bit too high. I guess I also miss the Rune Factory series a bit and was looking for my fix, this is perhaps where I went wrong. I am aware that this company is different from the one that created the original games, but I don't feel that is any excuse to bastardize the series. If you are testing the waters, great. But using the HM name to get attention for something new and completely different is ultimately only going to lead to disappointment and harsh criticism for/from the fans. It sets an expectation that obviously had no intention of being met. 

TLDR: If you are new to the series I recommend this whole-heartedly. If you are looking to have the same experience as you got from prior HM games this may have you ripping your hair out at the unnecessary disorganization and lack of variety and content, that you have come to expect. 

I have spent a lot of time on this game and can't bring myself to not recommend it. I have enjoyed the time I played, but the little nuances have started to grate on me and I find myself sadly losing interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198259612393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2451, 'last_played': 1524480005}
review:
Ich spiele Harvest Moon seit Friends of Mineraltown für GBC. 

Wie alle Fans habe ich mir immer eine Pc Version gewünscht. Ich finde diese auch ganz gut, sie scheint mir eine Mischung aus Story of Seasons und Himmelsbaum zu sein. Ich weiß das sich die Macher eigtl getrennt haben aber es fühlt sich für mich so an. Toll finde ich das die Miene wieder da ist !! Es könnte jedoch gerne noch mehr Level geben :D 
Was mir wie in jedem Harvest Moon fehlt sind Schweine. Ich weiß nicht ob das Spiel vorgaukeln soll, dass keine Tiere getötet werden abgesehen von Fischen.... Trozdem Schweine und kleine Ferkel währen genial. Die Produkte der braunen Kühe und der braunen Hüner sind genial und haben genau diesen HM Humor. 
Was auch sehr Schade ist, dass einige Storys wirklich sehr nahe an Himmelsbaum erinnern. 
Und es hätte ruhig auch ein paar neue Charas geben können.
Positiv finde ich auch die neue Tastatur belegung, vorher fühlte es sich oft an als würde man das Spiel über einen virtuellen Gameboy spielen.

Negativ beim Kochen könnte man gerne wieder diese Trennung rein machen wie bei den anderen Spielen. Also Fischgerichte, Nachspiesen, Getränke, Salate und C.o.

Ich fand auch das die Hauptstory recht schnell zu bewältigen war. Hätte gerne noch mehr Aufgaben gehabt.

Ansonsten dennoch ein sehr spaßiges Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067910209', 'num_games_owned': 1554, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 4771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2886, 'last_played': 1512739977}
review:
รีวิว Harvest Moon: Light of Hope หลังจากเล่นเนื้อเรื่องจบ 

สรุปคะแนน 9/10 

เป็นเกมที่ไม่เหมาะกับทุกคน และคนละสไตล์กับ Stardew ไปคนละทาง กล่าวคือ เกม Stardew จะใหญ่กว่า และค่อนข้างไปในแนว Sand Boxes แต่เกม Harvest Moon จะเป็นแนว RPG

ตัวเกมมีเป้าหมายชัดเจนกว่าแต่ละขั้นต้องทำอะไร และมีแต่เควสช่วยบังคับให้ว่าเรารู้ว่าต้องทำอะไร ปลูกอะไร หาอะไรต่อ แต่ก็จะบอกอ้อมๆ ไม่ได้ถึงจะกับว่าไปขุดสิ แค่บอกว่าชาวบ้านอยากได้อันนี้ หามาที หามายังไงไม่รู้นะ

ข้อดีของเกม 
- เนื้อเรื่องถือว่าโอเค
- เอาใจใส่เรื่องตัวละคร บทพูด ปฏิสัมพันธ์ระหว่างตัวละคร ถ้าคุณเหนื่อยบทพูดก็จะเปลี่ยน ทำเควสสำเร็จบทพูดก็จะเปลี่ยน หรือถ้าเราไม่ทำเควสหลักสักที ชาวบ้านก็จะช่วยแนะนำให้ไม่ลืม 
- มี Event เลือกคำตอบ แบบ Stardew เวลาที่ความสัมพันธ์ก็จะมีเรื่องน่ารักๆ ขำๆ ไป
- ตัวละครค่อนข้างมีนิสัยเอกลักษณ์ จดจำได้ง่าย และมีเสน่ห์เป็นของตัวเองดี
- การใช้งานเครื่องมือ ง่ายถึงขั้นสุดๆ เป็นจุดที่ชอบที่สุดและ ไม่ต้องเสียเวลามาสลับเครื่องมือให้วุ่นวายเสียเวลา เกมออโต้ให้หมด 
- อีกจุดที่ชอบมากเป็นพิเศษ คือ ปลูกผักแบบไม่ต้องสนใจฤดูกาลได้ (แต่ต้องมาใส่ปุ๋ยนะ) คือเป็นปัญหาของเกม Stardew มาก ต้องที่มานับวัน พอเปลี่ยนฤดูก็ตายหมด หรือต้องรอข้ามปีกว่าจะปลูกพืชบางชนิดได้ อันนี้คืออยากปลูก แกก็ปลูกไปสิ ไม่อยากให้ผักตายก็ใส่ปุ๋ย ถ้าลืมใส่ แล้วผักตายก็ปิดเกมเปิดใหม่ มาใส่ปุ๋ยก็จะรอด โหยชีวิตแม่งโคตร Happy มาก 
- ตอนขุดเหมืองให้อารมณ์แบบกำลังเรียนเลข คือขุดไปสักพักก็จะพอเดาจุดได้และว่าจะตรงไหนจะเจอทางไปต่อ ไม่ต้องมาเสียเวลาขุดทั้งแมพ

ข้อเสีย
- ภาพไม่สวย ดูเด็กไปหน่อย แต่เอาจริงๆ เล่นสัก 5 ชมก็จะเล่นชินกับมันได้ แล้วก็คิดว่าสาวในเรื่องน่ารักทุกคน ผู้ชายก็เท่ ไม่ต้องมา MOD แบบ Stardew ด้วย
- อีเวนต์แม่งน้อยมาก แต่ตัดจบมาก


สรุปสุดท้าย เกมดี แต่ไม่เหมาะกับคนที่ชอบคิดเยอะ หรือชอบความอิสระแบบเกม Sand Boxes ซึ่งมันไม่ใช่ไง มันเกม RPG ชัดๆ เป็นเกมเล่นง่ายๆ คือเล่นแล้วรู้สึกว่าเออเกมแม่งต้องแบบนี้และ ไม่ต้องทำอะไรยุ่งยาก คิดมาก

author: {'steamid': '76561198022085812', 'num_games_owned': 692, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1528594134}
review:
Harvest Moon: Light of Hope brings back the fond memories of the original harvest moon farming games that started it all!

Despite its change in graphics it is enthralling on a whole new level with the same existing gameplay that kept me going for hours on end when it first appeared several years ago.

There are a lot of games that have been derived, improved, and expanded on from this one but all owe Harvest Moon a full and complete bottle of homage in celebration of its come back especially finally being here on steam.

I admit I was a bit hesitant about this one at first but after playing it for awhile it feels like a well welcomed addition to the entire Harvest Moon Game series with all the fun of the originals and more.

 I just hope it stays updated which so far it seems like it with some recent fixes and improvements and that some neat fun cool things are added over time to keep the game going more even if it's additional DLC I would gladly get.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029338816', 'num_games_owned': 955, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1619, 'last_played': 1511206308}
review: Harvest Moon does some good ad some bad, but still feels faithful to the series. Some of the mechanics have been simplified, and the game feels much smaller than previous titles. This may put some people off, as it did for me originally, because the grind was a big part of the buildup in the older games. That being said, if you perservere for a bit, the game opens up a bit and it becomes much more enjoyable. Is it better than previous harvest moons? no, not really. But, it does have it's place in the series. If you enjoyed the old games, but you're ok with it being finished much faster, you will enjoy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146430764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1520973552}
review:
Ich habe jetzt ein paar Stunden das Spiel gespielt und ich kann das Spiel empfehlen. Zwar ist das Spiel auf Englisch, aber dennoch auch für die Spieler verständlich, die kaum Englisch sprechen können. 
Das Spiel kann man nicht mit den Wii Versionen vergleichen. Es ist quasi wie ein DS Spiel, was mich überhaupt nicht stört. Alles ist knuffig und liebevoll gehalten und ich finde die Figuren richtig nice. Wer die DS Spielversion schon mochte, macht auf jedenfall keinen Fehler. ich habe den Kauf nicht bereut und ich freue mich schon darauf weiter zu spielen.

Ich hoffe natürlich auch, dass die deutschsprachige Version dazu gepatcht wird :)

review:
สนุกค่ะ  ถึงบทอาจจะเด็กๆไปหน่อย  เทียบกับภาคเก่าแล้วภาคเก่าเล่นยากกว่า ภาคนี้เหมือนว่าอะไรที่ซับซ้อนเขาจะตัดออกไป
ส่วนตัวคิดว่า รวมๆภาคเก่าๆ สนุกกว่าค่ะ  ภาคเก่าภาพน่ารักกว่า เนื้อเรื่องสนุกกว่า ทั้งบ้านทั้งฉากหลายๆอย่าง 
แต่เอาจริงๆว่าเล่นภาคนี้แล้วก็ติดงอมแงมเหมือนทุกภาคนั่นแหละถ้าเข้ามาเล่น ก็ขึ้นชื่อว่าฮาร์เวสมูนอ่านะ

ถ้าจะซื้อเล่นก็ไม่ผิดหวังหรอกค่ะ  ก็มีหลายๆอย่างในภาคนี้ก็ดีขึ้นจากภาคก่อนนะคะ ถึงมันจะไม่ดีกว่าเดิมไปซะทุกอย่างอ่านะ ต้องลองเข้ามาเล่นดูค่ะ  

รวมๆแล้วยังไงก็ชอบค่ะ  สนุก เพลิน สบายหู สบายตา

author: {'steamid': '76561198162907589', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1515659301}
review:
I have been an avid fan of Harvest Moon since its early days and I was a little skeptical at first when I blindly bought this, but after unknowingly playing for about 6 hours straight right after I finished downloading, I just knew that this game has the same kind of freshness that the previous (and well-loved) games have. The artstyle was very refreshing to see after spending the year immersed in high-resolution textures. Being able to play this game at your own pace is also very welcome. If you need to just relax play this game.


P.S. If you do buy this game, take note of floor 41. Keep going back and make $$$$

author: {'steamid': '76561198046595999', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1610743261}
review:
I have play every single harvest moon game ever been made . I honestly adore the fact that they finally brought it into the pc now. The game is not as polished on graphics compare to wii console, but i have to say is better than the gameboy and the psvita ones. Cotroller or keyboard works really good and having no issue no matter which one you choose. 
Con of the game so far is that even if you choose to play with a keyboard all the help keys point out in controller , meaning if you wanna know what key you need to press on the keyboard you have to go on the key mapping to figure out so for me was a bit annoying .
But all for all i love the game and i definetly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141733428', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1511545840}
review:
It's a close tie with A New Beginning for my least favorite harvest moon. At least A New Beginning looked a lot prettier and felt a lot smoother. I love Harvest Moon and I've played just about all of them as much as I could to some sort of end. This doesn't really feel like a Harvest Moon game.

Firstly, I hate the graphics. The art style is bland and it doesn't look as if they tried very hard on any of it, almost like they threw assets together rather than create a world. Any immersion I might have had is already almost completely lost on this. It reminds me of those free flash games or something you can play on Facebook. The first word that comes to mind when I see it is "cheap". A Wonderful Life looks leagues better and that was on the Gamecube. I don't see any excuses here.

Secondly, nothing at all thus far has pulled me in or interested me. The characters are plain and the story seems rather shallow. It already wants you to invest your time and energy into helping people you hardly know or care about, whereas, in most other Harvest Moon games, it seemed to leave you alone for a little while with your farm and the people, so you could get to know them and the area before throwing you into any kind of plot involving the Harvest Sprites or any sort of conflict, even if it was previously mentioned.

It's too easy. In previous Harvest Moon games, they introduced some interesting things, even if they were different variations of asects from other games, it still worked. Now, in the very beginning it gives you the possibility of infinite cabbage seeds and clearing most of the land without consequence. I read that it was all intentional and that "hard work pays off as with every Harvest Moon" from one of the people working for the game. It isn't hard work at all. What's the point if I can do all of this without consequence within the first couple days in the game?

This game is on the PC but a lot of the mechanics and even the button hints on the screen scream controller. It doesn't tell you to click the right mouse button but if you want to open your bag to hit X on the controller. Why not just make a game for the console?
My guess on that one is that putting it on Steam was an excuse for them to be lazy and make money off of yet another "Harvest Moon" game. And lazy they were.

There's graphical glitches, awkward controls, lack of explanation, poor graphics, bland characters, boring plot, all for a price I wouldn't pay again for it, not in a million years.
I'm incredibly disappointed since I've seen such wonderful Harvest Moon games prior to this one. First PC game is a bust.
Don't waste your money. If I can get a refund, I plan too.
This is a poor excuse for a Harvest Moon game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113754923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1329, 'last_played': 1513543219}
review: Jogo sensacional, superou minhas expectativas. Parem de comparar este jogo com stardew valley. Apesar de muitas semelhanças, é outro jogo, se você jogar vai perceber a diferença, personagens carismáticos, um boa história, jogabilidade muito boa, é muito gostoso de jogar, além da nostalgia para quem jogou os antigos harvest moons. Super recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347090770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2587, 'last_played': 1535456925}
review:
ส่วนตัวแล้วชอบเกมฮาร์เวสมูนมาก แม้จะเล่นไม่เยอะก็ตาม ดังนั้นสำหรับเกมแนวทำฟาร์มอย่างเดียว ถือว่าทำออกมาได้ดี 
-เนื้อเรื่องพอประมาณ จบไวไปนิดนึง ทำให้การเล่นช่วงหลังๆ เบื่อๆ 
-กระเป๋า กว้างใหญ่ เก็บของได้เยอะ แต่คุณภาพ และชนิด ของในเกมก็เยอะตามทำให้เมื่อเล่นไปนานๆ ของจะเต็มจนน่ารำคาญ 
-การทำฟาร์ม ดีตรงที่ไม่ต้องเลือกเครื่องมือ แค่คลิกตัวเกมก็เลือกให้เลยว่าจะ รดน้ำใส่ปุ๋ย บลาๆ สะดวกดี และเก็บผลผลิตได้ครั้งละ 9อัน ไวดี 
แต่ ข้อเสียก็มีคือ ทำอะไรข้ามขั้นไม่ได้ รดน้ำก่อนเก็บเกี่ยวไม่ได้ ทำให้ต้องเดินวนไปมาหลายรอบ 
- มีสัตว์ใหม่ๆ ให้ผลผลิต ที่ภาคอื่นไม่มี  แค่โดยรวมแล้วยังไม่หลากหลาย
.เควสเยอะดี แต่ บางอันก็ทำยาก 
-การตกปลา ตอนแรกๆ ตกยาก แต่ถ้าตกเป้นแล้ว ตก ไปเล่นเว็บ หรือทำอย่างอื่นไป ได้ด้วย พอได้ยินเสียงปลาฮุบเหลือ ค่อยกลับมาจอเกมยังตกทัน
-ข้อเสีย 
-เหมืองขุดยาก (แต่หาเงินได้ดีมาก)
-ไม่มีปฏิทิน ร้านต่างๆ เปิดปิดกี่โมงถ้าไม่ไปดูข้อมูลนอกเกม แทบไม่รู้เลย 
-สิ่งสำคัญเลยคือความโรแมนติก... เหมือนทำเกมมาให้เด็กเล็กๆเล่น แม้แต่ฉาก จูบวันแต่งงานยังเซ็นเซอร์ โถๆ 
ตอนจะแต่งงาน ต้องหาของเยอะ รอนานมากๆ เลย 
ภาคนี้ไม่มีคนช่วยเราทำฟาร์มด้วย (แอนมอลพาเรด สามี+ลูกช่วยทำฟาร์มได้)
-เก็บสัตว์มาเลี้ยงได้แค่แมวอย่างเดียว... 
-------

สรุปแล้ว คิดว่ากราฟฟิกปานกลาง ไม่สวยมากไม่ถึงกับดีเยี่ยม สนุกและคุ้มค่าพอสมควร 
แต่ถ้าให้เทียบแล้วชอบภาคแอนนิมอลพาเรด กับ tot มากว่า (ตัวละคร เควส โรแมนติก )

author: {'steamid': '76561198074564133', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2630, 'last_played': 1547760247}
review:
ACHTUNG! SUBJEKTIVE MEINUNG!

(Vor dem Lesen sollte beachtet werden, dass ich diese Review freischnauze und ohne weitere Recherchen geschrieben habe, in dem kompletten Text nur meine eigene, subjektive Meinung vertrete und in erster Linie nur eine mehr oder weniger kurze Information über meine Eindrücke zu dem Spiel geben und den Leser unterhalten möchte. Das Spiel ist scheinbar nicht aus dem selben Haus, wie die früheren Harvest Moon Teile, dies wusste ich zum Zeitpunkt des Verfassens meiner Review jedoch noch nicht und wurde eher unfreundlich in der Comment-Section darauf hingewiesen, weshalb künftig jegliche Art von Kommentar zu meinem Review gelöscht wird. Noch einmal: Dies soll nur zur Unterhaltung dienen und meinen eigenen Standpunkt wiedergeben. Jeder der seinen eigenen Senf zu dem Spiel abgeben möchte, kann dies in Form einer eigenen Review gerne tun.)

Aufgrund der Tatsache, dass ich eher der stille Genießer bin und nie Reviews schreibe: Trommelwirbel bitte. Hier kommt mein erstes Review, like... ever.

Harvest Moon DS - Das Spiel mit dem alles begann, alles steht und alles fällt. Viele Leute denken, mit dem Kauf des neuen Teils "Harvest Moon: Light of Hope" bekommen sie Gelegenheit, sich von der Melancholie und der Nostalgie ihrer Jugend davon tragen zu lassen... Doch warum gibt es dann trotzdem rote Däumchen, in der Review-Section?
(Achtung! Ich meine damit, dass mein EIGENER Hype und nicht die Reihe an sich mit 'Harvest Moon DS' begann. Mir ist bewusst, dass es davor noch andere Teile gab, leider fand ich die jedoch persönlich nie annähernd so gut wie 'Harvest Moon DS'.)

Grund dafür mag zum einen die Tatsache sein, dass viele nicht bedenken, dass sich über Jahre die Zielgruppen ändern, Spiele sich entwickeln, neue Partner dazu kommen und alte abspringen und es nie ein Spiel zwei mal geben wird und nie ein Spiel so gut oder so schlecht wie das vorherige sein kann - Denn genauso wie die Menschen, die diese Spiele erschaffen oder sie spielen, ist jedes Spiel ein Unikat und unterscheidet sich von den anderen. Liege ich im Recht? Ich hoffe doch.

Wer Fan der "Harvest Moon"-Reihe ist, wird bereits die Entwicklung mitbekommen haben. Mit den letzten Teilen wurde die Grafik zwar immer moderner, doch auch kindgerechter, da - genauso wie bei Pokemon - neue Generationen nachrücken, die nun die neueren Teile unserer alten Kindheits-Helden als ihren Einstieg in die Gaming-Welt nehmen.

Ich gebe zu, die Grafik ist in diesem Teil ein negativer Aspekt. Mir gefällt sie nicht, das ist eine subjektive Meinung und damit bin ich nicht alleine. Aber wie war es denn auch anders zu erwarten, von einem Spiel, welches es normalerweise nur als Handheld gibt? Berichtigt micht, wenn ich dies nun sage, aber: Betrachtet man das Spiel einmal genauer, stellt es sich kleiner und auf einem DS-Bildschirm vor, so ist die Grafik schon weniger schlimm. Und wenn man nun den Ursprungspunkt des Spiels bedenkt... könnte man diesen vielleicht als Entschuldigung nehmen. Vielleicht. Zusätzlich zu der bereits erwähnten "Verkindlichung" natürlich. 

Aber diesen Punkt mal beiseite. Verglichen mit den letzten neu-veröffentlichten "Harvest Moon"-Teilen hat dieser endlich wieder eine Story, an der man gefallen finden kann, wenn man offen ist, dem Spiel eine Chance gibt und vielleicht lange genug die Augen zusammenkneift, bis man sich an die Grafik gewöhnt hat. Unsere Erntewichtel sind zurück, mit altbewährten Namen aus dem "Harvest Moon DS"-Teil, und somit auch die Erntegöttin - und ihr Pervert-Nosebleed-Väterchen. Oder Ehemann. Who knows.

Aber auch sonst ist alles beim Alten: Pflanzen anbauen, Tiere hüten, Katzen zähmen, Hunde halten, eine Mine erkunden, die große Liebe finden, heiraten und ein Kind zur Welt bringen. Letzteres sind Punkte, die auch auf mich noch zukommen werden und ich bin sehr gespannt, inwiefern sie mich catchen werden.

Nostalgie pur, nicht wahr? Auch die Musik gibt den gewissen "Harvest Moon"-Flair wieder. Jedoch muss ich zugeben, dass ich sie nur leise als kleines Hintergrund-Tüdelü vernehme und sie drastisch von Spotify übertönt wird. Aber ich hab mir das Spiel auch nicht wegen der Musik gekauft, verstanden?

Nein, gekauft habe ich dieses Spiel auch aus einem anderen Punkt, der mich leider bisher auch ein wenig (!) wie bestellt und nicht abgeholt im Regen stehen lässt: Charaktertiefe. Bisweilen suche ich verzweifelt nach einem Charakter, der mich so richtig catcht. Den ich mag und heiraten will und mit dem ich gerne rede. Ich habe da so meine Lieblinge, klar. Aber andere Charaktere sind wiederum einfach nur NPCs. Leere Hüllen, die nichts zu erzählen haben. Aber vielleicht geht das auch nur mir so. Subjektive Meinung - ihr erinnert euch?

Um mal von dem zweiten negativen Aspekt unter hunderten von positiven abzulassen:
Wir haben uns entwickelt. Ja, richtig. Auf einmal können Pflanzen mutieren und somit in neuen Farben erstrahlen, die Enzyklopädie erweitern und das Achievement-Hunting auf Vordermann bringen. Das Spiel ist mal wieder ein wenig - wie wollen wir es am besten nennen? - komplex, auch wenn man keine hunderte von Erntewichteln finden muss um eine versteinerte Erntegöttin wieder in ihren Normalzustand zu befördern und dann abzuschleppen. Die Arbeit in der Mine ist zum ersten Mal seit Langem wieder essentiell für das Spiel, die wohl beste Geldquelle die man haben kann... und es macht Spaß! Auch kommen nach dem End-Game neue Tiere hinzu und - wohl das Beste von allem - man wird von den Machern erhört und es gibt tatsächlich Patches. Patches? Patches! 

Ihr seht, das Spiel hat sich entwickelt und es ist noch nicht vorbei. Schnuppert doch einfach mal rein, egal ob ihr neu in der Reihe seid (an dieser Stelle: Tut mir leid, dass ich meine Zielgruppe auf alte Hasen gerichtet habe) oder nicht: Mit zusammengekniffenen Augen und viel Offenheit oder Liebe für "Harvest Moon" wird dieses Spiel euch viele schöne Stunden bescheren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198156550870', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1511462287}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046049207', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1511450357}
review:
For newcomers to the Harvest Moon games, this game is a good way to learn the ropes.

HOWEVER:
As a fan who has grown up with the franchise, right back to the very first game - the only thing "Harvest Moon" about this game, is the title. All the charm have been cut away , the areas are bland, and all the things that made the franchise so lovable is missing. 

This game just feels like a hurried attempt to remind the declining fan base, that the games are still standing strong - which they aren't. 
As a "20 year celebration" to the Harvest Moon games, this is a slap in the face with a dead fish.

review: ถ้าหากคุณเป็นแฟนเกม ปลูกผัก จีบสาว แต่งงาน หรือ เคยเล่น Stardew Valley หรือ แม้แต่จะเป็น Harvest Moon ภาคอื่นๆ การที่คุณไม่ได้ซื้อภาคนี้มาเล่น ถือว่าพลาด ผมเล่นเกมนี้มา 45 ชั่วโมง บอกเลยว่า ในราคา 300 บาท เป็นเกมที่คุ้มค่า ถึงบางทีอาจจะเล่นยาก แต่เกมก็มีเควสรองที่ช่วยคุณประหยัดเวลาในการทำฟาร์ม แล้วเนื้อเรื่องที่ชวนติดตาม ระบบเลี้ยงสัตว์ที่มีเฉพาะในรูปแบบของ Harvest Moon 9.5/10 สำหรับเกมนี้ คุ้มค่า คุ้มราคา ได้ทั้งความสนุก ความสุข ความรู้ และ การตามจีบสาวที่คุณชอบ บอกเลยว่า คุ้ม !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198161564934', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1513653552}
review: Haven't really played a Harvest Moon title (or any other farming game tbh) since I had HM Boy & Girl in my psp. I had second thoughts on buying this game since I thought it would just get boring after 2 to 3 hrs but it has some kind of variety and charm to it that hooked me up into playing even though I had quizzes/exams the next day (lol). This is a Harvest Moon game, don't expect any Rune Factory/SoS/Stardew Valley level of shit here, if you enjoyed playing the old school(ps1/ps2/psp) versions of Harvest Moon I'm pretty sure you'd enjoy this game just as much as those versions

author: {'steamid': '76561198027316824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 3279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1518092083}
review:
I am tempted to give this game a positive just because it's Harvest Moon. This franchise was my all-time favorite game when I was still playing on my GBA and after that my Nintendo DS. I mean, I started playing Stardew Valley because of HM.

Comparing with games such as Stardew Valley or World's Dawn there are a few things I am missing (for example, something simple as a calender where I can find the birthdays and events). However since I have only just started playing and the game has only just been released I'll give this the benefit of the doubt and won't let this weigh too heavily when forming my opinion.

In fact, while writing this review there is only one thing I don't like about the game and that's the art style. The design of the characters (especially up close) I find more befitting a Nintendo console such as the 3DS or the Wii. But honestly, it's not something that bothers me a lot. I just prefer an art style either like several visual novels have (more anime-style) or like some H.O.-games have (most Eipix games). I am sure there are people who actually prefer the art style of HM.

All in all, I am looking forward to the future. How the game will develop further, how much effort the developers will put in this game now that it's released. One thing is for sure, it has great potential and I for one am very happy that HM is finally available on pc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060799282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1407, 'last_played': 1511409421}
review:
I've been playing Harvest Moon since 1997 and I'm absolutely addicted to its repetitive gameplay, but Natsume just can't seem to get a good mechanic down. I first thought it was a limitation of the Tech, but now I'm just wondering if they're lazy.

For example, it's great that you can walk over crops, but you can't walk over weeds??? In the GBA (Mineral Town) version, grass would grow back after the animals ate it, but in this one you have to CONSTANTLY: till, plant, water, repeat. IT'S GRASS. Why can't the animals eat weeds?? Seriously, weeds (and rocks) don't grow that fast.

They got rid of pushing the animals (one-by-one), but instead of a bell; why not an open door concept? When your barn door is open: the animals can roam in and out (morning/evening). Cows sleep outside all the time with no problems. Keep the sick mechanic, but only when you leave the animals out when it's raining/hurricane. Rushing to get them in the barn and closing the door can be a thing. I liked the Gamecube version where you had a pasture for animals. This world is big enough, but there's no pasture?

This game would be great if, when you expanded (built the bridges), you could turn that land into a grazing pasture or something. It's a cheap way of turning expansion into a reward.

More expansion options. I get all this cash, but nothing to spend it on. There should be: Seeders, Automatic milkers, Auto feeders, SPRINKLERS, seed hybrid machines (I couldn't figure out the Gamecube version. Don't make it that complicated. A minigame or simply waiting is sufficient to get new seeds) etc. You should still have to interface with something everyday, but getting these toys will allow you to spend more time expanding the farm or romancing locals. As it is, You only have enough Time/energy for small gardens here or there even after maxed out everything.

The game should start out like chipping at a mountain with a toothpick, but as time goes by and the more work/effort you do the more utilities you should get. Like in real life. I'm not talking about a combine. I'm talking about simple tools for the animals.

There should be family things. Picnics, etc. IDK. Something. Ok, I'm married. Now what?

The wife should help and depending upon who you choose (lazy, stubborn, thrifty, etc) should determine what they do around the house. One can be good at farm work. One that doesn't do anything except spend your money. One that cooks all the time. One that gets discounts at the store. Etc. Have them do something!

Houses/building should be real. We have the tech. Why isn't there an upstairs? Why are all the adults single? The 90s are over. It doesn't have to be fancy, but something that doesn't feel like a shed.

Befriending the sprites should also reward something. Like randomly upgrading quality of crops/animal products. Finding and giving rare foods/minerals. There's a sprite for every chore, but all I see them doing is getting in the way.

The chicken coop. Why not have an attache where the chickens can walk and roam and feed outside? This should be an upgrade option for the coop. You don't need this huge building for chickens. I lift their lid (I have chickens in real life) and grab the eggs. There's a trough I pour feed in. Chickens NATURALLY seek shelter at night. I just make sure the feed is full, but with the attache (it's a fenced in area around the coop) feeds costs are now nill. The Doc NEEDS that for an building option.

I've been wanting Natsume to fix these issues for decades, and I'm hoping they do that in the next game (and the graphics should be Gamecube or better quality). I know Harvest Moon is not about the graphics, but in this day and age it just feels lazy.

review:
I completed the "story mode" of the game in just under 50 hours, taking my time, and though it was relatively easy, it's still a cute and fun Harvest Moon game. Even post-story mode, I am still enjoying the gameplay, just trying to do quests, unlock the achievements, complete the encyclopedia etc. There's a lot to do. My main complaint is that a lot of the trees and rocks respawn far too quickly; I understand though that this is a new game and hopefully there will be further patches somewhere in the near future. 

Overall though, it's a solid game that still kept me interested 50 hours in, which has me pretty satisfied. Though, the price of the game is pretty expensive at over $30.

review: I played many HM games as a child on multiple platforms. I do love the nostalgia, however the FPS is rediculous and should be worked on. Now, If I had this vs Stardew I would probably pick SD. I cheated though and own both and have put ...many...many..many hours into SD just like I did HM as a kid. I feel like if just minor things were just improved I would change my comment. However I would still recommend the game and still love it, Nostalgia talks right to my wallet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198228622740', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1650, 'last_played': 1511561189}
review:
The first thing I must say is this is a TRUE harvest moon game and it brought me many hours of pure nostalgic joy. At 25 hours I feel like I had barely scratched the surface of the content that is available in this game. It’s fun, relaxing, and I personally LOVE the graphics. I am a diehard harvest moon fan and must say that this game can best be compared to the design of both harvest moon: magical melody and Stardew Valley. That being said there’s nothing wrong with Stardew Valley and I’ve seen a lot of people suggesting it rather than buying this game as its $15 cheaper. If you aren’t a harvest moon fan and love indie games than I HIGHLY SUGGEST you buy Stardew Valley instead. Personally, I’ve played harvest moon all my life. I’m currently 22 years old and I’ve been playing harvest moon games since I was six or seven so of course I’m going to be very biased to loving this game, which I do A LOT. Stardew Valley is not appealing to me because it personally does not “feel” like harvest moon. It was mostly an indie graphics problem for me. If you don’t like Stardew Valley because of the graphics than harvest moon: a light of hope is the game for you. It very closely resembles similar graphics to harvest moon: a magical melody and a very similar playstyle. Bottom line that people must understand is that harvest moon and Stardew Valley cannot be compared. They are different in a lot of ways and in my honest option just doesn’t have the same “harvest moon” nostalgic feel. Harvest moon games never had indie graphics and to be honest that is what instantly turned me away from even wanting to try Stardew Valley. That being said the choice is yours! If you’re still interested in learning more about Harvest Moon: Light of Hope, there is a pro/con and changes list below: 
Since this game cannot be compared to Harvest moon: a wonderful life as it is in no way similar I will compare it to harvest moon: magical melody as it seems to adopt the same style. 

Things that have changed since Magical Melody: 

1.	The Map! This is a GREAT CHANGE in my opinion as the map in harvest moon: a light of hope is SO MUCH BETTER! In a magical melody you had to buy different plots from all around the map and it was very very frustrating and almost impossible for you to have multiple farms. In a light of hope they made your farm not only centralized but also having different areas that are attached to your farm that can be unlocked for additional plot space. I LOVE THIS.
2.	I LOVE the story. You’re basically tasked with rebuilding the town. This may turn a lot of people off to the game because it is grindy.. BUT THAT’S WHAT A HARVEST MOON GAME IS. If you don’t like relaxing farming simulators, then this game wont please you.
3.	NO MORE LIMITED BAG SPACE!!! This is the change I have to say I welcomed the most. One of the most frustrating things to me in Magical Melody was having to upgrade my bags and going through them every day to try clear them out. The backpack system in this game is wonderful and it will bring you absolutely no annoyance.
I realize that there are no negative changes listed but once again this is just my opinion and Harvest Moon: Magical Melody is hands down one of my most favorite games ever made. I liked all the changes made to Light of Hope and I truly believe Light of Hope is a superior game. It captures the spirit of a true harvest moon game.

Pros:

1.	I love how you no longer must change out your tools hoe/axe/hammer etc. when farming. This was always something that frustrated me about harvest moon games but that is no longer a problem! You no longer must switch out, but the game automatically knows what tool you want to use. This makes farming smooth and simple and really makes relaxing your top priority. 
2.	The Map
3.	The story 
4.	FREE BAG SPACE!!

Cons:

Given that I really do love this game it was difficult for me to come up with any cons, so I will address some things that other people have been bringing up in reviews. 

1.	Many people may view the lack of customization as a con. I can understand this if you are a Stardew Valley, harvest moon: skytree village, or harvest moon: new beginnings fan. Harvest moon: a wonderful life and harvest moon: a magical melody NEVER had customization and as this game is a 20th anniversary edition I must say I would have been disappointed if it did. 

2.	The cutscenes are a little annoying if you already know what you’re doing because they cannot be skipped. However, once you get through them you never have to go through them again. 

I hope this review helped you decide if this is the game for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086330653', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1587906744}
review:
I love the harvest moon series. To be clear I'm not saying alternatives are bad, they just didn't give me that harvest moon feel when I played it. I was scared because of some of the negative reviews but now that I've played it I can see that this truly does give me the feeling that I used to get when playing harvest moon back in my childhood, and that feeling is losing track of time while I spend hours trying to manage what I want to do next, whether it's focussing on making certain crops or improving relationships with the other characters or upgrading my tools, and the list goes on.

The way this game essentially works is you "build" the town first, and then you play. you are meant to acquire certain materials and then use them to repair old buildings around the city in order to bring back the old residents of the town. The game does this in a way to introduce you to new elements one at a time as to not overwhelm you from the get go. For example the first few things you repair just require softwood which can be obtained from many trees, then once you advance a little you will start repairing buildings that require wood + stone and from there on they get more and more complex in order to teach you how to use new tools and such, you will also unlock new areas of the map over time as you progress the main story so you aren't overwhelmed with the big map right out of the gate.

There's a bookshelf in your house that has a tips category that grows as you unlock stuff so it's a good idea to go back and check it every once in a while because otherwise you will most likely miss a lot of information.

Here's what I think based on my experience with other HM games compared to this one.

PROS: Game has a decent story, it's not like the old school HM games where the story is "save the town by making a lot of money and friends" it's more like the modern HM games where you try to restore life by completing goals.

Game has a good way of introducing things to you as quickly as you are able to understand them, you progress on your own terms.

Game has a ballanced focus on building your farm as well as rebuilding the town, some things rely on others in order to be improved, like you need to have the blacksmith back in order to upgrade your tools that way you can be more effecient at farming.

Game has a good variety of characters and has the standard friendship builder that shows with music notes when you speak to them.

Game does a good job at allowing you to use tools for their given purposes when looking at a surface that needs that tool instead of picking the tool you want to use and then press an action button.

Game probably has the most extensive list of vegetables out of any HM game I have ever played, this is mainly due to the fact that vegetables can mutate based on various conditions like which soil they are grown on or what other things they are grown near, an example of a mutation would be planting 6 cabbages and then 2 of them end up being red cabbages instead of green ones.

Game does a good job with crops in general. You don't have to worry about sorting them in any specific manner because each seed sows 1 spot so you don't have to make weird crop patterns to effeciently accomodate the most crops, this is also made possible by the fact that all crops have no hit boxes so you can walk right through all of them.

Now here's the negative things,

CONS: Game does a pretty poor job explaining how mining works, if you have ever played HM before then you can probably gather that you go into the mine and hit the crystals with your hammer and then use the hoe to find the ladder, but even after that the gems you find aren't even worth a lot UNTIL you process them at the blacksmith by talking to him during his working hours and tabbing over to his 2nd tab and trading your ores for processed versions of the items you dug up, I figured this out but it took me some time and I know this is a confusing subject because I have seen a lot of people point out in their negative reviews that mining makes no money, in fact mining makes INSANE amounts of money once you figure this out, almost too much money in my opinion.

Game might feel slow or empty to newer players. You pretty much unlock EVERYTHING in this game, you start with practically nothing. So to people who have never played a HM game in their life they might expect to be put in this world filled with NPC's and such but that only happens once you begin rebuilding stuff and getting them to come back. I have seen reviews of people saying there are only like 14 npc's but I am on the 2nd day of summer and there's at least 24 different NPC's that I can converse with so I get the idea that some people might think the game has no content.

Game has (in my opinion) slow progression for tools. In order to upgrade your tools you need to unlock the blacksmith and then pay him 3k (or 10k for fishing rod) per tool + the required materials to upgrade them. Most of the materials are simple to get but for some reason you need a specific type of flower to upgrade them the first time and those flowers don't even become available until you unlock them which might take some time. 

Game could have more interesting NPC's. There's times during certain quests that any NPC involved in that quest will essentially be locked in the same area until you complete that quest and some of the later ones can easily take an in-game week to complete because you must wait for a certain crop to grow. 
I feel like this is kind of a way to remind the player that they need to do the quest and not forget the main objective, but I can't help but feel like they coulda just done that with either an in-game journal that tracks progress or at the very most have one of the harvest sprites remind you whenever you spoke with them, but to have an entire city in a hypnotic state over a blue bird for an entire in game week is kinda rediculous in my mind. 
You can still speak with them and gift them things, but everytime you talk with them they will repeat that same line, which most NPC's do anyways until you get their friendship status to the next milestone, but it's still pretty shoddy in my opinion. The game does however do a decent job of having events happen when you get all the different villagers to certain friendship levels, but other than that it's pretty much the typical HM NPC experience.

Game took away two things that I heavily relied on in old HM games, the T.V & the Calandar. Now the only way to tell the weather for the next day is to get this wizard back into the town and then go to him at his convenience and he can read tomorrows weather for you, on the bright side rain plays a significantly smaller role now because animals hate being left outside overnight REGARDLESS of what the weather will be the next day, plus there's a bell outside the barn that can move the animals from the barn to outside and vice versa.  There are however some new weather types that can hurt crops and such which would be very nice to be able to see a day early on T.V but they did what they did. The removal of the calandar in my opinion was the worst idea, for a game that does a good job of holding your hand through the beginning, now you're expected to remember birthdays and festivals without that aid, yes you can open up the menu and go to villagers, and go through every single one of them to see when their birthdays are, but that takes time and you just end up forgetting anyways. The same thing can be done with festivals but again it's tedious and too time consuming.

Those are the primary topics that I could think of to cover in my current experience with the game, I will be sure to update this review if I run into anything in the future that I feel should be added. My end conclusion is that I love the HM series and this game is no exception, I am having loads of fun with it and it has been keeping me well entertained for a few days now.
