author: {'steamid': '76561198044394101', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 14124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11823, 'last_played': 1532979239}
review:
Edit: I want to take a moment and address the name controversy. Even though it's been four years since this happened, I still see a lot of hate being spewed at Natsume--that they "stole" the Harvest Moon name, they're "lying" to people, and Story of Seasons is the "real" Harvest Moon. But a little bit of knowledge is a dangerous thing, as they say, and there's a lot of facts these people don't know. For anyone reading the topic who doesn't know the story, Harvest Moon games were originally made in Japan and published under the name "Bokujou Monogatari." Then Natsume would translate the games into English and release them as Harvest Moon. But after A New Beginning, Marvelous yanked the series from Natsume and began having XSeed, their western publisher, localize the games as Story of Seasons. Then Natsume began internally developing their own Harvest Moon games, consisting of The Lost Valley, Skytree Village, Seeds of Memories, and Light of Hope. So without further ado, here's some facts you may not be aware:

1. Marvelous did not create the Bokujou Monogatari franchise.
Bokujou Monogatari was originally owned by Pack-In Video, which later merged with Victor Entertainment. Marvelous later bought out Victor Entertainment and acquired the rights through that purchase.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pack-In-Video
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvelous_Entertainment#Marvelous_Interactive_Inc.

2. Animal Parade is the last real Harvest Moon game.
Many fans commonly cite Animal Parade as one of the best games in the series and a good entry point for newcomers. That's because it was the last game made by the real creator of the series, who left Marvelous after that.

http://harvestmoon.wikia.com/wiki/Yasuhiro_Wada

3. The Marvelous games, including Story of Seasons, were not made by the original development team.
Even after Yasuhiro Wada and most of the pre-Marvelous development team left, Marvelous just hired a new development team and continued making games under the Bokujou Monogatari banner. Compare the credits of an older game in the series like Harvest Moon 64 to Story of Seasons, and you won't find a single name in common. Even when you compare the credits of Animal Parade to the credits of Story of Seasons, you'll barely find any names in common and the two most notable ones (Yoshifumi Hashimoto and Igusa Matsuyama) are only listed under Special Thanks.

http://fogu.com/hm/animal_parade/game_credits.php
http://fogu.com/sos2/game-credits.html

4. If you think Natsume "lied," then Marvelous has lied to you for years.
The Story of Seasons games are made by completely different people compared to beloved classics like Harvest Moon 64. So if you're going to hate on anyone, it should be Marvelous. They changed development teams years before Natsume began developing Harvest Moon titles.

5. Marvelous is to blame for the name change, not Natsume.
Many people think Natsume refused to license the trademark out of spite, but Marvelous actually declined to license it. When Marvelous notified Natsume that they would not be licensing Bokujou Monogatari anymore, they had already made the decision to release the series under a new name.

Hiro Maekawa, President of Natsume: Roughly three years ago, Marvelous notified us that they were not going to license their Bokujo Monogatari series to Natsume anymore, and that they were going to release the series by themselves under a different brand name. Needless to say, we were surprised by this decision. One of the things I am proud of at Natsume is that we have loyal and longstanding relationships based on mutual trust and integrity with our partners, and we never like to see a successful partnership end, especially one that includes a product so near and dear to my own heart.

http://www.siliconera.com/2015/03/18/harvest-moon-beyond-whats-next-natsume/

6. What Marvelous did is considered a jerk move by Japanese standards.
From an American perspective, having XSeed localize the games is completely logical. From a Japanese standpoint, you don't turn your back on a loyal partner. Loyalty is extremely important in Japanese business culture.

"The Japanese, for example, define business ethics in terms of loyalty to their companies, their business networks, and their nation."

https://hbr.org/1996/09/values-in-tension-ethics-away-from-home

7. If the president of Natsume hadn't gambled on the original Harvest Moon, we probably wouldn't be getting the games.
People thought he was nuts trying to bring the series over, but Hiro Maekawa was positive there was a market for the game and he was right. The series would have likely remained in Japan for decades or even forever if not for him. Maybe you could show a little gratitude by not being a colossal jerk to the company that brought you years of fantastic memories? You don't have to play the new games or like them, just don't be hateful.

8. Natsume spent over 15 years building the Harvest Moon fanbase in the west. 
If you're not familiar with business, you may not understand what a huge deal it is that Natsume spent fifteen years building a market in the west for Harvest Moon. Then Marvelous, the new kid on the block, yanked the series from them and flushed Natsume's years of hard work down the drain. Legit move? Of course, they had the right to do that. But surely you can muster some sympathy for Natsume in this situation.

9. Now do you understand why Natsume began developing their own games?
Marvelous handed them lemons and Natsume made lemonade. Thanks to that, we now have two farming series to play instead of just one, and both are getting better with every new game. Frankly, that's totally awesome for fans. It's fine to prefer one series over the other, but please stop the misguided cries of "dis isn't REEL Harvest Moon," "Natsume stole the name," etc. It's completely pointless to argue that one is "real" and the other isn't when there AREN'T any real Harvest Moon games anymore. All we have left are two different companies making games, one under the name "Story of Seasons" and the other under "Harvest Moon."

10. PS: Natsume's Harvest Moon games are in fact developed in Japan.
For those people who turn their noses up at western-developed games, Natsume's internally developed games are made in Japan and localized for western release.

Original review:
Don't let the haters put you off this game. The graphics might not appeal to everyone, but the gameplay underneath it is solid and improved compared to Skytree Village. Give it a try--you can always get a refund if you don't like it and played less than two hours. I'll try to update this review with more points as I continue playing.

Pros:
-The game has a main story, unlike many modern HM games.

-You don't just gift people, you can do requests for them and they'll give you rewards.

-The crop mutation system is really fun. You can plant crops in different areas besides your farm with different fertilizer, and they'll produce a new crop.

-You don't need to change tools, the game will automatically use the right tool when you press the Action button.

- FoMT mining system, which is way better than mining in SoS. Instead of just smashing a single rock and reloading if you get the wrong thing, you explore a mine and have to find the staircase by digging.

-You can fish nearly anywhere with water instead of just designated fishing spots, and you can see the fish swimming around. They also sell for good money. Bait is also much more useful compared to Skytree Village.

-Music is nice; too bad the soundtrack isn't for sale.

-Cows that give chocolate milk!

-Not just one, but two marriagable wizards!

Cons:
-The main story is fairly short. 

-No new characters compared to Skytree Village

-Characters don't have much dialogue.

-Less customization

author: {'steamid': '76561198163411984', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1546346383}
review:
I've played Harvestmoon since N64 days, and along with all the older games and newer. Included when the company split to XSeed. This is an actual improvement to me for Natsume. The past 2 or 3 games weren't thrilling and low rated for me. To the point it was a waste of money. 
This one I see improvements.
HOWEVER; I only feel netural about this game.

I am going to go down starting the dislikes.
Dislikes: 
-Disappearing villagers? Why not let them walk to the next loading screen? Thats so weird and it makes the game feel....like it's missing something?
-Short story line . I almost beat the main quest within ONE season. 
-What happen to the marriage flowers? these quest requst lines are kinda...blah to me.
-No voice overs?
-Not enough content like in Stardew Valley or Story of the Season.
- Price doesn't equal how much care and love they put into this game.
-No feeling on the characters. Not many lines...They kinda say the same things....
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Likes:
- Crops have different types like instead of A+, or a grading system it's more like a more different crop.
-different terrioration this is a big plus because it's different and for each crop it improved and makes it worse. I really like this idea.
-Interesting story line
-the rebuilding process 
-lots of farm land
-this game I can let my future children play because it looks like it's for the younger age kids. Not us adults lol.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Neither dislike/like
-No new characters in the past 4-5 years. This is not an issue really, but there is no new creativity.
BUT many havestmoon characters are also reused. Like from NES, Gameboy, SNES, N64, Gameboy advance and some  other come backs. I don't see why some people have problems now? Ann, Popri, Karen, Mary, Elli been in how many Harvestmoon games? See this is for me defending Natsume because they always done it. So they shouldn't be bashed or rated by reused characters.
-graphics I can live with, I see improvements from the moblie apps

This can change.
Do I recommand this game. Yes
Rate: 6/10
Room for improvement
Is it worth 29.99?
No, I would wait for a sale. 
I would say 20.00 or less for the price of the game. 

Everyone has their thoughts about the game.
Natume keep trying, not saying you have to go back to A Wonderful Life.
Magical Melody though.... <3 I loved that game.

review: A IMPRESSÃO QUE EU TIVE DO JOGO É QUE OS GRÁFICOS DO BACK TO NATURE SÃO MELHORES DO QUE DESSE AKI,ALÉM DE ENCHER O JOGADOR DE CONVERSAS DESNECESSÁRIAS PRA TOMAR SEU TEMPO,MODELAGEM 3D DOS PERSONAGENS COM UM UMA IMAGEM 2D QUE SIMULA UM AMBIENTE(NEM SER PELO MENOS UMA IMAGEM COM QUALIDADE NÃO É 144P E F******),NESSE AKI VC N PODE ESCOLHER A FERRAMENTA QUE USAR (NAO TEM COMO MAIS MOLHAR AS GALINHAS MT DAORA DE ANTIGAMENTE) UM CACHORRO EXTREMAMENTE ZUADOOOOO SÉRIO MT FEIO PARECE UM RATO O BAGUI E PRA COMPLETAR OS CARAS TEM A CARA DE PAU DE VENDER O GAME POR 72.99.PELO AMOR DE DEUS SE VOCÊ É UM FÃ DE HARVEST MOON E TA COM SAUDADES NAO COMPRE ESSA COISA CHAMADA DE JOGO SÉRIO UMA BOA DICA É O STARDEW VALLEY ESSE SIM É BOM PODE CONFIAR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066092315', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5888, 'last_played': 1530464746}
review:
First few minutes of the game is not intresting with little story. And correct me if I'm wrong but I couldn't find anyway to skip the lengthy tutorial. The cutscenes go on to be not only boring but almost entirely unskippable aside form the text itself which can be button mashed through. 
Unlocking all the characters feels like a poor excuse for gathering/spending money and materials as you don't get a choice in what you build or any kind of new machanic to set it off from that last game that hadthe player build the town from scratch. It really feels like you never have to really go out of your way and work hard to get anything. Once you know to just keep everything you get from rewards, you're kinda set for the cycle. 
The graphics are not at all appealing from the purely objective (and kinda logical) stand point of; why are the 3d models polygon (it is 2018) and why do most of the pixels look weirdly compressed as though someone saved the PNGs as JPGs. Something else I noticed, especially in winter, was the fact that the floor tiles don't match up when they are put side to side in-game. I'd say the game feels unfinished, but it's more just seems to be designed like an IOS game.
I would get my money back, way too much money for an IOS game, but to find out whether or not you like the game you have to pass the 3 hour refund time. 8 hours in and there's still more basic things to unlock.

Though I will say, I do like how the dirt looks. Those dirt tiles still don't match up side by side but it's the best example of the 'painted art style' people seem to love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126755625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7255, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5497, 'last_played': 1571429252}
review:
[u]The Cons:[/u]

1.  There are a few graphical issues and the graphics are certainly not stunning by any means.
2.  The story feels way too easy to complete and the upgrades aren't terribly time consuming either.  
3.  Beyond a few requests and repairs there is no purpose for wool and fur.  There is no tailor to use them at or any clothing to collect.  Some of my favorite games of this genre allowed for buffs if you wore certain items together.
4.  A lot of the content and NPCs are recycled from previous games so it appears there wasn't a lot of effort put into design or development.
5.  There appears to be a lot of little bugs here and there which, again, makes it seem as though not a lot of effort was involved and the game was rushed.


[u]The Pros:[/u]

1.  Being able to work towards achievements and show them off, being this is a PC game on steam, makes the grind feel worth it.
2.  Not having to switch tools constantly was a nice perk.  Tools are also upgradeable which saves on time in-game.
3.  The farming buddy that shows you what is growing and the health of the plant was extremelly helpful in caring properly for crops.
4.  Being able to grow any plant in any season without a greenhouse right off the bat and trying to find mutations makes the game unique to any other competitors in the genre.


[u]Overall[/u]

While it was entertaining and I am still playing it I don't feel the quality is on par with a 20th Anniversary title nor is it worth the current price tag.  So, due to that and in spite of my love for the series, I personally wouldn't feel right recommending it.  However, there is plenty of room for improvement and hopefully we'll see some very nice DLC down the road to add more depth and ramp up the entertaininment value.  For now though, save your money and keep an eye out for sales or improvements before you buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350794212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1688, 'last_played': 1512376905}
review:
สนุกเลยล่ะ

ขอบอกก่อนว่า ไม่ได้เล่นHMภาคหลังๆที่ลง3dsเลยนะ ดังนั้นจึงไม่รู้จะเปรียบเทียบกับอะไรดี

เนื้อเรื่อง เรามาติดเกาะโทรมๆที่แทบไม่มีคนอยู่ เพราะที่เกาะเคยเกิดพายุหนักพัดบ้านเรือนเสียหาย ประภาคารก็ไม่มีแสงซ่อมไงก็ไม่สำเร็จ เกาะทรุมโทรมลงเรื่อยๆ ไม่รู้เพราะอะไรดลใจเราตัดสินใจจะอยู่ที่นี่ จึงต้องมาฟื้นฟูเกาะ ซ่อมบ้านเรือนให้คนกลับมาอยู่และซ่อมประภาคารให้กลับมาใช้ได้ดังเดิม

ตัวเกมเหมือนrpgแบบปลูกผัก คือมีเควสหลักฟื้นฟูเกาะ และเควสย่อยๆจากชาวเมือง มีแผนที่หลากหลายที่ต้องใช้ของในการปลด 

ระบบต่างๆเปลี่ยนไปจะHMสมัยก่อนๆเยอะ เราชอบนะดูมีมิติดี
เช่น ขายของกับsamได้ทุกชนิดแต่ราคากลางๆ แต่ถ้าขายดอกไม้ที่ร้านดอกไม้หรือขายวัตถุดิบที่ร้านอาหารจะได้ราคาดีขึ้น

sam ไม่ได้ประจำอยู่ที่ร้าน บางวันอยู่ในฟาร์มเรา บางวันก็ไปอยู่บนเขา

หรือผักบางชนิดต้องปลูกในดินเฉพาะ

ภาคนี้ไม่มีปฏิทิน ร้องไห้หนักมาก

ไม่มีทีวีนะ อยากรู้สภาพอากาศต้องไปหาพ่อมดฝึกหัดให้ทำนายให้

ตัวละครที่จีบได้ หนุ่มๆน่ารักดี ให้ผ่าน ปล.ทำไมถึงจีบไมเคิลไม่ได้ เด็กแล้วไง สงสารคนเล่นสายโชตะหน่อย โฮฮฮฮ

เรื่องภาพเรามาตัวละครดูสูงเก้งก้างไปหน่อย แต่พวกพื้นหลังนี่ ok เลย ปกติถ้ากราฟฟิกมีพวก 3D เราจะปวดตาแต่นี่เล่นได้ยาวๆ

สรุปว่าเราให้ผ่าน รสนิยมแต่ละคนไม่เหมือนกัน มีคนชอบก็ต้องมีคนไม่ชอบ

ส่วนราคา 300กว่านี่ก็ไม่แพงนะ 

กลัวอย่างเดียว จะทิ้งไม่อัพเดทนะสิ ในอนาคตช่วยอัพเดทโชตะน้อยๆมาเป็นกำลังใจให้ที

author: {'steamid': '76561197991178476', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1588532320}
review:
I have been a follower of Harvest Moon since PS 1.  I love this series, I love this concept, and I love this game title.  Here is my first impressions.

First off, I am thrilled that this game has finally come to PC.  At last!  

Please note, this is not Stardew Valley and should be played differently.

The game seems a bit dumb down from the pervious versions of the title.  The 'story' is a bit childish and appears to be less comples.  I'm not randomly seeing people or bumping into them, but I am forced to through what seems to be a linar story line.  (I am not sure if I'm just too new into the game yet for it to open it)  

I don't know where the random festivals are, the town mayor, why some houses are just 'we'll come back later' after its repaired.  It seems less logic/story based then just 'not yet for your linar story line'.  In the past the game used to have business hours.  At 12 or 1:00pm you knew others would be having lunch or doing their normal rourtine.  

I'm curious what the future holds for this game.  The reason the series has lasted this long has been due to the complex and adorable story lines, attempting to reach goals, getting married, making your farm (the way you want it made) etc.

The ability to farm with one click is AMAZING so thank you!!!  I don't mind skipping over the dull routine of doing the same thing over and over again.

Also hoping I'll have storage somewhere?  We shall see with that as well.

As of now I do recommend this game, but be aware its interesting.  This is also not a graphic based game by any means.  I don't know why the DS version has better graphics - I'm not into major graphics but I also don't understand the downgrade.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054053037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1556, 'last_played': 1582770474}
review:
I am delighted to play this game...it is important to note that I am a long-term Harvest Moon fan, from DS, Game Cube, and Wii days.  Every year I begged Natsume to make a PC version.  The initial reviews I read made me worry, but I bought anyhow, and I am very glad I did.  Is this perfect?  No.  Is it exactly what I hoped for in a Harvest Moon PC game?  No.  I would like the music from one of the early games, perhaps it was It's a Wonderful Life, where you connected with the Mineral Town DS and could trade items from two towns.  The perfect game in the Natsume portfolio for me was Rune Factory Frontier on the Wii.  So, yes, I would have preferred more elements from some of the earlier games.  Maybe that will come later?

However, this is highly enjoyable and I am having a great time figuring things out for myself.  At first I thought the fishing was another horrid challenge as it is in some games (like Stardew Valley), but I figured it out, and I like the mining, too.  I will also add that Stardew Valley was always a clone of Harvest Moon for me, as I am so grounded in the latter.  Naturally, I loved Stardew Valley, and will return to it at some point, but I do warmly recommend Harvest Moon:  Light of Hope.  Very thankful to have it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198240969650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1551, 'last_played': 1562803099}
review: If this is the type of game you like, then get it. I love games like HM, Stardew, World's Dawn, Rune Factory, ect, so when this game came out, I was excited. The reviews through me off, but I still decided to get it. If the art style in the preview turns you off, then don't get it because that's what the game looks like (obviously). I don't understand why most comments are about the graphics when you could see them before you bought the game? It took me about 18 hours to finish the story and I am working on marriage/kids now. My advice is to save about 5 of everything, get fertilizer, and get the upgrades that you can as soon as you can. I liked the game because it's the type of game I enjoy, simple as that. Is it better than Stardew? No, but if you'd played Stardew and you're looking for something in the same realm, get this game because it's similar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043208394', 'num_games_owned': 1752, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2851, 'last_played': 1559617808}
review:
To Start, I wouldnt recommend coming into this game with the mindset of Story of Seasons or Stardew Valley gameplay. There have many similarities, but SoS has had decades of experience and changing to refine its style and gameplay versus the couple of years that Natsume's beeen making games (not just publishing them). I would equate this game to the older Harvest Moons (ie. N64 or Gameboy). 

Whats I like in the game : 
-The crop growing and animal raising has been streamlined. No more pushing individual animals in/out of the barn or switching between tools.
-Cute story. Its simple (as the original HM games were pretty simple) and progresses rather quickly, so you dont have to wait months in game to grow a crop to progress the game.If youre looking for harder challenges to complete, you can work on upgrading your farm and tools, which require A LOT moire supplies and money.
-The mutation system. Its fun to try different plants in different areas to see what happens (though I wish there were more variations)
-They brought back the gift system. This was lacking in the 3ds game, so its nice to see that come back.

What I didnt like: 
-Repeated characters. There are a few new characters, but MOST of the characters weve seen in the last 2 Harvest Moon games, so its like introducing yourself to the same person withthe same personality and the same problems over and over again. They also tend to repeat the same thing over and over.I also wish there were more then the 14-ish characters total. 
-Graphically, I wouldnt same its bad, but I wish there was a little more variation and a little more effort put into the scenary (though again, the old HM games didnt have much done with the background either). 
-Mining is a pain, you have to plan to use your whole day getting to the next landing level and you have to take a lot of food because the latter placement is random in these huge rooms, you can go through all 5 hearst just on 1 level looking for the latter to the next one and the landings are only every 5 levels. 

Untimately, I think its a game you have to give a few hours of play time to really make a decisiom on likablilty And if you expect ts going to be as good as the SoS games or Stardew Valley, then you will probably be disappointed. But if you go into from the perspective of the old HM games or comparing it to the last few entries, It is improving in quality. I personally like it and find it a good game for the time between now and when the next SoS game gets localized. Not the best, but Deffinantly not the worst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057656483', 'num_games_owned': 234, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2879, 'last_played': 1512141917}
review:
Buy this when it's on sale (because honestly this seems more like a $15 game).  I've played the Harvest Moon games for years, and even though Stardew Valley basically puts this game to shame (independently made, tons of wonderful content and marriage candidates), this game is still good in some aspects.

However, I have a lot of gripes with it.  Doesn't even seem like they really tried on some aspects of the mobile port (Tap on screen, seriously?  How did that get through testing?), and some of the key bindings don't really make sense - but it seems they tried to remedy that in their latest update.

My biggest gripe I have so far is that there is NO (clear?) WAY of deleting saved games. I mean, I accidentally made a new save for my current farm, so now I have two saves.  I tried going into my Harvest Moon folder and attempting to find the save data that way, but I couldn't find them at all.  Please make a way to actually delete saved data, or at least make it clearer if already implemented.

I'm also unsure which people are the bachelors/bachlorettes?  I see the friendship meters, but it's not very apparent which of them are actually available for marriage. Not a big deal, but it's still something that should be apparent.  Maybe with hearts instead of music notes?

Also, the walking/running animation makes it seem like you should be going faster than you actually are.  I suggest tweaking it a bit to make the animations a bit slower.  Also, the path-finding heading up to Edmond's house is pretty bad - my character just kept running back and forth like she was lost.

Edit: A few more things I want to point out that I forgot about until I started playing again after the review.  Some of the descriptions of crops aren't consistent.  Some crops state that they can be harvested more than once, but then an NPC informed me that strawberries ALSO could be harvested more than once despite its description not saying so.  There is no consistency there, and there definitely should be.

Another issue that I found out is that it takes energy to pet your animals? Understandable I guess until you're trying to feed your animals and they keep getting in the way of the feeder despite pushing them, so you just keep petting them and WASTING ENERGY because they're being assholes. Please make it cost a lot less or make it easier to push the animals longer distances or something.
-> Also regarding the horse, I befriended it enough and now I can't pet him anymore - I just mount him.  Not sure how I can pet him and raise friendship when I automatically mount the horse now? Unless mounting strengthens friendship, then nevermind, but there aren't any hearts to show that.

I also just found out that improving your tools grants you an entirely new tool for some reason, even though it's supposed to be an improvement to your existing one.  So I currently have one basic watering can, one expert watering can, one basic hoe, and one expert hoe in my inventory. Not sure if this is a bug or not but that's something that should be improved upon.  You shouldn't have two/three/four things of the same thing in your inventory when they should be improvements, not brand new ones.

Overall a decent game, but things could be improved upon. I'm only in early summer, so my review could change from now until later.  I'm still having fun with the game, but it is NOT worth the $30 price tag.

((I took out a portion of my review about receiving a quest in late Spring to craft some food that required strawberries, but then I found out that's what the fertilizer is for - it helps grow crops in the season they don't do so well in.))

Pros:
- Has a bubble indicator to note what kind of crop it is if you've grown it before. Very nifty.
- I like the concept of restarting a village, and I like how this was accomplished.
- Pretty straightforward starting out, although there were a few things I was confused on, such as how to get the hammer and how to get material stone.
- The animals and characters are cute HOWEVER they need to work on the clipping issues.  This is visible as a female character and you're running south - the shorts/legs are clipping.
- You don't have to swap tools, which is REALLY nice.  You just point and click on a thing you want to do (till the ground/water a crop/smash a rock/chop a tree) and it does it automatically.
- Harvesting crops is SO NICE, you can click, and drag your mouse over crops that are ready to be harvested and you can pick up a lot of crops doing this.  I just now found this out and I'm in a quarter-way through the summer month.
- You can plant crops and flowers at any time of the year (!!!) HOWEVER you should be using fertilizer every so often to ensure they don't just wither and die.

Cons:
- All of my gripes I mentioned above.
- Not worth the $30 price tag as-is. Seems more like a $15 game.
- There doesn't seem to be any real benefit to planting crops anywhere else besides your farmland, but maybe I'm just not far enough into the game.
- No character customization. I would REALLY love character customization, even something as simple as a new eye or hair colors.
- Fishing seems buggy.  There were quite a few instances where I was definitely mashing my left mouse button and it was NOT going down.  I think it's because my mouse was directly over the square/area where the fish & bobber was? Either way that should NOT be a thing and should be fixed.
- The townsfolk basically stand in one position (sometimes they will walk around depending on where they are) until a certain point of time and then they just DISAPPEAR INTO THIN AIR and appear somewhere else on the map.  This is lazy design, make them walk like normal people. Except the mage, his apprentices, and the Harvest Sprites - those at least make sense.
- Economy honestly seems rather broken.  I believe I reached 100k gold within my first month, if not very early on in summer.  The mining needs tweaked because you can make SO MUCH just by mining alone.  It's where I have made the majority of my money.  The earnings needs toned down by quite a lot, or it should require more ore to create a gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071175937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 12281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3762, 'last_played': 1603499235}
review:
Contrary to what others, who have little to no hours in the game, are saying..this is an amazing game. 
Yes, there is allot of running around and talking to people, taking on certain tasks..but thats been every harvest moon ever!
The first season is SUPER slow, summer is slightly more active and once you wake the Harvest Godess so many festivals open up! The graphics are not amazing, but no harvest moon graphics have been amazing ever! 

I have 43 hours so far and I just now entered Spring 1st of my 2nd year. It has plenty of things to do and so far I made it to level 76 in the mines...no clue how deep it is :o so excited to find out.

Main complaint, it'd be nice to actually be able to push the animals...

author: {'steamid': '76561198024577837', 'num_games_owned': 503, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1511709868}
review:
I've played Harvest Moon games since Harvest Moon 64 and have come to expect better of the Harvest Moon title. 

        Being that they decided to release it on Steam I would have guessed that they could have went all out doing much better than 3DS graphics, but they somehow made the graphics worse than if it were on the 3DS. They have Stardew Valley to compete with on Steam so they should have steped up their game. The mouse and keyboard controls feel as if they were an after thought, feeling like they really tried to focus on touch screen over all else. 

        And when you combine all of this you end up with the mobile feel which from my experience most Steam users aren't interested in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298629834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1591352932}
review:
As skeptical as one might be in purchasing this game after reading so many bad reviews, I did it anyway because I knew [from following and checking up every now and then for the past 3 years] that Natsume had come a long way since the horrendous 'the lost valley' and I wanted to give them a chance and support the company that had localized my favorite game series for such a long time.  
  
After playing for a few hours and reaching the cut-off time for a refund, I decided to continue playing and keep the game. Why? Because I genuinely enjoyed it. Yes, the farming mechanics are simplistic, and yes the art/graphics are pretty barebones, but it has a surprising amount of charm to it. So far the characters actually are showing signs of having some personality [at least on par with MFOMT localization] compared to their previous endeavors as a development company, and while farming is perhaps TOO easy, it's fun and now I can plant and harvest over 85 crops as early as spring 4th! As a veteran HM farmer, that made me pretty happy. 
  
Yes, Stardew Valley, and Story of Seasons are WAY better. But this game is actually fun as well. If you've already played both of those games for over 100+ hours [like I did], and are an old school harvest moon fan, then I think that you'll really enjoy playing this game. It's very carefree and easy, something fun to do for a couple of hours. Also a good game for introducing younger people [or people new to video games in general] to the joys of farming/dating sims.  
  
Now, the only real issue I'm having is that NO, this game is NOT worth thirty dollars. Maybe 15, or even 18. But not thirty. 
If the character portraits were actual ART and not polygons, and if the map were twice as large and the mechanics better, then maybe I could see charging that amount. My recommendation would be to wait until it's on uber sale, and THEN buy it. It's worth having in your library if you like these kind of games, but just not for the listed amount, especially since it's a digital copy, not even physical. [and no manual and artbook either, boo. Natsume please fix this.] 
  
...Now if you'll excuse me, I have a farm to run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212581149', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1394, 'last_played': 1511211022}
review:
Ja was soll ich sagen, dieses Spiel ist wirklich Mega schön! 
Die Leute die Sagen es ist ja nur auf Englisch übertreiben finde ich. 
Mein Englisch ist wirklich nicht sehr gut und ich hab zu 90% ALLES verstanden! :) 
Die Story ist mit so viel Liebe zum Detail gemacht worden (hab die Story ganz durch) und bin mega happy darüber. 
Ich finde die Story und auch die Charakter sehr schön gezeichnet und jeder hat so seine eigene Persönlichkeit. 
Natürlich ist es nicht zu vergleichen wie Harvest Moon Back to Nature, aber ich finde es dennoch wirklich seehr gelungen und für mich ist es kein Fehlkauf! Ich hab in 2 Tagen über 20 Stunden gespielt und bin begeistert ^-^
Manche Dinge sind wieder so wie früher (B-Day auswählen, die Mine...) 
Was ich auch sehr schön finde, dass man Häuser reparieren muss damit neue Leute auf diese Insel kommen. Man hat also auch gleichzeitig eine Herausforderung. Wie es mit dem Heiraten ist weiß ich nocht nicht ganz genau, da ich noch mein Haus Upgraden muss, aber ich hab schon viel gesehen und fast alles repariert. 

Top Spiel! 
Klar freue ich mich aber auch wenn es irgendwann auf Deutsch raus kommt, dennoch ist es ein super Spiel. 

PS: https://www.twitch.tv/videos/201667100  https://www.twitch.tv/videos/202062602 sind meine beiden letzten Streams wo ich es durchgesuchtet habe, für Leute die es sich anschauen wollen, aber es ist ein Livestream gewesen, also hab ich viel mit dem Chat geredet :D Es ist nicht zu vergleichen mit einem Profi Lets Player! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198393353905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1521444410}
review:
I was skeptical because of the bad reviews I saw. It did take me a litle bit to warm up to this game but I'm only 5.4 hours in right now and I absolutely love it. It's all I want to do with my free time. 
Seeing so many bad reviews makes me sad because I think it's really great and would recommend people to try it themselves and form their own opinion. I have a feeling people are just jumping on the bandwagon of "this game sucks" just because. 
Thank you creators of this game I hope you see this! I love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082219377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425, 'last_played': 1510995293}
review: Your not going to like this game if you don't like a lot of story and cutscenes, only want the past harvest moon games, or hate the graphics and can't get over it because it's not changing from the pictures. But you will love this game if you love games with a lot of story (because this is the reason you should play this, really well done!), love farming harvest moon like games and want to give this a chance, and love playing with controller (because i personally think this is the best experience with this game in particular) or like RPG's. I was worried i wasn't going to like this game and it surprised me! It is really good and the story makes it really fun! The only problem that i have with this game is that i doesn't explain anything very well. Like it tells you you can finally have animals and need to get fences but won't tell you how or tells you you need to fish and have no access to a fishing rod. It gets really irritating with all the guessing and as you keep playing you find out you just didn't have any access to those things yet. I just wanted to mention that because has been irritating me a little bit and might be a deal breaker for someone else. The only other thing i want to point out that is that the npc's are not always available when you need them and sometimes you will go days before you can get one to show up back at there house so you can finally complete a side mission. This wasn't as bad, i just wish they were always in the same place for at least a small percent of time to make it easier...But i will also say Stardew Valley is better. and if you are debating between the two get Stardew Valley. This game is a solid 7/10 and would be better bought on a sale but worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198127004705', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1427, 'last_played': 1511254048}
review:
Okay so this is my review for this game (sorry for bad grammar)

• Light of Hope is the latest game in the Natsume series, having a horrendous graphic that nobody want to look at it so theres alway a negative vibe around the game but if you take a look at it, it is actually pretty decent

• LoH plays very much like a traditional HM game, so farming does not have much change, the game have a variety of fertilizers to choose from, there is a tons of crops and they all can mutate, not to mention that the farm you own has a very large size (roughly equivalent to Stardew Valley)

• Activities outside farming such as mining, fishing, ranching and cooking in general are very normal and nothing outstanding. There are no monsters in the Mine, the mine it self look bland and lack any kind of creativity in design, the number of fish species in the game is not much compared to the number of crops In the game, the animals in the game include Chicken, Sheep, Cow, Horse, Dunkey, ... .Crafting does not exist in the game, the material is only for upgrade.

•The most important point to me in a HM game is the character , and have to say that I am very pleased about the character in LoH and this is probably the brightest point of LoH. This game is full of cuties, we have Dean a big redhead who work in the flower shop with his mother and ask me for fertilizer every damn time, Jeanne a lonely girl with a small garden like to spend time in the mountains and Doc a mad scientist who owns a robo dog, theres also 3 magicians in the game (mage, wizard, witch) and alot more cool character, no samesexmarriage btw. Festivals in the game are generally fun, including dog racing, cooking,fishing ... things,the game also have little events in the year like fireworks, gift day, ...

• The visual part of the game is bad, the 3D character model that combined with the 2D background  make the character look like he/she not touching the ground, not to mention the texture is pretty low look like 720p that is stretched. The game supports controller and you can play the game with only mouse, the game also plays well on the window tablet.

• In general LoH is not bad, if you have 30$ in your pocket and already own Stardew Valley then LoH is a game for you to chill the fuck out after a hard day at school or work (Slime Rancher is also fun if you want to relieve stress). 

• An ok and very basic HM game that has nothing special about it, Natsume choose a safe bet this time
*6.8/10*

author: {'steamid': '76561198006366212', 'num_games_owned': 1658, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1642326417}
review:
"The star (Stardew Valley) has more light and hope than this moon... "

As a long-time Harvest Moon player, I do not recommend to get this because you can get better HM games on 3DS, alternatively called "Story of Seasons" or get Stardew Valley instead for better gameplay and more contents...
----------

The main issue I have is that this game overall took major stepdowns than the previous HM games I have familiar with; more things are absent/not presented.. It's hard to suggest people to play this while there are better HM games existed out there on portable console that offers more varieties, extensive gameplay, and customizations (HM: A New Beginning and Story of Seasons).. 

Light of Hope still offers basic core HM gameplay that have been known for the series; from farming, fishing, mining to getting friends and eventually get married, all are there and working like before, but it's so basic that the repetitive nature of the game is way higher than previous HM and there's not much stuff to do to fill the time with different activities like before... In short, LoH feels more like a downgraded version and a major disappointment for the first series entry for the PC...

If PC the only choice of platform to play farming games, Stardew Valley is still the best option overall..

review: I recommend it only so far as it's Harvest Moon (kind of) for PC (arguably).  As a huge fan of original HM, it is incredibly disappointing, it feels incomplete with terrible graphics and annoying controls.  I almost quit halfway through the first Spring because while there were still new crops to grow, I felt like there was really nothing new to discover about the game by playing more.  But I'm still going to keep playing because I'm just so addicted to raising chickens that like being thrown around.  Stardew Valley is in every single way better though.

review: In all honesty i never played a harvest moon game for the story, i just liked how it felt to grow and sell crops, do quests, and pretty much do whatever i want. it actually somewhat reminds me of the lost valley, but better (i never liked the sandbox world mechanic that that game used, too confusing as to how high certain crops had to grow to mutate) the controls were a little wierd to get used to for the pc, and i did get stuck quite a few times during the story line (right now i gathered wool, flowers, and fish, but for some reason haven't progressed further.) however again, i rarely play a harvest moon game for the story itself. it's a great relaxing game series to play when i get stressed and need to relax. Of course it is new so i kind of expect there to be some problems. but i do recommend for those who just want a farming game (although you will have to repair somethings for npc's to start coming).

author: {'steamid': '76561198024689294', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 5061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 935, 'last_played': 1513465005}
review:
My favorite genre is definitely farming sims. I've played all but the last two HM, SoS, Stardew, all Rune Factory and even realistic sims like Farming Sim and Historical Farming. I've played great games and downright awful games.
I was on the fench about buying this one, especially with the deluge of negative reviews right away, but decided to go for it anyway. I'm glad I did.
I'll say right away that it looks, plays and costs like a 3ds game. For me that's fine, but if that's not ok with you than be warned. Some details:

Story
It's light hearted, true to form HM fare. There's a struggling town in the middle of nowhere and you are tasked to revive it. It's not deep, but it's fun enough.

Characters
The characters are interesting and I feel like I want to know more about them. This for me sets HM/SoS/Rune Factory apart from other farm sims. These games put as much focus on the community as they do the farming and they do it well. This game is no exception.

Farming
Farming/Ranching is well-rounded with the added bonus of mutations. I've not been able to mess with the system much, but it seems like it will add a lot of experimentation and discovery to the typical farming formula. It also adds a lot more crops and products to the list. The mutation system was actually the selling point that finally made me buy the game. 
I will add that the expansion of your farm is directly linked to the expansion of the town. You can't ignore the town repairs.

Graphics
Again, it wholly reminds me of a 3ds game. They're clear, colorful and to me they're charming. Graphics have never been a make or break for me either way.

I make a point to review every game on its own merit and overall this game is just plain fun. Plus, it's exciting to repair the town bit by bit and find new mutations. If the price bothers you wait until a sale comes along, but for me it's worth the price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305377458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2369, 'last_played': 1669328957}
review:
ONLY IF YOU FRIGGIN LOVE FARMING GAMES

Is it worth the price? Eh.

There is more content than I thought at first, I am moving through the main storyline pretty quickly, but there is a TON of stuff to unlock. but I don't think the replayability is there like it is in SDV. especially since you can't skip scenes. 

Everyone is complaining about the graphics but they remind me of Another Wonderful LIfe on the GameCube. Just more yellow. I genuinely prefer the graphics to stardew valley, but at least SDV allows mods. 

Characters are pretty cute and have some lol dialogue, made me wish there were more. 

You have a gratuitous amount of land available to use, I wish there was more I could do with it than just plant crops. as far as I know I can make a couple fence types and upgrade my house. I would like to be able to create pathways and ranch more animals. I was excited by the character Doc the Architect, the name made me think we could make some cool things. :(

Its stupid easy to make money. Like it almost feels like cheating its too easy. 

p.s. the donkey sleeping might be the cutest thing I have ever seen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144932126', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1514976853}
review:
Fangen wir erstmal mit dem positiven an. Die Story und Spielmusik ist echt nett. Man erkennt sofort das es ein Harvest Moon ist. Das Gameplay ist auch soweit in ordnung. Aber...

Die Grafik kommt einen lieblos dahin geklatscht vor, als wollte man auf Teufel komm raus unbedingt ein neues Spiel machen, egal wie. 
Die Animationen sind recht dürftig.
Die Characktere haben keinen richtigen Tagesablauf. Zwar findet man immer an bestimmten tagen zu bestimmten Uhrzeiten eine Person an einem bestimmten Ort. Eine kleine Routine ist drin, aber kommt man eine Minute zu Spät verpufft der Charakter und ist am nächsten Ort der Routine.
Schon nach kurzer Zeit erreicht man etwas, wofür man bei anderen Teilen, zb Tierparade länger brauchte und das "Wow, ich hab es geschafft. Yeay" Freudegefühl bleibt irgendwie aus.
Von den Spielen, die ich selbst von der Harvest Moon Reihe gespielt habe ist dies nicht gerade das beste. Für mich gar das schlechteste. Ich habe bei dem Namen und dem Spielehersteller etwas besseres erwartet. Die 30 Euro kann man lieber in ein anderes Game investieren was liebevoller gestaltet ist, zb. Die ehemaligen Teile für die Wii, für den DS oder Stardew Valley auf dem PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083331024', 'num_games_owned': 1452, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1224, 'last_played': 1556682411}
review: This game does a lot and does so little... Why do I like it then?! Well I actually liked Seeds of Memories on IOS and Android and felt that it was a logical choice for the series due to mis steps in Lost Valley and Skytree Village. A partial return to the series roots. Partial being the MAIN word here. I just wish we could get a new cast of characters already with these characters and DLC from the 3DS games being present. If you want something deep Stardew Valley is half the price or heck Harvest Moon: Friends of Mineral Town is on the Wii-U virtual console go check those out. But for those most curious I reccomend this because Harvest Moon's addicting nature is still present in this game too. This game is almost A Light of Hope!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054262228', 'num_games_owned': 881, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1510884728}
review:
People seem to use the term "port" very liberally. Let's make it clear that this is NOT a port. It does however use the base engine developed for the mobile game, Seeds of Memory as well as most of its art assets. But it uses the characters from The Lost Valley and Skytree Village, along with a brand new story.

A port would be a complete copy of the mobile game, adapted to PC with no changes to the art, story and characters.

Does it feel like a complete and complex Harvest Moon title? No.  It is worth the buy? Yes, but only once the pice drops (Steam sales, anyone?)

It is, per se, a very simplified Harvest Moon experience. If you expect and want the complete experience, play Story of Seasons.

In itself, it's still very enjoyable. There are some pro and cons, however:

PROS
- Greatly enhanced rucksack system. Honestly, I'm surprised no one though of that earlier. No more tool swapping all the time. And THAT feels super great.
- Laid back atmosphere.
- Straightforward story.
- Most (but not all) of the hand-drawn style backgrounds look rather good.
- No more awkward minecraft-esque world building.

CONS
- Complete re-use of characters from other games. Honestly, why go through the trouble of creating a new story only to re-use past characters?
- At the beginning of the game it's hard to completely fill an entire day. I often use out all my energy and need to go to bed at 11am.
- As much as the hand-drawn style of most art assets is pretty, there are also huge problems with the look of some items. Most notably proportion-wise.
- The 3D characters look out of place.
- I hear the keyboard controls are so-so. I'm ready to believe that and list it as a con, even though I've been using a controller (PS3 controller emulating an Xbox controller) and saw no issues.
- Sometimes the story feels too simple and pretty bland. It feels like an alpha build or an incomplete game at times.

More to come as I keep playing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198264308464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1697652209}
review: Before I bought the game, I read some of the reviews. Almost all of the review were poor, but being the Harvest Moon fan that I am, I decided to try the game anyways. I am so glad that I made that decision. So far, the game is great. This game is sort of a mix between Seeds of Memories and Skytree Village. The characters are endearing and show great personality. I would definitely recommend getting this game if you are interested in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198429853764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1548369280}
review:
Compaired to the last Harvest Moon this is a lot better. I never got married in the last one because the elevation thing killed the game for me. I like Story of Seasons more than this but I think Harvest Moon is heading in the right direction. 

There is a lot of story early on so be prepaired for a lot cut scenes. I don't know what people mean by the tuturial is to long. Other than the 5 minute crash course, of how to take care of your field there isn't any other tutorial. 

I love the magic users. Their animation is great and they have purpose. The map is way to big but there is enough time in the day to hike from one end to the other while still getting stuff done. The crops vary depending on what soil they are planted. Hint: Fix Cryl's house early on. Fishing is a great source of income. 

I have a lot more to understand and experience but so far I would recommend this game, especially for 26 dollars. I don't see me paying 60 dollars for the switch version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050433002', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 2174, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1706635512}
review:
Finally, an official Harvest Moon game for PC! About frickin' time!

Not wanting to go all fan-boyish on the game, but will say the wife and I own just about every Harvest Moon game released in the US, and have drawers and a closet of old consoles and hand-helds, many of which were bought just to play HM games.

This one in particular is no better or worse than many of the others and it does have a unique charm in that it's the 20th anniversary themed game so does go back to the roots of the genre in being more focused on the farming, socializing, and town building aspects of its earliest predecessors.

It also has cameo appearances from NPC's of earlier titles as well. As well as a storyline focusing back on reviving the Harvest Goddess.

So for us, this game has a lot of charm, and thankfully, a reaffirmation of what Harvest Moon games are all about - farming, socializing, a touching storyline about rebirth and renewal with a cast of loveable NPC's that really make you feel welcome in a game you feel like calling home.

It's a love letter to all the Harvest Moon games in the past, and as such is a welcome, appreciated, and recommended Harvest Moon game for all of its fans.

If the game sucked, I would say so, but in our long years of playing Harvest Moon games, this one definitely doesn't. Is it the best Harvest Moon game? No. But it's also not nearly in the bottom either.

Beyond being a homage to the series, it's a solid, enjoyable addition to the series in its own right. And one that returns to what Harvest Moon is all about.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078727447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1219, 'last_played': 1517369759}
review:
I am REALLY loving this game, though, I went in expecting absolute dirt. I'm playing on PC with an xbox controller and the movements are very fluid and super easy to direct. I'm on Summer 11th and I've played about 13 hours. I've fixed all of the villagers homes and I think I'm on the last leg of the story (maybe) because I need to upgrade my hammer to get mithril, which I can't get until fall. Even though they're reusing previous characters, I'm really not minding them at all. Plus, I really love Edmond. I was really stoked when I heard he was in this game.

I am really missing character customization as well. I don't know if the clothing requests work the same in this one as SV, my sheep is still a baby and the first request asks for two wool. The house upgrade asks for a lot of dough and mats, but it gives me something to look forward to working towards. 

There's still three or four sections of the map that I still haven't unlocked and I am happy with the pace of the game and how much I'm accomplishing/still have to accomplish. I got this game for $26 since it was discounted when I bought it from steam (weird for a newly released game, I think). I think that this was more than worth the money since I can already tell I'm going to spend at least quadruple that on this game.

It looks like crop mutations work similarly as stated above, just with stuff being out of season being fragile. This is also the first game where I'm making my own feed and fertilizer, I think it's much better this time around--I always thought it was too much of a hassle. I think the materials are just easier to obtain, I donno. Fishing is fun as well, regular bait can be bought at the getgo from sam for really cheap. With crafty saving, I was able to win my first fishing contest. :p

Mining is also awesome. I was skeptical as well with not being able to save but now that I have started mining with an updated hoe, it is so much easier to farm for ores. You also get fish recipes right after building bastions home, so replenishing hearts isn't a problem either as long as you have a good stock of fish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326207772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1959, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1635, 'last_played': 1511021273}
review:
เคยเล่น harvest moon มาหลายภาค ได้ยินคำวิจารณ์ด้านลบมาเยอะเหลือเกินเกี่ยวกับกราฟฟิคของเกมนี้
แต่บอกเลยว่าพอได้เล่นแล้วก็ติดสุดๆ พอซื้อเสร็จ นี่เล่นมา10ชั่วโมงละ
ถ้าคุณไม่ยึดติดกับภาคเก่าเกินไป มันก็ไม่ได้แย่ขนาดนั้น
ตอนนี้ในเกมเล่นเข้าหน้าร้อนแล้ว ตอนเริ่มเกมต้องค่อยๆซ่อมเมือง เปลืองตังมาก
มันจะมีแมพที่ยังไม่เปิดตอนเล่นเกมหลายอย่าง ต้องค่อยๆ unlock แมพ (มีแมพที่เหมือนจะเป็นดันเจี้ยนด้วย แต่ไม่แน่ใจเด้อ)
ตอนนี้ยังงมการตกปลาไม่ได้ ยังตกปลาไม่เป็น ใครมีคำแนะนำบ้างคะ

การปลูกพืช มีดอกไม้และผัก และผลไม้ยืนต้น คล้ายๆ stardew 
บางชนิดปลูกได้หลายฤดู มีที่ปลูกฤดูหนาวได้ด้วย แต่ที่แปลกกว่าที่เคยเจอมา คือต้องดูว่ามันชอบดินแบบไหน
มีดิน 4 แบบ บางชนิดปลูกได้ทุกดิน บางชนิดขึ้นได้ที่ดินแบบเดียว 
ตอนเริ่มแรกๆจะปลดล็อคได้ดิน 3 แบบ ไม่รู้ว่าดินอีกแบบอยู่ตรงไหน คงต้องรอเปิดแมพอื่น

วิธีหาตังค์เยอะๆ คือเข้าเหมือง เอา ore ไปทำเป็นแท่งที่ blacksmith แล้วขายได้ตังดีมาก
ถ้าขยันเข้าเหมือนรวยแน่

เวลาอัพเกรดเครื่องมือ ไม่ได้ใช้แค่แร่อย่างเดียว ใช้ดอกไม้ด้วย(กุงง) ฉะนั้นต้องปลูกดอกไม้เผื่อเอามาอัพเกรดของ
แล้วดอกไม้บางอย่างก็ต้องรอจนหน้าของมันถึงจะปลูกได้ ต้องวางแผนดีๆ

สัตว์มี ไก่ วัว แกะ กับอะไรสักอย่างนี่แหละ ลืมอ่านดีๆ แต่แพงสุดเลย
มีหมาให้ซื้อราคา 8000G มีแมวอยู่บนเขาอันนี้ยังไม่รู้ว่าทำไรได้ แต่ไปเล่นกับมันทุกวันจะมีหัวใจขึ้น คิดว่าอนาคตอาจจะเอามาเลี้ยงได้

มีคนแปลกๆ เป็นนักวิทยาศาสตร์สติเฟื่องมาด้วย
มีพ่อมด คอยชี้ทางเวลาไม่รู้จะทำอะไร และ นักพยากรณ์ แต่ยังไม่รู้ว่ามันทำไรได้ นอกจากบอกว่าใครไม่ชอบอะไร

ไม่มีปฏิทินให้ดู ไม่รู้ว่างานเทศการณ์มีตอนไหน ยังไม่เคยเจอ อาจจะเพราะยังซ่อมเมืองไม่เสร็จ
บางตึกต้องใช้ปลาในการซ่อมแซมด้วย เลยต้องรอจนตกปลาได้ก่อน ซึ่งตอนนี้ได้เบ็ดมาแล้วแต่ยังตกไม่เป็น

สรุปรวมๆ สนุกดี เล่นเรื่อยๆ มีไรให้ทำ แต่ยังงงๆบางอย่าง ต้องซ่อมๆไปเรื่อยๆ
ตอนนี้คิดไรไม่ออกละ ต้องไปเล่นเอง ใครเป็นแฟนเกมแนวนี้ก็ซื้อมาเก็บๆไว้ ราคาไม่แพง แล้วมันไม่ได้แย่ขนาดนั้น

author: {'steamid': '76561198160356888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1528346666}
review: I will admit the graphics on this game are subpar, to say the least. The gameplay mechanics are simplistic. There is hardly any tutorial or walkthrough on how to do things (Helpful Hint: Use the bookshelf in your house to look up how to do things). And yet I am terribly fond of this game. The characters and story are charming, the gameplay is easy and adaptable, and everything is pretty straightforward. This game is not a cutting edge take on diverse technology or a harrowing fast-paced action-packed grindfest. It's a casual and fun farming simulator that most people play to unwind and have fun. There are completionist achievments and depending on how you play will impact the difficulty but overall it's accessible to everyone. This game fits well into the Harvest Moon formula and does evoke some nostalgia for its predecessors while still bringing new elements to the table. If you've played and Harvest Moon, Story of Seasons, or Stardew Valley then you've pretty much got the gist of the game. It's not supposed to be challenging to the point of ripping your hair out but instead a relaxing and enjoyable escape.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059763100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1696003477}
review:
O jogo possui uma jogabilidade gostosa e simples, um gráfico simples e minimalista, uma história parecida com a de outros jogos da franquia mas com uma mecânica nova e uma sensação de nostalgia e diversão deliciosas.
Mesmo o preço parecendo caro, acho que o jogo vale a horas de diversão que vicê terá.
Não espero um BTN ou um HM inovador; espere um jogo que via te lembrar os antigos e, ao mesmo tempo, te mostrar coisas novas.
Concordo que não é o melhor HM de todos, mas é um dos que mais me chamou atenção e me deram vontade de jogar.
Caso eu mude de opinião ao longo do jogo eu atualizo minha avaliação.
E caso queiram ver como é o jogo antes de comprar, passem no meu canal: https://www.youtube.com/playinplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198025227359', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1614712084}
review:
Getting started to give you an idea: https://youtu.be/AAUCkd50c3c

I'm not going to lie - I debated long and hard on whether or not to recommend this game or not.  Even in the video I made for it I was leaning heavily towards not recommending it.  But after considering it, I realized it had something that kept me interested - charm.  While the game might look like some sort of cheap mobile knockoff, be kind of goofy at times, and generally not seem too appealing, it still captures the overall spirit of Harvest Moon and carries that charm with it.  

Don't get me wrong - it has it's downsides.  The biggest being the price.  When you have the farming gem Stardew Valley at $15 and it being such an amazing game - you should be priced more competitively.  Yes, Harvest Moon is the original.  Yes, it set the standard for the farming/RPG genres.  But this is the first foray into the PC market and you have an amazing game to compete against... so compete!

Graphically the game just doesn't look impressive.  It's more reminiscent of a flash game. It's trying to aim for that retro look while also going for modern and it just looks... not great.  Also a lot of sections that simply look like standard mobile icons in pretty much every mobile game ever (the big, bubbly boxes for example).  

The natural keybindings for the game are frustrating.  More frustrating is that it took a minute to actually find the options and make changes to it (or to even exit the game).  

There are a few quality of life changes that I did enjoy.  The main one probably being that you can just click on something and your character will automatically interact with it properly - water it, cut it down, harvest it, etc.  This is really nice for those of us who have the tendency to forget to switch tools and accidentally cut down our hard work.  Though I guess for some it might be "easy mode."  

In conclusion I think Natsume has kind of dropped the ball on this game in a lot of ways - pricing, looks, control, etc.  But through it all they managed to keep that spirit alive and somehow make it fun - even alongside titans like Stardew Valley, Rune Factory, etc.  But I will say if you're on the fence about the whole farming RPG games - avoid this one. It costs entirely too much and you can spend half of this and get something that's definitely great.  But if you're an old school fan and just enjoy this genre as a whole, then it may be worth considering.

author: {'steamid': '76561198300344215', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1695596556}
review:
My review is going be base off there 2 other self made tlites. 
 
Graphic: Compare to how horrible Lost Valley was it was improvement, But i feel like Skytree had better Graphic then Light of Hope did. So i giving (Graphic 6/10 Rating.)

Controls: I played on Gamepad. Could be little more smoother i got stuck sometimes. or while trying to pluck weeds wasted enegry by using the hoe instead. I did like that i didn't have to go menu to change tool/items.
(Controls 7/10 Rating)

Gameplay: Lot more fun then Lost Valley, About the same as Skytree. Quest could be more organize by what has been unlock. Example: Nova want bread. (No clue how to get bread why? Because i didn't know you had to unlock resturant to cook nobody in game explain that.) Plant grow to fast and are to easy to get seeds. (Gameplay 7/10)

Story: Better story then Lost Valley. Not as good as Skytree. The story felt rushed and little to fast. You shouldn't be handed main part of story right off the bat. Nor middle part of the story right after. It should be a challage and explain what your goal is to aim for. ( I talking about Tablets). (Story 5/10 Rating)

Overall Review: This game is not bad or good. It inbetween they aim it towards younger kids and little towards the older fans. I'm a HM Vet. I wish they kept Skytree graphic but i can understand them trying out a different approach as they grow. The game is little to easy because of it aiming towards Kids. Wish they up challage because kids are smarter these days and don't need it dull down.

Ending Note: To everyone giving this a negtive review least play this  more then 2-4 mins.  If you're going to review this you need to compare it to there other self made games not there past localization. Because Natsume didn't make any of Harvest Moon games in past. They only translated it. Lost Valley-Skytree-Seeds of Memory-Light of Hope. Are in studio made game. So you need to review base from Lost-seed of memory.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965597692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1469, 'last_played': 1510967431}
review:
I'm fairly certain this is the first review I've ever written on steam, and it comes on the precipice of a 16 hour stream, so It should excell in neither format nor execution.


Having put a -fair- amount of time into the game after release, I'd like to say that this is by far one of my favorite HM games. I've played most of the games throughout the entire series and it's art style hearkens back to the oldschool games, while maintaining a modern feel through 3D sprites.

I plan on putting a lot more time into the game, but at this point, I've gotten every ounce of my money's worth.

If you're a fan of the series, I highly suggest you check it out. It's filled me with nostaglic joy from the Titlescreen and onward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079533959', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1510707905}
review:
It's ugly beyond believe. It's overpriced. The gameplay is so basic and watered down, even my hamster should be able to play it.. And it's a god damn MOBILE GAME. Heck, it even says "Tab here" on the title screen and you can control your character by dragging. But hey, who would pay 30 bucks for a mobile game? So let's release it on pc instead! What could possibly go wrong? (Bubsy reference: check!).

I really tried to overlook all of it's flaws, I wanted to think: "Oh hey, it's not that bad after all!", but that's all it is. It is just.. bad. A really really bad cashgrab. I'm SO happy I was able to refund it, because it's not worth it's money at all and my head hurts because of some of it's ear piercing sound effects. -.-

Please, don't buy this. DO NOT support lazy game development. Buy Stardew Valley instead. Or buy one of the "Story of season" games, because those games are made by the real developers of the old Harvest Moon games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198114313703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1523980140}
review:
Hmm, don't get me wrong. I bought the game merely because it's Harvest Moon (Yeah I know the good ol' HM we ever knew is never the same any more since their parting with Marvelous). Come on, seriously how many game designers are in the company anyway? The story so far is rather uncompelling with idk lots of 'loopholes', I mean in just 2 days time, I've grown over 100 cabbages easily, the heck ?!

Seriously Natsume you need to step up your pace and live up to your name that most people have always come to know of , or else this franchise will slowly end up rolling down the drain.

I've made my purchase, and hopefully you guys would be making profits and continuosly improving especially over those unattractive, lazy-looking graphics. Would've not hurt too to consider some realism into the game as well (i.e the awkward dialogues, mechanism etc...)

How I wish Story of Seasons too will loosen up a bit and make their debut on PC...

author: {'steamid': '76561197998550103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 6013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5584, 'last_played': 1550224580}
review:
I like it, overall. I wish that they would have used different characters rather than copying every character completely from Skytree, but otherwise it is ok. 

There is some boring grindy parts, and the tutorial takes FOREVER. And if you don't pay attention to dialog, you can get stuck in a spot for hours.

I am excited about the crop mutations and figuring those out, and I like the fact that you can go back to the mine in increments of 6 (6, 11...) so you don't have to start at 1 every time. 

It is a tad bit hard to get your items upgraded, though, and getting your house upgraded is REALLY tough.

Overall, feels like a HM game.

Edit: May 29, 2018:

The gameplay lasts about 20 hours. I finished Fall Y1, and even then I could have ended earlier due to a misstyped quest request.

Now, it is boring. Has been for months. There is nothing left to do except the same old grind day in and day out. I could have spent 3x the price on my switch and gotten DLC and multiplayer, but us poor PC players just the shaft and no DLC. SO disappointed

author: {'steamid': '76561198060165392', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2079, 'last_played': 1533334838}
review:
I was really excited to hear there was a PC version of Harvest Moon coming out, so I bought it immediately. Although it seemed somewhat pricey, I don't really regret spending the money on it. While I do wish they would have followed more like Animal Parade's style as far as graphics go, it's still cute and the gameplay is as expected. I am enjoying it, despite all of the negative comments that seem to be circulating around.

Some downsides to note:
- Aboslutely zero character customization. This feels like a giant leap backwards because A New Beginning let us customize our characters, and that was so well received that it should have set the standard for futures game. The complete lack of character customization was and is a huge turn off for me personally.
- Very little to 'forage'. You start in the spring and there are 3 things you can forage (every few days, not daily) 2 types of flowers and bamboo shoots. 
- If you're not paying attention, you can accidentally buy crops that are not in season at the time of purchase. Once planted they'll die unless fertalized. I made this mistake only once before I realized, so granted it's an easy thing to learn not to do but still frustrating for the first time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989177019', 'num_games_owned': 1031, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1510687245}
review: From what I have played so far, this Harvest Moon seems pretty good with a good interesting story to guide what you are doing with a good sense of progression. After you end up on this mostly abandoned island after a storm, you work with the few people you find to start rebuilding the town along with the nature sprites that you slowly revive through various activities like planting and fixing the mine, etc. The game has a goofy sense of humor which has kept me laughing with funny dialogue and characters. While the artwork may not be for everyone, I found it totally fine for the most part with only a couple things looking a little off such as the mountain edge cliff and the water backdrop behind it. The animals and characters are well done with their expressions and the animals are really cute. The expressions are especially silly such as everyone's extremely alarmed look when they find out you were the one to repair their homes and shops. Your character's running animation is also a tad goofy as well but it's serviceable and after a while you don't notice as much and get used to it. The game also has some helpful innovations like a little thought bubble that tells you how your crop is doing and if it needs water, etc. Also there are some great streamlined features such as not needing to switch tools to do different activities. The game knows automatically what you are wanting to do given the current context and does it. I'm also super excited to finally get the so-called "candy" animals such as the cow that produces chocolate milk and the cotton candy sheep. Overall, it's proving to be a fun way to spend your time especially if you like these style of games. If the game looks even a little interesting, I'd recommend giving it a try and if you don't end up liking it by the 2 hour mark, just return it and get something else.

review:

While textures can be a lot better (looks like stretched 720p) and really needs a Vsync option, had not a single trouble binding the few keys that the game needs, controller works fine, also, I cant believe some ppl has FPS troubles... my toaster (FX 8350 + R9 270x) runs this at 160 - 210+ fps

author: {'steamid': '76561198106166561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1521011872}
review: I know this is an unpopular opinion as i have looked at other reviews of this game but i'm enjoying the game, i do agree with a majority of the points but I am moderately enjoying myself. Of course it's not like the previous games, nor does it compare, there are aspects of it that people will love and hate. What i'm liking from this game is the story as it is intriguing and also the new land layout, seems to be quite a bit to explore. Now as with the things i like in this game there are ofcourse things i could do without, or in my case do with more of, and that's guidance on how to proceed in the game, there is no clear path on when things should be done, or what is accessable at the present moment. I'm not going to hate on the fact that it's 2D or that the graphics aren't what they should be in a game made in 2017, it's clear this game is different. It has it's own personality and is not going to float everyones boat. My boat is hanging in there and i'm gonna see it through. I recommend that people try it and play it through and experience it for themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219241367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 984, 'last_played': 1515784807}
review:
Was waiting for this game since they had made the announcement and to be honest, some of the previews had me a bit worried considering it looked very 2D and lower quality for something that would be run on a PC.
However, being as that I've grown up with Harvest Moon since the SNES, I decided to give it a run anyway.
And I'm not dissapointed. It very much has the spirit and feel of the older games that I fell in love with time and time again.

Pros:
Frame rate is fine
Not having to switch tools for all actions comes in handy
Controller works just fine (Using a Logitech Controller from Best Buy)
Villagers have many cute emotes during conversations, making it engaging

Cons:
Not really sure when festivals happen, there doesn't seem to be a calendar.
Takes a while to really get started and it's hard to find all the tools. (I've found all of them and now the game is fine.)
Is it worth $30, no. Maybe $15

Other than that, I am very much enjoying my playthrough of HMLOH.
I really reccomend this game to those who are true HM fans. Nice change of pace from Stardew Valley.
If anyone needs help on tools, I can assist! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198005761573', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 3444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1891, 'last_played': 1512051471}
review:
Buen juego como todos los harvest moon, excelente jugabilidad con el mouse y teclado, me corre sin problemas y el juego es sencillo de entender

Positivo- 
*cambio de herramientas automatico un genio al que se le ocurrio esto

*No matrimonios homosexuales, puedes hablar con personajes de tu mismo genero sin temor de que salgan conversaciones gay

Negativo
